materials: RED HEART® "LusterSheen®": 1 Skein each of colors required: see individual patterns.
For Each Trim: One 1/2" diameter flat white button for attaching to Crocs™; small amount of stuffing material; yarn needle.
abbreviations: Dec = draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook – 1 stitch decreased.

beg = beginning; ch = chain; dec = decrease; hdc = half double crochet; lp = loop; mm = millimeters; rem = remaining; rep = repeat; rnd = round; sc = single crochet; sl = slip; st(s) = stitch (es); tog = together; * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated; [] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Trims measure approximately 1" to 1½" across.
gauge: 7 sts = 1"; 6 rnds = 1" in sc rnds.
instructions:
NOTES FOR ALL TRIMS: 
• Most pieces are worked in continuous rounds without joining unless otherwise specified. 
• Always leave a long end of yarn for sewing when you fasten off. 
• You can always embroider eyes instead of using beads or buttons if you prefer. 
• Sew the small flat white button to the wrong side of the finished trim. 

SUN 
LusterSheen® Colors: 0227 Buttercup, 0002 Black and 0915 Cherry Red. 
Additional Materials: 2 Black 1/2" buttons. 

Directions: With Buttercup, ch 2. 
Rnd 1: 6 Sc in 2nd ch from hook. 
Rnd 2: 2 Sc in each sc around – 12 sc. 
Rnd 3: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 4 times – 16 sc. 
Rnd 4: Sc in each sc around. 
Rnd 5: Sc in back lps of each sc around. 
Rnd 6: [Dec] 8 times – 8 sc. Fasten off. Stuff lightly. Draw remaining sts together. 

Rays: Attach Buttercup in any remaining front loop of Rnd 4; * ch 3, sc in 2nd ch from hook, hdc in next ch, skip next loop, slip st in next loop; repeat from * around. Fasten off. 

Finishing: Embroider Cherry Red smile. Sew black buttons in place for sunglasses. Embroider Black straight sts for center and sides of sunglasses. 

OCTOPUS 
LusterSheen® Colors: 0995 Ocean and 0002 Black. 
Additional Materials: 2 Tiny purple buttons for eyes. 

Directions: With Ocean, ch 2. 
Rnd 1: 6 Sc in 2nd ch from hook. 
Rnd 2: 2 Sc in each sc around – 12 sc. 
Rnd 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times – 18 sc. 
Rnd 4: Sc in each sc around. 
Rnd 5: [Sc in next sc, dec] 6 times – 12 sc. Stuff lightly. 
Rnd 6: [Dec] 6 times – 6 sc. Fasten off. Draw remaining sts together. 

Tentacles (Make 8): With Ocean, ch 6; sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across. Fasten off. 

Finishing: Sew tentacles in place around Rnd 5. Sew eyes in place. Embroider smile with Black. 

FISH 
LusterSheen® Colors: 0300 Serenity and 0002 Black. 
Additional Materials: 1 Tiny black bead for eye. 

Directions: With Serenity, ch 2. 
Rnd 1: 6 Sc in 2nd ch from hook. 
Rnd 2: 2 Sc in each sc around – 12 sc. 
Rnds 3-7: Sc in each sc around. Stuff lightly. 
Rnd 8: [Dec] 6 times; turn – 6 sc. 
Row 9: Holding Rnd 8 flat and working through both thicknesses, sc in 3 sc; turn. 
Row 10: Ch 2, (hdc, sc) all in first sc, slip st in next sc, (sc, hdc, sl st) all in last sc. Fasten off. 

Fin: With Serenity, ch 4; sc in 3rd ch from hook, slip st in last ch. Fasten off. 

Finishing: Sew fin in place. Embroider smile with Black. Sew bead in place for eye. 

LADYBUG 
LusterSheen® Colors: 0913 Warm Red and # 0002 Black. 

Directions-Body: With Warm Red, ch 2. 
Rnd 1: 6 Sc in 2nd ch from hook. 
Rnd 2: 2 Sc in each sc around – 12 sc. 
Rnd 3: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 3 times – 15 sc. 
Rnd 4: Sc in each sc around. 
Rnd 5: Sc in back loops of each sc around. Stuff lightly. 
Rnd 6: [Dec] 7 times, sc in next sc – 8 sc. Fasten off. Draw remaining sts together. 

Head: With Black, ch 2. 
Rnd 1: 6 Sc in 2nd ch from hook. 
Rnds 2 and 3: Sc in each sc around. Fasten off. 

Finishing: Sew head in place. Embroider Black French knot spots and a long st up center of back. 

FLOWER 
LusterSheen® Colors: 0227 Buttercup and 0735 Hot Pink. 

Directions: With Buttercup, ch 2. 
Rnd 1: 6 Sc in 2nd ch from hook. 
Rnd 2: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 3 times – 9 sc. 
Rnd 3: Sc in back loops of each sc around. 
Rnd 4: [Dec, sc in next sc] 3 times – 6 sc. Stuff lightly. Fasten off. Draw remaining sts together. 

Petals-Rnd 1: Attach Hot Pink in any remaining front loop of Rnd 2 with a sc; sc again in same loop, [2 sc in next loop] 8 times – 18 sc. 
Rnd 2: [Slip st in next 2 sc, 3 hdc in next sc] 6 times; join with a slip st in first slip st. Fasten off. 

BEE 
LusterSheen® Colors: 0007 Vanilla, 0002 Black and 0227 Buttercup. 
Additional Materials: 2 Tiny blue beads for eyes. 

Directions-Body: With Buttercup, ch 2. 
Rnd 1: 6 Sc in 2nd ch from hook. 
Rnd 2: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 3 times – 9 sc. 
Rnds 3 and 4: Sc in each sc around. 
Rnd 5: [Sc in next sc, dec] 3 times – 6 sc. Stuff lightly. Fasten off. Draw remaining sts together. 

Head: With Black, ch 2. 
Rnd 1: 6 Sc in 2nd ch from hook. 
Rnd 2: Sc in each sc around. Fasten off.  

Wings: With Vanilla, [ch 7, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 5 ch; join with a slip st in first sc] twice. Fasten off. 

Finishing: With Black, embroider back st around body between Rnds 3 and 4. Sew head in place. Sew eyes and wings in place. Tie a small strand of Black to top of head for feelers; trim.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: (1, 1, 2, 2, 2) skeins each 334 Buff A, 330 Linen B and 1 skein 320 Cornmeal C.
1 yard ribbon-1½” wide, 4 gold metal D rings-1½”, stitch markers, yarn needle.
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
measurements: Corset Belt measures 6” wide x 20 (23½, 27½, 32, 36, 40)” long, excluding ribbon lacing.
gauge: 13 sts = 4”; 7 rows = 4” using 1 strand of A and B held together. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Belt
Center Panel
Holding 1 strand of A and B held together, ch 21.
Row 1: Dc in 3rd ch from hook and in each ch across – 19 dc.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), turn, dc in each dc – 19 dc.
Repeat Row 2 until 18 (20, 22, 26, 28, 32) rows have been worked.
Fasten off.
Side Panels (Make 2)
Holding 1 strand of A and B held together, ch 18 (22, 26, 30, 34, 38).
Row 1: Dc in 3rd ch from hook, dc in each ch across, turn – 16 (20, 24, 28, 32, 36) dc.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), turn, dc in each dc – 16 (20, 24, 28, 32, 36) dc.
Repeat Row 2 until 11 rows have been worked.
Row 12: Ch 2 (counts as hdc here and throughout), turn, hdc in each dc across.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
With wrong side facing, position one side edge of one Side Panel along first row of Center Panel. Position side edge of second Side Panel along last row of Center Panel. Whipstitch pieces together.
Holding 2 strands of C together, work 3 large cross-stitches over seams on right side.
Lacing Trim
Row 1 (Right Side): With right side facing and 1 strand of A and C held together, skip 1” along opposite side edge of one Side Panel and join yarn in side edge, ch 3, dc 12 sts evenly spaced along edge, leaving last 1” unworked – 13 dc.
Row 2: Ch 3, turn, dc in each dc across.
Fasten off.
Repeat along side edge of opposite Side Panel.
Edging
Round 1: With right side facing and holding 1 strand of B and C together, join yarn in any st along long edge, ch 1, sc evenly spaced around all edges of Belt, working 2 sc in each corner, to first st, slip st in first st to join.
Position 2 D rings evenly spaced on each Lacing Trim, opposite each other, and using C, sew on securely.
Weave in ends.
Lace ribbon through D rings to close Belt and tie ends into a bow.

materials: RED HEART® Soft Baby Steps®: 1 ball 9702 Strawberry
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Bun cover measures 9” circumference x 3¾” long (23 x 9.5 cm)
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
BUN COVER
Ch 2.
Round 1 (right side): Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc. Do not join.
Round 2: (Ch 4, slip st) in each sc around; join with slip st in first ch of beginning ch—6 ch-4 spaces.
Round 3: Slip st in first ch-4 space (ch 5, slip st) in each ch-4 space around, ch 5; join with slip st in first slip st—6 ch-5 spaces.
Round 4: (Slip st, ch 5, slip st) in first ch-5 space, [ch 5, slip st] twice in each ch-5 space around, ch 5; join with slip st in first ch-5 space—12 ch-5 spaces. Place marker for beginning of round and work in continuous rounds.
Rounds 5–10: (Ch 5, slip st) in each ch-5 space around ending with last slip st in first ch-5 space. 
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Tie Ch 80. Fasten off. Tie a knot at each end of tie and weave through ch-5 spaces of last round. 
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 skein each 360 Café A, 334 Buff B.
Crochet Hooks: 4.25mm [US G-6] for gopher head;
5mm [US H-8] for gopher body and inner sock; 5.5mm [US I-9] for inner sock to fit larger size club (460 cc).
Yarn needle, stitch marker, 10mm safety eyes, black embroidery floss for nose, stuffing.
abbreviations: A and B = Color A and B
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Cover measures 13½” tall.
gauge: 24 sts = 4”; 20 rows = 4” in single crochet using smallest hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Nose Blaze
With smallest hook and A, ch 5.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across, turn—4 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, skip first sc, sc in next sc, skip next sc, sc in last sc, turn—2 sc.
Rows 3–7: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 8: Slip st in each st across. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

Head
With smallest hook and A, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in ring—6 sc. Place marker for beginning of round, move marker up as work progresses.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Round 3: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc] 6 times—18 sc.
Round 4: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc] 6 times—24 sc.
Round 5: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc] 6 times—30 sc.
Rounds 6–8: Sc in each sc around; change to B in last sc of Round 8. Fasten off A.
Note: In the following 8 rounds, no increases are worked in the first 3 sc. This flat area is for the nose blaze. You may wish to put a stitch marker in this flat area for later reference.
Round 9: With B, sc in each sc around.
Round 10: Sc in next 3 sc, [2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc] 13 times, 2 sc in next sc—44 sc.
Round 11: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 11 times—55 sc.
Round 12: Sc in next 3 sc, [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 4 sc] 10 times, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last sc—66 sc.
Rounds 13–15: Sc in each sc around.
Round 16: Sc in next 3 sc, [sc2tog, sc in next 2 sc] 15, sc2tog, sc in next sc—50 sc.
Round 17: [Sc2tog, sc in next 3 sc] 10 times—40 sc.
Round 18: [Sc2tog, sc in next 2 sc] 10 times—30 sc.
Round 19: [Sc2tog, sc in next 3 sc] 6 times—24 sc.
Round 20: [Sc2tog, sc in next 2 sc] 6 times; change to A in last sc—18 sc.
Change to middle size hook.
Round 21: With A, working loosely, sc in each sc around.
Attach nose blaze and safety eyes: Beginning with color change round (Round 9), pin nose blaze with wider row at top (Round 9), to the flat 3-sc area at the beginning of Rounds 9–16. Sew nose blaze in place and weave in end. Attach safety eyes, one on each side of top of nose blaze, as pictured. Stuff head firmly.
Change back to smallest hook.
Round 22: Working in back loops only, sc in each sc around.
Round 23: [Sc2tog, sc in next sc] 6 times—12 sc.
Continue to stuff head firmly as work proceeds.
Round 24: [Sc2tog] 6 times—6 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Remove beginning of round marker. Weave tail through stitches of last round and pull to close opening. Secure and weave in end.

Sculpt Eye Area: With needle and a long piece of A, insert needle through bottom of head and bring out on inside (nose side) of left eye. Bring yarn across and insert back into head at inside of right eye. Pull needle back through bottom of head. Pull gently on both ends of yarn, to form a small gather in head between the eyes, and tie ends together. Repeat this process once more.

Body
Round 1: With middle size hook and working in unworked front loops of Round 21 of head, draw up a loop of A in any sc, ch 1, sc in same sc and in each sc around—18 sc. Place marker for beginning of round, move marker up as work progresses.
Round 2: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc] 6 times—24 sc.
Round 3: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc] 8 times—32 sc.
Round 4: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc] 16 times—48 sc.
Round 5: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 15 sc] 3 times—51 sc.
Rounds 6 and 7: Sc in each sc around.
Round 8: [Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 10 times, sc in last sc—61 sc.
Rounds 9–30: Sc in each sc around.
Round 31: [Sc in next 4 sc, sc2tog] 10 times, sc in last sc—51 sc.
Rounds 32–36: Sc in each sc around.
Fasten off.

Ears (Make 2)
With smallest hook and A, ch 6; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, 8 sc in ring; do not join—8 sc. Place marker for beginning of round, move marker up as work progresses.
Round 2: Sc in next sc, sc2tog, sc in last 5 sc—7 sc.
Round 3: Sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog, sc in last 2 sc—6 sc.
Round 4: [Sc2tog] 3 times—3 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Weave tail through stitches of last round and pull to close opening. Use remaining tails to sew one ear to each side of head.

Arms (Make 2)
With middle size hook and A, ch 7; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, 9 sc in ring; do not join—9 sc. Place marker for beginning of round, move marker up as work progresses.
Round 2: Sc in each sc around.
Round 3: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc] 2 times, 2 sc in last sc—12 sc.
Rounds 4–12: Sc in each sc around.
Round 13: [Sc2tog, sc in next 3 sc] 2 times, sc2tog—9 sc.
Round 14: Sc2tog, sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog, sc in last 2 sc—7 sc.
Round 15: Work 2 sc in each sc around—14 sc.
Round 16: Sc in each sc around.
Round 17: [Sc2tog, sc in next 5 sc] 2 times—12 sc.
Round 18: Sc in each sc around.
Round 19: [Sc2tog] 6 times—6 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Weave tail through stitches of last round and pull to close opening. Stuff firmly. Leave remaining tail for sewing arm to side of body.

Inner Sock
Note: If making cover to fit 460 cc club, use largest hook. Otherwise, use middle size hook.
With A, ch 31.
Row 1: Working in back loops only, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—30 sc.
Rows 2–30: Working in back loops only, sc in each sc across.
Fold piece in half, bringing last row to meet foundation ch. Seaming Row: Working through both thicknesses, slip st across to seam sides and form a tube. Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Thread tail through ends of row around one end of tube, pull to gather and close opening. Leave remaining tail for sewing sock inside body of gopher.

FINISHING
Turn body inside out. With yarn tail, sew inner sock to body of gopher, just under the head. Weave in end. Turn right side out.
Pin arms to sides of upper portion of body, as in photo. With yarn tails, sew arms in place. Weave in ends.
With black embroidery floss, and using photograph as a guide, embroider straight st nose at end of nose blaze.

materials: AUNT LYDIA'S® Metallic Crochet Thread, Size 10: 2 (2, 2, 3, 3) balls 90G Gold/Gold
1 (1, 11/8, 1¼, 1¼) yd [1, (1, 1, 11/8, 11/8) m] grosgrain ribbon, 1½” (38 mm) wide
sewing needle and thread to match
abbreviations: *= repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
gauge: 18 sts = 1 ½” (4 cm) in pattern; 14 rows = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions: Ch 19. Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—18 sc. Row 2: Ch 2 (counts as first dc here and throughout), skip first 3 st, fan in next st, ch 3, working around fan just made, fan in 2nd skipped st (2-fan group made), skip next st after first fan of this 2-fan group, dc in next st, *skip next 3 st, fan in next st, ch 3, working around fan just made, fan in 2nd skipped st (2-fan group made), skip next st after first fan of this 2-fan group, dc in next st; repeat from * once, turn—6 fans, 4 dc and 3 ch-3 spaces. Row 3: Ch 2, fan in first dc, skip first fan, dc in first ch-3 space, *skip next fan and next dc, fan in 2nd dc of next fan, ch 3, working around fan just made, fan in 2nd dc of previously skipped fan, dc in next ch-3 space; repeat from * once, skip last fan, 4 dc (counts as last fan and dc) in top of beginning ch-2, turn—6 fans, 5 dc, and 2 ch-3 spaces. Row 4: Ch 2, skip first fan and next dc, fan in 2nd dc of next fan, ch 3, working around fan just made, fan in 3rd dc of first fan, dc in first ch-3 space, *skip next fan and next dc, fan in 2nd dc of next fan, ch 3, working around fan just made, fan in 2nd dc of previously skipped fan, dc in next ch-3 space; repeat from * once, turn—6 fans, 4 dc and 3 ch-3 spaces. Row 5: Repeat Row 3. Rows 6–97 (111, 125, 139, 149): Repeat Rows 4 and 5 forty-six (fifty-three, sixty, sixty-seven, seventy-two) times. Note In next row, “next st” may be a dc or a ch-3 space. Row 98 (112, 126, 140, 150): Ch 1, sc, *sc2tog, sc in next st; repeat from * across, turn—17 sts. Directions are for size Small. Changes for sizes Medium, Large, 1X, and 2X are in parentheses. Special Stitch fan = 3 dc in indicated stitch. sc2tog = [Insert hook in next stitch, yarn over and pull up a loop] twice, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook. Special Technique Working fan around fan just made = Yo, insert hook in indicated stitch, bring working yarn to back of piece and wrap around previously made fan, yo, draw up a loop, [yo, pull through 2 loops] twice, *yo, insert hook in same stitch, bring working yarn to back of piece and wrap around same fan, yo, draw up a loop, [yo, pull through 2 loops] twice; repeat from * once. Notes 1. Crossed stitch design is created by working a 3-double crochet fan around a previously made fan. 2. When working around a fan, ensure that the chains between fans are not caught in the stitching. 3. Ribbon backing is added for stability and belt closes with snap fasteners. 4. Belt can be lengthened or shortened to a specific length by increasing or decreasing Rows 4 and 5. You may need additional crochet thread and longer length of ribbon for a longer belt. Row 99 (113, 127, 141, 151): Ch 1, sc in first 2 st, sc2tog, *sc in next 2 st, sc2tog; repeat from * to last st, sc in last st—13 sts. Fasten off. FINISHING Trim ribbon to length 1” (2.5 cm) longer than belt. Fold and press under ½” (12.7 mm) at each end to wrong side; sew ribbon around all 4 sides to wrong side of belt. Leaving a 1” (2.5 cm) overlap, sew snaps on belt.

materials: Bernat® Maker™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 317 yds/290 m) Fawn (06013)
Size U.S. G/6 [4 mm] Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Approx 10 yds [9.1 m] of ½" [1.5 cm] wide satin ribbon for lacing.
Optional: D-rings (8 shown in photo) 1" [2.5 cm] for 'skirt hikes'.
Two pieces of ¼" [6.5 mm] spiral steel boning 5" [12.5 cm] long.
Four pieces of ¼" spiral steel boning 7" [18 cm] long.
abbreviations: Hdchb = Work 1 hdc in horizontal bar below space normally worked, created by hdc at front of work (see diagram).
Hdchb2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop into horizontal bar of next stitch) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.

Lnkdc = Insert hook down through lower horizontal bar in center of previous dc, yoh and pull up a loop. Insert hook in next stitch (through top loops in usual manner), yoh and pull up a loop. Yoh and pull through first 2 loops on hook. Yoh and pull through last 2 loops on hook – Linked Dc made.
measurements: Note: Corset is designed to fit with no ease. Fit is adjustable based on gap allowed at center back lacing. To fit waist measurement XS/S 23-26½" [58.5-67.5 cm], M 28-30" [71-76 cm], L 32-34" [81.5-86.5 cm], XL 36-38" [91.5-96.5 cm], 2/3XL 40-45" [101.5-114 cm], 4/5XL 46-50" [116.5-127 cm]. Finished waist XS/S 20" [51 cm], M 24" [61 cm], L 28" [71 cm], XL 32" [81 cm], 2/3XL 38" [96.5 cm], 4/5XL 42" [106.5 cm].
gauge: 20 hdchb and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions: The instructions are written for size XS/S. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written XS/S (M-L-XL-2/3XL-4/5XL). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given it applies to all sizes. Note: Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as st.

materials: 10" (25.5cm) square light blue hanky or 11" (28cm) square of light blue batiste cloth
RED HEART® Classic Crochet Thread Size 10, Art. 144 available in white & natural 350 yd (320m), solids 300 yd (274m)
abbreviations: shell (shell): Ch 1, [dc, ch 1] 3 times in indicated st.
large shell (lgshell): Ch 1, [dc, ch 1] 5 times in indicated st.
heart (heart): [Dc in indicated st, ch 4, dc in top of previous dc] 2 times, dc in indicated st.
measurements: Hanky measures 12" (30.5cm) square.
gauge: GAUGE: 8 sc = 1" (2.5 cm); 3 rows in pattern = ⅞" (2 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook needed to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
Notes: Trim is crocheted in joined rounds with Right Side always facing then sewn on hanky edge.
LACE  Ch 313.
Foundation: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next 42 chs, [3 sc in next ch, placing marker in 2nd sc, sc in next 77 chs] 3 times, 3 sc in next ch, placing marker in 2nd sc, sc in next 34 chs; without twisting row, join with slip st in first sc to create open square – 320 sc.
Round 1: Ch 1, sc in same st as join, sc in next 2 sts, [*skip next st, shell in next st, skip next st, sc in next 5 sts*; repeat from * to * across to last st before marker, skip next st, lgshell in marked st, moving marker to 3rd dc of lgshell, skip next st, sc in next 5 sts] 4 times; repeat from * to * across to last 5 sts, skip next st, shell in next st, skip next st, sc in next 2 sts; join with slip st in first st – 36 shells, 4 lgshells and 200 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in same st as join, [*ch 3, sk next 2 sc, skip next dc, heart in next dc, ch 3, skip next dc, sk next 2 sc, sc in next sc*; repeat from * to * across to last 2 sc, skip last 2 sc, sk next dc, ch 3, heart in next dc, ch 3, sc in next marked dc, ch 3, heart in next dc, ch 3, skip next dc, skip next 2 sc, sc in next sc] 4 times; repeat from * to * across to last 2 sc before last shell, skip next 2 sc, skip next dc, ch 3, heart in next dc, ch 3, skip next dc, skip next 2 sc; join with slip st in first sc – 44 sc, 44 hearts and 88 ch-3 spaces.
Fasten off.
FINISHING: Weave in ends. Sew trim to outer edge of hanky. Create a rolled hem after sewing on trim, if using a cloth square. Block if desired.

materials: Lily® Sugar ’n Cream (Solids: 70.9 g/2.5 oz/109 m/120 yds)
Size 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Finished Measurements: approx. 29 ins [73.5 cm] long.
gauge: 14 hdc and 11 rows = 4 ins [10 cm]
instructions:
Note: T urning ch 2 does not count as st. When changing colors, work to the last 2 loops on the hook of last st, then draw new color through rem 2 loops and proceed. 
FRONT
With MC, ch 58. 
1st row:(RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of ch. T urn. 56 hdc. 
2nd row:Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. T urn. 
Rep last row until work from beg measures 29 ins [73.5 cm], ending with RS facing for next row. 
**Next row:Ch 3. (Yoh and draw up a loop in next st) 3 times. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook– Hdc3tog made. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 4 sts. Hdc3tog over next 3 sts. 1 dc in last st. T urn. 
Rep last row to 8 sts. Fasten off.**
Place markers at each end of last row. 
BACK
With MC, ch 58. 
1st row:(RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of ch. T urn. 56 hdc. 
2nd row:Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. T urn. 
Rep last row 4 times more.  Work from ** to **, as given for Front. 
Joining Back and Front:Place WS of Back and Front tog, matching shapes and pin them tog. With RS of work facing, join MC with sl st to left marked corner of Front. Proceed as follows:  
1st rnd:Working through both thicknesses, ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. Work 30 sc evenly down left "shoulder", 2 sc in corner and 12 sc down left side. Working in Front only, 92 sc down left side of Front, 3 sc in corner, 1 sc in each of next 54 sts across bottom of Front, 3 sc in corner and 92 sc up right side of Front. Working through both thicknesses, 12 sc up right side, 2 sc in corner, and 30 sc evenly up right "shoulder". Working in Front only, 15 sc across top of Front. Join A in rnd with sl st to first sc. 
2nd rnd:With A, ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in next sc. *With B, 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. With A, 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around, working 3 sc in corners. Join with sl st to first sc.  
3rd rnd:Beg with appropriate color, ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each sc, changing colors, as in 2nd row. Join B with sl st to first sc.
4th rnd:With B, ch 1. Working from left to right instead of from right to left, as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
POCKET A (make 4)
With MC, ch 27. 
1st row:(RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. T urn. 26 sc. 
2nd to 4th rows:Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. . 
5th and 6th rows:Ch 1. T urn 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. (With B, 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. With A, 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) 3 times. With B, 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. With MC, 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. T urn. 
7th and 8th rows:Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. (With A, 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. With MC, 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) 3 times. With A, 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. With MC, 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. T urn.
Rep last 4 rows twice more, then 5th and 6th rows once more. Break A and B. 
Next 3 rows:With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. T urn. Do not turn at end of last row.  
Next row:(RS). With MC, ch 1. Working from left to right instead of from right to left, as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc across. Fasten off.
POCKET B (make 1)
With B, ch 59. 
1st row:(RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. (With A, 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. With B, 1 sc in each of next 2 ch) 14 times. T urn. 58 sc. 
2nd row:With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. (With A, 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. With B, 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) 14 times. T urn. 
3rd and 4th rows:With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. (With MC, 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. With A, 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) 14 times. T urn. 
5th and 6th rows:With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. (With A, 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. With B, 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) 14 times. T urn.
7th and 8th rows:With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. With MC, 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. With A, 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. With MC, 1 sc in each of next 46 sc. With A, 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. With MC, 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. With A, 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. T urn. 
9th and 10th rows:With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. With A, 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. With B, 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. With MC, 1 sc in each of next 46 sc. With B, 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. With A, 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. With B, 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. T urn. 
Rep last 4 rows 3 times more, joining MC at end of last row. 
Next row:(RS). With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Do not turn.  
Next row: Ch 1. Working from left to right instead of from right to left, as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc across. Fasten off.
Tie: With B, ch 15. Sl st to WS at top edge.  Ch 15. Fasten off. Insert hanger and use ties to secure at back. 
HEART
With B, ch 2. 
1st row:(RS). 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join A. T urn. 2 sc. 
2nd row:With A, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. With B, 1 sc in same sc (increase made). With B, 1 sc in next sc. With A, 1 sc in same sc (increase made). T urn.  
1st and 2nd rows of Chart are complete.
Cont in chart until 22nd row of Chart has been completed, working increases as before. 28 sc. 
23rd row:(RS). Ch 1. Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook - Sc2tog made. Pat across 11 sc. Tu rn . Leave rem sts unworked. 
24th row:Ch 1. Pat to last 2 sts. Sc2tog over last 2 sc. T urn. 
25th row:Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2 sts. Pat to last 2 sts. Sc2tog over last 2 sts. T urn. 
26th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2 sts. Pat to last 2 sts. Fasten off. 
With RS of work facing, miss 2 sc of 22nd row. Join MC with sl st to next sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. Pat to last 2 sc. Sc2tog over last 2 sc. T urn. 
Next rnd:Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2 sts. Pat to end of row.  T urn. 
Next row:Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2 sts. Pat to last 2 sts. Sc2tog over last 2 sts.
T urn. 
Next row:Ch 1. Sl st in each of first 2 sts. Ch 1. Pat to last 2 sts. Sc2tog over last 2 sts. Fasten off. 
With RS of work facing, join B with sl st to bottom point of Heart. Ch 1. 3 sc in same sp as last sl st. Work 1 rnd of sc evenly around Heart. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Next rnd:With B, ch 1. Working from left to right instead of from right to left, as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Fasten off. Sew on Heart as illustrated, stuffing lightly as you sew it on. Sew on Pockets as illustrated, stitching down center of Pocket B.  
Reverse Sc Chart Key.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver™ Super Craft Kit – 1 kit
Contrast A  Pumpkin 1 ball or 39 yds/36 m
Contrast B  Soft White 1 ball or 62 yds/57 m
Contrast C  Black 1 ball or 39 yds/36 m
Contrast D  Saffron 1 ball or 10 yds/9 m
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Fsc = (Foundation single crochet). *Insert hook in “chain" of previous stitch and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 1 loop on hook (the “chain”). Yoh and draw through both loops on hook. Rep from * for indicated number of stitches. Note: This method adds foundation single crochet stitches to end of a row. Foundation single crochet (fsc) consists of a base chain and sc worked at same time.
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sts. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: One size to fit adult.
gauge: 12 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes:
• Work in color block technique, wind small balls of the colors to be used, one for each separate area of color in the design. Start new colors at appropriate points.
• To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops, then proceed in new color.
COLLAR
With A, ch 61.
See diagram on page 3.
Shape Body, Right Front and Right Back Paws: 1st row:  (RS).
2 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 4 ch. *2 sc in next ch. 1 sc in each of next 4 ch.** Rep from * once more. With B, rep from * to ** 9 times more. Turn. 72 sc.
2nd row: With B, ch 1. 3 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 53 sc. With A, 1 sc in each of next 17 sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 75 sc.
3rd row: With A, ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 13 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. With B, 1 sc in each of next 12 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. With C, 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 2 sc in next sc. With B, 1 sc in each of next 14 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 12 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 77 sts.
4th row: With B, ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 13 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 12 sc. With C, 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. With B, 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 14 sc. 2 sc in next sc. With A, 1 sc in each of next 14 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. Fasten off A. Do not break B. 79 sc.
Right Front and Right Back Paws are complete. 
Shape Body only: 5th row: Skip first 12 sts. Pick up B from previous row and join with sl st in next sc. Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as sl st. *1 sc in each of next 10 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * once more. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. With C, 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. With B, 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 60 sc.
6th row: With B, ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. With C, 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. *1 sc in each of next 9 sc. 2 sc in next sc.* With B, rep from * to * twice more. 1 sc in each of last 9 sc. Turn. 66 sc.
7th row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. *1 sc in each of next 10 sc. 2 sc in next sc.* 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. With A, 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. With C, 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. With B, 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to * once more. 1 sc in each of last 5 sc. Turn. 72 sc.
8th row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 11 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. With C, 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc.* 2 sc in next sc. With A, 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. With B, 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Rep from * to * once more. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 78 sc.
9th row: With B, ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. With C, 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. With A, 1 sc in each of next 19 sc. With C, 1 sc in each of next 20 sc. With B, 1 sc in each of next 16 sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 80 sc.
10th row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 10 sc. Break B. With A, 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. With C, 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. With A, 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. With C, 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. With B, 1 sc in each of next 14 sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 85 sc.
11th row: With B, ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 15 sc. With C, 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. With A, 1 sc in each of next 14 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. With C, 1 sc in each of next 16 sc. With B, 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. With A, 1 sc in each of next 18 sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 88 sc. PM at end of row.
12th row: With A, ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 18 sc. With B, 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. With C, 1 sc in each of next 15 sc. With A, 1 sc in each of next 14 sc. With C, 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. With B, 1 sc in each of next 21 sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 90 sc.
Shape Body, Left Front and Left Back Paws: 13th row: (RS).
With B, ch 13. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 11 ch. 1 sc in each of next 17 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. With C, 1 sc in each of next 12 sc. 2 sc in next sc. With A, 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. With C, 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. With B, 1 sc in each of next 13 sc. 2 sc in next sc. With A, 1 sc in each of next 17 sc. 2 sc in last sc. Make 12 fsc (see Abbreviations). Turn. 119 sts.
14th row: With A, ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 20 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. With B, 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. With C, 1 sc in each of next 14 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. With A, 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Break A. With C, 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. With B, 1 sc in each of next 15 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 20 sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 126 sc.
15th row: With B, ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 30 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. With C, 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. 2 sc in next sc. *1 sc in each of next 19 sc. 2 sc in next sc.* 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. With B, 1 sc in each of next 15 sc. With A, 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to * once. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 129 sts.
16th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. *1 sc in each of next 20 sc. 2 sc in next sc.* 1 sc in each of next 12 sc. Break A. With B, 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Break B. With C, 1 sc in each of next 12 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to * once. Break C. With B, rep from * to * once. 1 sc in each of next 20 sc. Sc2tog. Fasten off. 132 sts.
Tail
With RS of Body facing, join B with sl st at marked row (end of 11th row).
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. Working in posts of sts at ends of rows,  1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in side of each of next 5 rows. Turn. 6 sc.
2nd and 3rd rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Break B. Join A.
4th row: With A, ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn.
6th to 8th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
9th to 11th rows: Rep 4th and 5th rows once more, then rep 4th row once more. Break A. Join C.
12th and 13th rows: With C, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
14th and 15th rows: Rep 4th and 5th rows once.
16th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 4 sts.
17th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
18th row: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. Fasten off.
Head
See diagram on page 6.
With B, ch 2.
1st rnd: (RS). 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each of first 2 sc. With A, 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. With C, 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. Turn . 12 sc.
3rd rnd: (WS). With C, ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. With A, *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc.* Rep from * twice more. With B, rep from * to * once. 1 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. Turn . 18 sc.
4th rnd: (RS). With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. Break B. With A, *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc.* Rep from * twice more. With C, rep from * to * once more. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. Turn . 22 sc.
5th row: With C, sl st in each of first 2 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc.* With A, rep from * to * twice more. 1 sc in next sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 20 sc.
6th row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc.* Rep from * once more. 1 sc in next sc. With C, 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to * once more. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn . 24 sc.
7th row: With C, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. PM for First Ear in last st worked. Sl st in each of next 2 sc. Break C. With A, sl st in each of next 6 sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. PM for Second Ear in last st worked. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Fasten off. 20 sc and 8 sl sts.
Chin
With RS facing, join B with sl st to first sl st of 5th row of Head (first skipped st).
1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn. 8 sc.
2nd row: Sl st in each of first 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sl st in each of last 2 sc. Fasten off. 4 sc and 4 sl sts.
EARS
First Ear: With RS facing, join C with sl st to First Ear marker.
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Turn. 5 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Turn. 4 sts.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 3 sts.
4th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 2 sts.
5th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Fasten off.
Second Ear: With RS facing, join A with sl st to Second Ear marker.
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Turn. 5 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 4 sts.
3rd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn. 3 sts.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 2 sts.
5th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Fasten off.

Eyes  (Make 2 alike).
With D, ch 2.
1st rnd: (RS). 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
Fasten off, leaving long tail.
FINISHING
With C, embroider pupils on eyes using satin stitch, and embroider nose and mouth on Head, as shown.
SATIN STITCH
Sew Eyes to Head, as shown.
With A, sew Head to Body, on opposite end of Body from Tail, as shown.
Closure: Join D with sl st in tip of Paw below tail (Back Right Paw).

Pompom: Wind D around 2 fingers 60 times. Remove from fingers. Tie tightly in middle with 1 long strand of yarn.
Cut loops at both ends and trim to a smooth round shape.

Join D with sl st to tip of Paw below Head (Front Right Paw).

pattern_name: Mini Me Doll Size Crochet Dress
materials: Aunt Lydia’s® Classic Crochet Thread Size 10 (Colors: 350 yds/320 m) Fuchsia (69023) 1 ball or 38 yds/35 m
Size U.S. B/1 (2.25 mm) Susan Bates® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Hdc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: One size to fit 12" [30.5 cm] fashion doll.
gauge: 26 sc and 28 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes:
• Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as st.
• Ch 3 at beg of row counts as dc.
• Ch 4 at beg of row counts as tr.
BODY
**Ch 34 loosely. See diagram on page 3.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *1 dc in next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Rep from * to end of chain. Turn. 33 sts.
2nd row: Ch 3. *1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
4th row: As 2nd row.
5th row: (RS). Ch 2. Hdc2tog. *1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to last 3 sts. 1 sc in next dc. Hdc2tog. Turn. 31 sts.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in last st. Turn.
7th row: Ch 3. *1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
8th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
9th row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog. *1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to last 3 sts. 1 dc in next sc. Hdc2tog. Turn. 29 sts.
10th row: Ch 3. *1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in last st. Turn.
11th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
12th row: Ch 3. *1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
13th to 16th rows: As 5th to 8th rows. 27 sts.
17th to 20th rows: As 7th and 8th rows twice more.
21st row: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first sc. *1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to last dc and sc. 1 sc in next dc. 2 hdc in last sc. Turn. 29 sts.
22nd row: Ch 3. 1 sc in next hdc. *1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to last 3 sts. 1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next hdc. 1 dc in last hdc. Turn.
23rd row: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first dc. *1 dc in next sc. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last sc and dc. 1 dc in next sc. 2 hdc in last dc. Turn. 31 sts.
24th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first hdc. 1 dc in next hdc. *1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to last 3 sts. 1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next hdc. 1 sc in last hdc. Turn.
25th row: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first sc. *1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to last dc and sc. 1 sc in next dc. 2 hdc in last sc. Turn. 33 sts.
26th row: Ch 3. 1 sc in next hdc. *1 dc in next sc. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last 3 sts. 1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next hdc. 1 dc in last hdc. Turn.
27th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Fasten off.
Shape front: With RS facing, skip first 11 sc. Join yarn with sl st to next sc.
1st row: (RS). Ch 13. Sl st in each of next 2 sc. Ch 11. Sl st in each of next 2 sc. Ch 9. Sl st in each of next 2 sc. Ch 11. Sl st in each of next 2 sc. Ch 13. Sl st in next sc. Fasten off.
Neck choker and shoulder straps: 1st row: Ch 10. Sl st in first ch-13 loop. Ch 1. Sl st in next ch-11 loop. Ch 1. Sl st in next ch-9 loop. Ch 1. Sl st in next ch-11 loop. Ch 1. Sl st in next ch-13 loop. Ch 11. Turn.
2nd row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each of next 9 ch. (1 sc in next sl st. 1 sc in next ch) 4 times. 1 sc in next sl st. 1 sc in each of last 10 ch. Turn. 29 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Fasten off.
Sew shoulder straps along back edge 3 sts in from side edges.
Sew back seam.
Bottom edging:
1st rnd: (RS). Join yarn with sl st at back seam. Working in rem loops of foundation ch, proceed as follows: Ch 4 (counts as hdc and ch-2). (Skip next ch. 1 hdc in next ch. Ch 2) 16 times. Join with sl st to 2nd ch of ch-4.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right, instead of from right to left, as usual, work 1 reverse sc in same sp as sl st. *1 reverse sc in next ch-2 sp. 1 reverse sc in next hdc. Rep from * to last ch-2 sp. 1 reverse sc in last ch-2 sp. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Simply Soft (170 g/6 oz; 288 m/315 yds)
measurements: Not applicable.
gauge: Not applicable.
instructions: Wrap double stick tape around outside edge of the hanger, leaving ends untaped. Make sure the whole outside surface is covered. Wind one color of yarn smoothly and loosely around hanger starting at center hook. Do not wind tightly or it will warp the hanger. Press the yarn firmly against the tape. Make yarn strands lay flat next to each other but not overlapping. Repeat Step 2 for second half of hanger. Cut 2 strands of second color each 72"/183cm long. Thread both strands through the yarn needle. Beginning at one end of hanger, weave over and under several threads through all layers. At the opposite end, flip the hanger over and weave under and over the same holes, but in the opposite direction. Repeat the weaving until the center section of the hanger is filled up. Add more yarn for weaving as needed, hiding ends in the center of the weaving.

materials: Sizes 4.5 mm (U.S. 7) and 5.5 mm (U.S. I or 9) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 13 x 18 ins [33 x 45.5 cm]
gauge: 14 sc and 16 rows = 4 ins [10 cm] with smaller crochet hook. 14 sts and 14 rows = 4 ins [10 cm] with larger crochet hook in pat.
instructions:
Note: When changing colors, work to last 2 loops on hook of last st, then draw new color through rem 2 loops and proceed. 
TOWEL I
With MC and larger hook, ch 46. 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *Ch 1. Miss next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Rep from * to end of ch. Turn. 45 sts. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 
Rep last 2 rows until work from beg measures 13 ins [33 cm], ending with RS facing for next row. Join A. 
Change to smaller hook and proceed as follows:
Edging: 1st row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, work 46 sc across. Turn. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 2. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first ch-2 sp. *Ch 2. (2 dc. Ch 3) 3 times in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * to end of row. Fasten off. 
Towel Topper: With B and smaller hook, ch 2. 1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc. Fasten off.
FLOWER
First Petal: 1st row: Join D with sl st to front loop only of any sc. *Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as sl st. 2 sc in front loop only of next sc. 4 sc for petal. Turn. 
Next 4 rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn. 
Next row: Ch 1. (Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sts. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook - sc2tog made) twice. Fasten off leaving a long end.*
Second Petal: **Rejoin D with sl st to front loop of next unworked sc of 2nd rnd. Rep from * to * once.**
Third to Sixth Petals: Rep from ** to ** 4 times more. 6 petals.
3rd rnd: Join A with sl st to rem back loop of any sc of 2nd rnd. Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp. 2 dc in each rem back loop around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 24 dc.
4th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. *1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last dc. 1 dc in last dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 36 dc.
5th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last 4 dc. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 2 dc in last dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 50 dc.
6th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last 6 dc. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. 2 dc in last dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 66 dc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right instead of from right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each dc around. Ch 7 (loop). Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. 
Using yarn ends from each petal, sew around outer edges of petals.
TOWEL II
Work as given for Towel I, substituting A for D and D for A. 
TOWEL III
Work as given for Towel I, substituting D for B, C for D and B for A. 
TOWEL IV
Work as given for Towel I substituting A for B, B for D and C for A. 
FINISHING
Pleat top edge of each Towel to fit Towel Toppers. Sew in position.

pattern_name: Fabric Lined Adult Crochet Face Mask
materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m) Turqua (0512) 1 ball or 57 yds/52 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
11" x 12" [28 x 30.5 cm] piece of lining fabric (heavyweight quilter’s cotton, flannel or high thread count bedding recommended).
Coats & Clark Dual Duty XP® All-purpose Thread.
Alternate Versions: Ribbon Ties Version: 72" [1.8 m] of ¼" [6 mm] wide ribbon; Elastic Ear Loops Version: 12" [30.5 cm] of ¼" [6 mm] wide elastic.
abbreviations: Hdc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: One size to fit Adult.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Ch 29.
Foundation row: (WS). Sl st in 2nd ch from hook and in next ch. 1 sc in each of next 4 ch. 1 hdc in each of next 16 ch. 1 sc in each of next 4 ch. Sl st in each of last 2 ch. Turn. 28 sts.
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. Working in back loops only, sl st in each of first 2 sts. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 1 hdc in each of next 16 hdc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sl st in each of last 2 sts. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg (at middle hdc section) measures 5" [12.5 cm].
Next row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, sl st in each of first 2 sts. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 1 hdc in each of next 7 hdc. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 7 hdc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sl st in each of last 2 sts. Do not turn. 
Alternate Ribbon Ties or Elastic Ear Loop Versions (see page 2):
Fasten off.
Crochet Ties and Edging: *Ch 59 (tie). Sl st in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch to end of chain.* Sl st evenly across side edge of Mask. Rep from * to * once. Sl st evenly across lower edge of Mask. Rep from * to * once. Sl st evenly up side edge of Mask. Rep from * to * once. Sl st evenly across top edge of Mask. Sl st into corner. Fasten off.
ASSEMBLY
Cut Lining Template out (see page 3 - print at 100% scale). Alternatively, draw onto paper using template as guide, noting each square represents 1" [2.5 cm] square. Trace onto Lining Fabric and cut out 2 pieces. Stack Lining pieces and turn under ¼" [6 mm] along perimeter to WS.
Center WS of fabric on WS of Mask and pin into position. With sewing needle and all-purpose thread, whipstitch fabric to Mask.
Alternate Versions:
Ribbon Ties: Sew 18" [45.5 cm] length of ribbon securely to each corner on WS of Mask.
Elastic Ear Loops: Sew ends of 6" [15 cm] length of elastic securely to each corner on WS of Mask.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 skein each 672 Spring Green A
abbreviations: A, B, C, D, E = color A, B, C, D, E
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Holder measures approximately 2½” wide x 7½” tall excluding strap.
gauge: 12 sts = 4”; 16 rows in sc = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HOLDER
With A, ch 4, join with slip st to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, 6 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc, do not turn – 6 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc, do not turn – 12 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, *sc in first st, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc, turn – 18 sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in flp only of each sc around; join with slip st in first sc, turn – 18 sc.
Rounds 5-7: Ch 1, working in both loops of sts, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc – 18 sc. Drop A, join B.
Round 8: With B, ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc – 18 sc. Drop B, pick up A.
Rounds 9-13: With A, ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc – 18 sc.
Switch Opening
Work now progresses in rows.
Rows 14-18: Ch 1, sc in each st; do not join, turn – 18 st.
Work now progresses in rounds.
Round 19: Ch 1, sc in each of 18 sts, join with slip st in first sc – 18 sc.
Round 20: With A, ch 1, sc in each of next 7 sts; with E, sc next sts; with A, sc in next 2 sts; with E, sc in next sts; with A, sc in each of next 7 sts; join with slip st in first sc, turn – 18 sc.
Round 21: With A, ch 1, sc in each of next 6 sts; with E, sc in next st; with D, sc in next st; with E, sc in next 2 sts; with D, sc in next st; with A, sc in each of last 6 sts; join with slip st in first st – 18 sc.
Round 22: Repeat round 20.
Round 23: With A, ch 1, *sc in each of next 2 sts, 2 sc in next; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first st; turn – 24 sc. Drop A, pick up C.
Round 24: With C, ch 1, sc in each of next 5 sts, holding first ring to surface, sc over ring and each of next 2 sts, sc in each of next 10 sts, holding 2nd ring to surface, sc over ring and each of next 2 sts, sc in each of last 5 sts; join with slip st in first st; turn – 24 sc. Drop C, pick up D.
Rounds 25-26: With D, ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc; turn – 24 sc.
Round 27: Ch 1, *sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first st; turn – 30 sc.
Rounds 28-29: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc; turn – 30 sc.
Round 30: Ch 1, (sc, ch 4, sc) in first st, *skip 1 st, (sc, ch 4, sc) in next sc; repeat from * around, skip last st; join with slip st in first sc – 30 sc; 15 ch-4 loops. Fasten off.
NOSE
With C, ch 4, join with slip st in first st to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, 6 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc – 6 sc. Fasten off leaving a long tail for sewing. With yarn needle and tail, sew nose onto body centered under eyes on round 15.
SCAR
With D and yarn needle, embroider scar onto face as pictured.
STRAP
With D, join with slip st in one ring on side of body, ch 40, slip st in clasp, 
Row 1: Ch 1, turn; sc in each of next 40 ch, slip st in first ring, turn.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each of next 40 sts, slip st in clasp. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Soft®: 1 ball 9440 Light Grey Heather A for Boy
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 3.75mm [US F-5] for Boy
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
measurements: Boy Bow Tie measures 4¼” [11 cm] wide x 1¾” [4.5 cm] high; Adult Bow Tie measures 4½” [11.5 cm] wide x 2¼” [5.5 cm] high
gauge: 20 sts = 4” [10 cm]; 20 rows = 4” [10 cm] in single crochet using smaller hook for Boy. 16 sts = 4” [10 cm]; 16 rows = 4” [10 cm] in single crochet using larger hook for Adult. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
BOW TIE
Using A and smaller hook for Boy or larger hook and B for Adult, ch 37 (33).
Row 1: Working in back loops, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across – 36 (32) sts.
Row 2: (Right Side) Ch 1, turn, working in both loops, sc in each sc across – 36 (32) sts.
Rows 3-7: Repeat Row 2.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
CENTER BAND
Using A and smaller hook for Boy or larger hook and B for Adult, ch 11 (12).
Row 1: Working in back loops, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across – 10 (11) sts.
Row 2: (Right Side) Ch 1, turn, working in both loops, sc in each sc across – 10 (11) sts.
For Adult Only
Row 3: Repeat Row 2.
For Both Sizes
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
COLLAR 
Using A and smaller hook for Boy or larger hook and B for Adult, ch 60 (70).
Sew short ends of Bow Tie together to form a loop. Flatten loop, positioning seam in center of back. Sew top and bottom edges closed. With wrong side facing, fold a “W” pleat lengthwise along center 1” [2.5 cm] of Bow Tie and sew in place. With right sides facing, position Bow Tie in center of Collar. Wrap Center Band around tucked center of Bow Tie and Collar and sew ends together on wrong side of Collar. Sew 1 (2) button on one short end of Collar, adjusting to fit comfortably around neck. Use space between sts as buttonholes. Weave in ends.

pattern_name: Crochet Baby Snuggle Up with Sleeves
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Finished Width: 26 (28, 32, 34)”; Finished Length: 24 (26, 28, 30)”
gauge: 14 dc = 4”; 8 rows = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the specified gauge.
instructions:
THROW
Body
Ch 91 (100, 113, 122)
Row 1 (Right Side): Dc in 4th ch from hook and in each ch across – 90 (99, 112, 121) sts.
Rows 2 – 35 (39, 43, 47): Ch 2 (counts as first dc here and throughout), turn, dc in each dc across. 
Divide for Armholes 
Right Side
Row 36 (40, 44, 48) (Wrong Side): Ch 2, turn, dc in first 20 (23, 26, 29) sts. Leaving remaining sts unworked.
Rows 37 (41, 45, 49) – 40 (44, 48, 52): Ch 2, turn, dc in each dc across – 21 (24, 27, 30) sts. 
Remove hook and slip st to stitch holder. 
Do not cut yarn.
Back
Row 36 (40, 44, 48): With wrong side facing, skip next 9 (9, 11, 11) unworked dc on Row 35 (39, 43, 47) of Body, join second ball of yarn with slip st in next dc, ch 2, dc in next 29 (32, 35, 38) dc. Leaving remaining sts unworked. 
Rows 37 (41, 45, 49) – 40 (44, 48, 52): Ch 2, turn, dc in each dc across – 30 (33, 36, 39) sts. 
Fasten off.
Left Side
Row 36 (40, 44, 48): With wrong side facing, skip next 9 (9, 11, 11) unworked dc on Row 35 (39, 43, 47) of Body, join second ball of yarn with slip st in next dc, ch 2, dc in next 20 (23, 26, 29) dc.
Rows 37 (41, 45, 49) – 40 (44, 48, 52): Ch 2, turn, dc in each dc across – 21 (24, 27, 30) sts.
Fasten off.
Shape Neck and Shoulders
Row 41 (45, 49, 53) (Right Side): Working in st on Right Side stitch holder, ch 2, turn, dc in next 20 (23, 26, 29) dc, ch 9 (9, 11, 11), dc in next 30 (33, 36, 39) dc of Back, ch 9 (9, 11, 11), dc in next 21 (24, 27, 30) dc of Left Side.
Row 42 (46, 50, 54): Ch 2, turn, dc in next 20 (23, 26, 29) dc, dc in next 9 (9, 11, 11) chs, dc in next 30 (33, 36, 39) dc, dc in next 9 (9, 11, 11) chs, dc in next 21 (24, 27, 30) dc – 90 (99, 112, 121) sts.
Rows 43 (47, 51, 55) – 47 (51, 55, 59): Ch 2, turn, dc in each dc across. Do not fasten off.  
Border
Turn to work along one side edge, ch 1, working in ends of rows, work 60 (66, 72, 78) sc evenly along side edge, turn to work along opposite edge of Foundation Row, work 3 sc in first ch along bottom edge, sc in next 88 (97, 110, 119) chs, 3 sc in last ch, turn to work along opposite side edge, work 60 (66, 72, 78) sc evenly spaced along side edge, turn to work along last row of Body, 3 sc in first dc, sc in next 88 (97, 110, 119) dc, 3 sc in last dc of row, join with slip st to first sc. 
Fasten off.
Sleeves
Round 1: With right side facing, join yarn with slip st to 5th (5th, 6th, 6th) st of skipped 9 (9, 11, 11) dc at underarm of Body, ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in next 4 (4, 5, 5) sts, 8 (8, 9, 9) dc evenly along edge of next 5 rows, dc in each ch on opposite side of next 9 (9, 11, 11) chs, 8 (8, 9, 9) dc evenly along edge of next 5 rows, dc in next 4 (4, 5, 5) dc, join with slip st to top of beginning ch – 34 (34, 40, 40) dc.
Rounds 2 – 5 (5, 6, 6): Ch 3, turn, dc in each dc around, join with slip st to top of beginning ch. 
Round 6 (6, 7, 7): Ch 3, turn, dc in first 8 (8, 10, 10) dc, dc2tog, [dc in next 9 (9, 11, 11) sts, dc2tog] twice, dc in in each dc around, join with slip st to top of beginning ch – 31 (31, 37, 37) sts.
Rounds 7 (7, 8, 8) – 9 (10, 12, 13): Ch 3, turn, dc in each dc around, join with slip st to top of beginning ch. 
Round 10 (11, 13, 14): Ch 3, turn, dc in first 7 (7, 9, 9) dc, dc2tog, [dc in next 8 (8, 10, 10), dc2tog] twice, dc in each dc around, join with slip st to top of beginning ch – 28 (28, 34, 34) sts. 
Rounds 11 (12, 14, 15) – 13 (15, 17, 19): Ch 3, turn, dc in each dc around, join with slip st to top of beginning ch. On last round, do not turn.
Round 14 (16, 18, 20): With right side facing, ch 1, sc in each dc around, join with slip st to first sc. 
Fasten off.
Repeat for second Sleeve.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 316 Soft White A, 319 Cherry Red B, and 624 Tea Leaf C.
abbreviations: A, B, C = color A, B, C
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Hat measures 2” x 2”; Scarf measures 1” x 18”.
gauge: 16 sts = 4”; 16 rounds = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
Round 1: With B, ch 2; 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; do NOT join but work in continuous rounds – 6 sc. Place a marker in last sc and move up each round.
Round 2: 2 Sc in each sc around – 12 sc. 
Round 3: [Sc in first sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times changing to A in last sc – 18 sc.
Round 4: Sc in each sc around changing to C in last sc.
Round 5: Sc in each sc around changing to A in last sc.
Round 6: Sc in each sc around changing to B in last sc.
Rounds 7-9: Sc in each sc around. At end of Round 9, slip st in next sc. Fasten off. Weave in all ends.
SCARF
With A, ch 4.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across; turn – 3 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across changing to B in last sc; turn.
Rows 3-68: Repeat Row 2 working color sequence as follows: [next 2 rows B, 2 rows C, 2 rows A] 11 times. Fasten off. Weave in all ends.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each of 254 Pumpkin A, 312 Black B
Yarn needle, two ½”-5⁄8” (12-15 mm) buttons
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Cuff measures 6” (15 cm) long and 2½” (6.5 cm) wide.
gauge: 16 sts = 4” (10 cm); 14 rows = 4” (10 cm) in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
With A, ch 24.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across—23 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, with A, sc in first 7 sc, sc2tog; with B, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc; with A, sc2tog, sc in last 7 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, with A, sc in first 6 sc, sc2tog; with B, 2 sc in next sc; [with A, sc in next sc; with B, sc in next sc] twice, with A, sc in next sc; with B, 2 sc in next sc; with A, sc2tog, sc in last 6 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, turn, with A, sc in each sc across.
Row 5: Ch 1, turn, with A, sc in first 10 sc; with B, sc in next 3 sc; with A, sc in last 10 sc.
Row 6: Ch 1, turn, with A, sc in first 9 sc, 2 sc in next sc; with B, sc3tog; with A, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last 9 sc.
Row 7: Ch 1, turn, with A, sc in first 7 sc; with B, sc in next 3 sc; with A, sc in next 3 sc; with B, sc in next 3 sc; with A, sc in last 7 sc
Row 8: Ch 1, turn, with A, sc in first 6 sc, 2 sc in next sc; with B, sc3tog; with A, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc; with B, sc3tog; with A, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last 6 sc.
Row 9: Ch 1, turn, with A, sc in each sc across.
Button Loops and Edging: Working in ends of rows down side of piece, sc in end of Row 9, [ch 3, skip ends of next 3 rows, sc in end of next row] twice, slip st evenly spaced across lower edge of piece, side edge, and in all sts of Row 9; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING: Sew buttons opposite button loops. Weave in ends.
Special Stitches: sc2tog = [Draw up a loop in next st] twice, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
sc3tog = [Draw up a loop in next st] 3 times, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
Note: 1. Work tightly for a firm cuff.
2. To change color, work last stitch of old color to last yarn over. Yarn over with new color and draw through all loops on hook to complete stitch. Drop old color to the wrong side. Proceed with new color. Do not cut old color. Carry old color evenly across wrong side of work when next needed.
3. Decreases, increases, and color changes are used to create the pumpkin face. Each row has the same number of decreases and increases, so the stitch count remains the same throughout.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Classic Crochet Thread, Size 10: 1 ball each 480 Delft A, 001 White B, and 421 Goldenrod C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 2.75 mm [C-2 US] and 3.75mm [F-5 US]
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Menorah measures 5¼” (13.5 cm) wide x 4½” tall (11.5 cm) after blocking.
gauge: With 3.75mm [F-5] hook and holding two strands together, 5 sc = 1” (2.5 cm), 6 rows sc = 1” (2.5 cm). Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
Base
With larger hook and 2 strands of A held together, ch 12.
Row 1 (wrong side): Sc in 2nd ch and in each ch across, turn—11 sc.
Row 2 (right side): Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first sc, sc2tog, sc in next 5 sc, sc2tog, sc in last sc, turn—9 sts
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn—9 sc.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in next 5 sc, sc2tog, turn—7 sts.
Row 6: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn—7 sc.
Row 7: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog, turn—5 sts.
Rows 8–11: Ch 1, sc in each st, turn—5 sc.
Row 12: Ch 1, sc in each sc, ch 11, drop hook from yarn; holding 2 new strands of A together and with right side facing, join thread with slip st to last st of previous row, ch 10; fasten off these strands and drop hook—5 sc and 21 ch.

Candles
Note: When working with A, carry B behind A and work stitches over B. When working with B, do not carry, but drop A.
Row 15: Ch 1, slip st in first sc, sc in next sc, changing to B in last 2 loops; ch 6, slip st in 2nd ch from hook; sc in next 4 chs, changing to A in last 2 loops (candle made); *sc in same sc as candle; sc in next 3 sc, changing to B in last 2 loops; ch 6, slip st in 2nd ch from hook; sc in next 4 chs, changing to A in last 2 loops (candle made)**; repeat from * twice; sc in same sc as candle; sc in next 3 sc, changing to B in last 2 loops; ch 9; sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 7 chs, changing to A in last 2 loops (candle made); repeat from * 4 times, ending last repeat at **; sc in same sc as last candle; leave last st unworked—9 candles. 
Fasten off A and cut B.

Flames
With wrong side facing and smaller hook, join one strand of C with slip st in slip st of candle, ch 3, turn, sc in 2nd ch from hook and next ch, slip st in unworked loop at top of candle. Fasten off. Repeat for each candle.

FINISHING
Weave in all ends before blocking. If desired, apply sealant to flames. Stretch the piece and pin in place, ensuring the row of candles is straight and each candle is blocked to its longest length. Apply stiffener and allow to dry completely before attaching gift tie or Hanging Loop.

Gift Tie 
With 2 strands of A held together, work as many chs as needed for 13” (33 cm) length; fasten off. With right side facing, thread ends of tie in space between 2nd and 3rd sc and 4th and 5th sc of Row 13. Gently pull to wrong side and tie to package.

Hanging loop 
With smaller hook and one strand of C, work as many chs as needed for desired length; slip st in first ch to form a loop. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Sew to wrong side of flame of center candle. Weave in remaining ends.

materials: RED HEART® Luster Sheen®: 1 ball 0915 Cherry Red
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 3.75 mm [US F-5]
30 sewing pins, 5” (12.5 cm) x 5” (12.5 cm) piece of Styrofoam® at least ½” (13 mm) thick
2” (5 cm) piece of ¾” (2 cm) red “hook and loop” Sew-on fastener such as Velcro
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Celtic Knot measures: 3” wide x 5” long (8 wide x 13 long cm). To Fit Waist: 25-27 (28-30, 31-33, 35-37)” [63.5-68.5 (71-76, 79-84, 89-94) cm]. Finished Waist: 27 (30, 33, 37)” [8.5 976, 84, 94) cm]
gauge: 20 sts = 4” (10 cm); 20 rows = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
FINISHING
Using straight pins, pin Knot Diagram onto Styrofoam block. With right sides facing up, lay out all 4 cords on work surface. Mark 2 cords (A & B) with a pin 8” (21 cm) in from the left side (approximately 35 sc). Mark 2 cords (C & D) with a pin 8” (20.5 cm) in from the right side (approximately 35 sc)
Step 1: Place Cord A on Knot Diagram lining up pin with * on diagram and laying 8” (21 cm) on the left. Continue to lay the right-hand side of Cord A on the diagram following the path of the knot (see arrows). Use pins to hold cord in place.
Step 2: Place Cord C on Knot Diagram lining up pin with ** on diagram and laying 8” (21 cm) on the right. Continue to lay the left-hand side of Cord C on the diagram following the path of the knot (see arrows). Use pins to hold cord in place. Make sure to pass over and under correctly.
Repeat Step 1 with Cord B so Cord B lays side-by-side with Cord A, making sure to pass over and under correctly.
Repeat Step 2 with Cord D so Cord D lays side-by-side with Cord C.
Remove all pins and knot from block. Carefully adjust the knot gradually by pulling the cord ends so there are no spaces between the woven cords. Make sure there is at least 7½” (19 cm) of each cord on the left and right side of the knot. (see Diagram 2)
Assembling the Belt
Lay the woven cords right side up on work surface. Measure 7” (18 cm) out from the right and left side of the knot and mark with a pin on each cord.

CROCHET CORD (make 4)
Ch 145.
Row 1 (Right Side): Working in the back bar of each ch, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across—144 sc. Cord should measure 29” (74 cm) long. Fasten off, leaving a long sewing length.

BACK CLOSURE TAB (make 2)
Ch 12.
Row 1 (right side): Working in back bar of each ch, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn—11 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Rows 3–21 (28, 35, 45): Repeat Row 2.
NOTE: For larger belt, add more rows to Closure Tab. Fasten off, leaving a long sewing length.

NOTE: It is fine if the length of the cords vary. Their ends will be hidden under the closure tabs.
Step 3: With right side facing up, line up a Back Closure Tab with the 7” (18 cm) mark across all 4 cords. Pin cords onto back of tab using photo as a guide. Repeat Step 3 with other Back Closure Tab and other side of cords. Using a yarn needle and sewing lengths, sew all cords to the wrong side of the Closure Tabs. Weave in ends.
Using a yarn needle and a length of yarn, sew together all cords (A to B and C to D) on wrong side of knot. Continue to sew cords together around edges of knot so there are no gaps between the paired cords. Weave in all ends.
Separate 2” (5 cm) piece of Hook and Loop Sew-on Fastener – Using sewing needle and matching thread, sew on fastener at edge of Back Closure Tab, adjusting for proper fit. Repeat with other piece of fastener so that it aligns with first piece. The fastening edges of the Back Closure Tabs should overlap approximately 1” (2.5 cm).
Wet block belt unfastened with all cords extending out from knot neatly. Allow to dry overnight. Do not steam block belt or belt will lose its ability to stretch and fit snuggly.

materials: RED HEART® Anne Geddes Baby™: 1 ball 801 Bluebell
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Bowtie measures 9” long (23 cm) with 11” (28 cm) neckband circumference
gauge: GAUGE: 6 sc = 1” (2.5 cm) in pattern; 5 rows = 1” (2.5 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook/needles to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
BOWTIE
Tie
Ch 2.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook, turn—1 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, 3 sc in sc, turn—3 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in next sc, 2 sc in last sc, turn—5 sc.
Rows 4–6: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each sc to last sc, 2 sc in last sc, turn—13 sc.
Note: Continue working in back loops only until instructed otherwise.
Rows 7–8: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each remaining sc, turn—13 sc.
Row 9–12: Ch 1, sc in each sc, turn.
Row 13: Ch 1, slip st in first sc, sc in each sc, turn—12 sc and 1 slip st.
Row 14: Ch 1, slip st in first sc, sc in each sc, slip st in last slip st, turn—11 sc and 2 slip st.
Row 15: Ch 1, skip first slip st, sc in each sc, slip st in last slip st, turn—11 sc and 1 slip st.
Row 16: Ch 1, skip first slip st, sc in each sc, turn—11 sc.
Row 17: Repeat Row 9.
Row 18: Ch 1, sc in first st, *ch 1, skip next st, sc in next st; repeat from * across, turn—6 sc and 5 ch-1 spaces.
Row 19: Ch 1, sc in first st, sc in next ch-1 space, *ch 1, skip next st, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to last st, sc in last st, turn—7 sc and 4 ch-1 spaces.
Row 20: Ch 1, sc in first st, *ch 1, skip next st, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to last 2 st, ch 1, skip next st, sc in last st, turn—6 sc and 5 ch-1 spaces.
Rows 21–26: Repeat Rows 19 and 20 three times.
Row 27: Ch 1, sc in first st, *sc in next ch-1 space, sc in next st; repeat from * to last st, sc in last st, turn—11 sc.
Row 28–31: Repeat Row 9.
Rows 32–35: Repeat Rows 13–16—9 sc.
Rows 36–38: Repeat Row 9.
Rows 39–41: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc to last 2 st, sc2tog, turn—3 sc.
Row 42: Repeat Row 9. Place marker on end of row for placement of cinch band.
Rows 43-47: Repeat Row 4—13 sc. Do not turn at end of Row 47.
Neck Band
Row 48: Ch 29, working through back bar, slip st in 6th ch from hook (buttonhole loop made) and in each ch across, working through back loops only, sc in each st, ch 29, working through back bar, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; join with slip st in end of row. Fasten off.
Cinch Band
Ch 9.
Row 1: Working in back bar, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across—8 st. Fasten off, leaving long tail for sewing.

materials: RED HEART® Boutique Ribbons®: 1 ball 1938 City
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Finished Width: 4” (10 cm), Finished Length: 38 (40, 44)” (96.5 (101.5, 112) cm)
gauge: Gauge is not essential for this project.
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com and www.crochettoday.com
©2013 Coats & Clark

It’s easy to add a bit of glamour to your look with this ruffled collar. Crocheted with ribbon type yarn that has a beautiful sheen, it can take a plain top into dinner party mode.

Note: In Rows 2 and 3, when instructed to “insert hook in opening in ladder, insert hook into an opening of the ladder that is closest to the hook. This may require skipping 1-3 openings between insertions.

Row 2 (right side): Rotate piece to work across the band side of Row 1, insert hook through outer edge of band, insert hook into opening in ladder of working yarn and draw st through band (2 sts on hook), insert hook in next opening in ladder of working yarn and draw through both sts on hook (single crochet made – 1 st remains on hook), *insert hook from front to back through each of the next 3 openings in ladder of working yarn (4 sts on hook), draw the first st on hook through the other 3 sts on hook (1 st remains on hook), insert hook through outer edge of band of Row 1 at next natural ruffle (about 1½” (4 cm) from last insert location), insert hook in opening in ladder of working yarn and draw st through band (2 sts on hook), insert hook in next opening in ladder of working yarn and draw through both sts on hook (1 st remains on hook); repeat from * all the way across Row 1.

Cut yarn, leaving a 5” (12.5 cm) tail to weave in.

Row 3 (right side): With right side facing and beginning about 6 (6, 7)” (15 (15, 18) cm) from beginning edge of Row 2, insert hook through outer edge of band side of Row 2, insert hook into next opening in ladder of working yarn about 5” (12.5 cm) from beginning of yarn and draw through band (1 st on hook), *insert hook from front to back through each of the next 3 openings in ladder of working yarn, draw the first st on hook through the other 4 sts on hook, insert hook through outer edge of band of Row 2 at next natural ruffle (about 1½” (4 cm) from last insert location), insert hook into opening in ladder of working yarn and draw st through band (2 sts on hook), insert hook in next opening in ladder of working yarn and draw through both sts on hook; repeat from * across to the last 6 (6, 7)” (15 (15, 18) cm) of Row 2, leave these last 6 (6, 7)” (15 (15, 18) cm) unworked.

Cut yarn leaving 5” (12.5 cm) tail to weave in.

FINISHING
Weave all ends into the ruffles, pull ends through and trim.

materials: RED HEART® Soft Baby Steps®: 1 ball 9620 Baby Green
Stitch markers, two ¼–¾” [6-19 mm] buttons, yarn needle.
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: To Fit: 3-6 months; Sole Length: 4½” [11.5 cm]; Sole Width: 2½” [6.5 cm]
gauge: 16 sts = 4” [10 cm]; 16 rows = 4” [10 cm] in single crochet (sc). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SANDAL (make 2)
Sole
Ch 12.
Round 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 9 ch, 3 sc in last ch; working along opposite side of foundation ch, sc in next 9 ch, 2 sc in same ch as first sc; join with slip st in first sc—24 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in same st as joining slip st, sc in next 9 sts, 2 sc in each of next 3 sts, sc in next 9 sts, 2 sc in each of last 2 sts; join with slip st in first sc—30 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in same st as joining slip st, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 9 sc, [sc in next st, 2 sc in next st] 3 times, sc in next 9 sts, [sc in next st, 2 sc in next st] twice; join with slip st in first sc—36 sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, 2 sc in same st as joining slip st, sc in next 11 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts] 3 times, sc in next 9 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts] twice; join with slip st in first sc—42 sc.
Round 5: Ch 1, sc in same st as joining slip st, sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 12 sts, 2 sc in next st, [sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st] twice, sc in next 12 sts, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in last st; join with slip st in first sc—48 sc.
Fasten off.
Hold Sole with right side facing you. Counting from the first stitch of Round 5, place a marker in the 2nd, 6th, 16th, 30th, 40th, and 44th stitches.

Back of Heel
Hold Sole with wrong side facing you, draw up a loop of yarn in the 2nd st (marked).
Row 1: Ch 1, BPsc around the same st as joining, BPsc around each of next 6 sts (the last BPsc you work will be around the 44th st of Round 5); leave remaining sts unworked—7 sts. Remove the marker in the 2nd and 44th sts.
Rows 2–4: Ch 1, turn, working in front loops only, sc in each st across.
Fasten off.

Side 1
Hold Sole with wrong side facing you, draw up a loop of yarn in the 40th st (marked).
Row 1: Ch 1, BPsc around the same st as joining, BPsc around each of next 10 sts (the last BPsc you work will be around the 30th st of Round 5); leave remaining sts unworked—11 sts. Remove the marker in the 30th and 40th sts.
Rows 2–4: Ch 1, turn, working in front loops only, sc in each st across.
Fasten off.

Side 2
Hold Sole with wrong side facing you, draw up a loop of yarn in the 16th st (marked).
Row 1: Ch 1, BPsc around the same st as joining, BPsc around each of next 10 sts (the last BPsc you work will be around the 6th st of Round 5); leave remaining sts unworked—11 sts. Remove the marker in the 6th and 16th sts.
Rows 2–4: Ch 1, turn, working in front loops only, sc in each st across.
DO NOT fasten off.

Ankle Strap
