Round 1: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across Side 2, ch 2, sc in each st across Back of Heel, ch 2, sc in each st across Side 1, ch 1; sc in end of each of the 4 rows along edge of Side 1, BPsc around each of the next 13 unworked sts of Sole; sc in end of each of the 4 rows along edge of Side 2, ch 1; join with slip st in first sc—42 sc, 2 ch-2 spaces, and 2 ch-1 spaces.
Round 2: [Slip st in each st to next ch-2 space, 2 sc in ch-2 space] twice, slip st in next 11 sts (to first ch-1 space); leave remaining sts unworked.
Fasten off.

Button Loop
Work chains to make a loop larger enough to fit around one of your chosen buttons. Fold the chain in half to form loop and sew ends to top corner of side 1 of one sandal. Sew one button to top corner of side 2 of same sandal. Repeat to attach a loop to top corner of side 2 of remaining sandal and button to top corner of side 1. Note: Sandal shown has ch-8 button loops and ½" [13 mm] buttons.
Weave in any remaining ends.

materials: RED HEART® Reflective™: 1 ball 8704 Neon Pink
sewing needle and thread to match
measurements: Cuff measures 2½” wide x 8¼ (9¼, 10¼)” long (6.5 x [21 (23.5, 26.5) cm])
gauge: 14 sts = 5” (12.5 cm); 3 rows = 1¼” (3 cm), in pattern. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
CUFF (make 2)
Ch 24 (27, 30). 
Row 1: Hdc in 3rd ch from hook (beginning ch counts as first hdc), hdc in each ch across, turn—23 (26, 29) hdc.
Row 2: Ch 2 (does not count as first st here and throughout), hdc in first st, ch 1, skip next st, hdc in remaining sts, turn—22 (25, 28) hdc and 1 ch-1 space.
Row 3: Ch 2, hdc in each st and ch-1 space, turn—23 (26, 29) hdc.
Rows 4 and 5: Repeat Rows 2 and 3.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew buttons to opposite ends of rows with buttonholes.
Weave in ends.

pattern_name: Red Heart Cares Crochet First Aid Kit
materials: RED HEART® Super Saver® Accent™: 1 skein 361 Putty A or RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein 3950 Charcoal A
AUNT LYDIA’S® Fashion Crochet Size 3, Art. 182 available 100% Mercerized Cotton, 150 yd (147m) balls
RED HEART® Super Saver® Accent™, Art. E303 available in 4 oz (113 g), 202 yd (184 m) skein
RED HEART® Super Saver®, Art. E300 available in solid color 7 oz (198 g), 364 yd (333 m) skein
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 3.75mm [US F-5], 3.5mm [US E-4] and 2.25mm [US B-1]
Stitch markers, yarn needle, four size 4 black brass sew-on snaps for inner pocket flaps, two ⅞” [22 mm] brushed metal buttons for outer flap closure, matching sewing thread, needle and straight pins
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Kit measures 8” [20.5 cm] wide x 8” [20.5 cm] tall x 3” [7.5 cm] deep when folded.
gauge: 15 sc = 4” [10 cm]; 15 rows = 4” [10 cm] in single crochet using size 3.75mm [US F-5] crochet hook and A.
instructions:
NOTES
1. This retro-look tri-fold Red Cross inspired first aid kit is designed to hold lots of bulky first aid supplies with the help of two gusseted pockets for better organization. Snaps on the inner flaps keep the items secure in the pockets.
2. Pieces are worked separately and are sewn together. Leave long ends at beginning and end of pieces for sewing. Two Pockets are joined by a gusset piece along bottom edges. Pockets are gusseted and worked in the round for smoother look.
3. Some steps are worked back and forth in rows and others are worked in the round.
4. The iconic Red Cross logo is worked with a small hook, using size 3 crochet thread, for a more finely detailed look, and is sewn together using hand-sewing thread.

SPECIAL TECHNIQUES
Adjustable loop ring: Holding the thread a few inches [cms] from the end, wrap around your finger. Do not remove wrap from finger, insert hook into the wrap and draw up a loop of working thread. Chain one to secure the loop and remove ring from finger. Work stitches of first round in the ring. Pull gently, but firmly, on tail to tighten ring.

SPECIAL ABBREVIATIONS
sc2tog: [Draw up a loop in next st] twice, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.

KIT
POCKET (make 2)
Beginning at bottom pocket gusset with A and size 3.75mm [US F-5] crochet hook, ch 31.
Row 1: Working in back bumps only, sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across – 30 sts. 
Rows 2-5: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across. 
Round 6: Begin working in rounds, ch 1, turn, working in back loops only, sc in each st across, turn to work along side edge, sc 5 sts evenly spaced along side edge, turn to work along opposite edge of foundation ch, sc in next 30 ch, turn to work along opposite side edge, sc 5 sts evenly spaced along side edge – 70 sc. Place marker for beginning of round. Place marker in first st for placement of Bottom Gusset.
Rounds 7-31: Working in continuous rounds, sc in each st around.

Shape Inner Pocket Flap
Row 32: Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in next 30 sts, leave remaining sts unworked – 30 sts.
Rows 33-37: Ch 2 (counts as first hdc here and throughout), turn, hdc in each st across.
Row 38: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across. 
Fasten off. 

BOTTOM GUSSET 
Row 1: With right side facing and size 3.75mm [US F-5] crochet hook, join A to unused loop of marked st of Round 6 with a slip st, ch 1, working in unused loops, sc in same st and in next 29 sts – 30 sc. 
Rows 2-9: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across. 
Fasten off.
Sew edges of Row 9 to unused loops of Round 6 of second Pocket. Pocket Flaps should face each other when folded together. 

OUTER FLAP
With size 3.5mm [US E-4] crochet hook and A, ch 32.
Row 1: Working in back bumps only, sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across – 31 sts. 
Rows 2-28: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across.
Row 29: Ch 1, turn, skip first st, sc in next 28 sts, sc2tog – 29 sts.
Row 30: Ch 1, turn, skip first st, sc in next 26 sts, sc2tog – 27 sts.
Row 31: Ch 1, turn, skip first st, sc in next 24 sts, sc2tog – 25 sts.
Row 32: Ch 1, turn, skip first st, sc in next 22 sts, sc2tog – 23 sts. Fasten off.
Row 33: With right side facing, size 3.5mm [US E-4] crochet hook, join A with a slip st in first row of Outer Flap, slip st evenly spaced around sides and last row of Outer Flap, leave opposite edge of foundation ch unworked. Fasten off.

Sew Outer Flap to unworked loops of Row 32 on Pocket 1. Fasten off.

RED CROSS LOGO
Center Cross
With size 2.25mm [US B-1] crochet hook and C, ch 19.
Row 1: Working in back bumps only, sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across – 18 sts. 
Rows 2-6: Ch 1, turn, sc each st across. 
Fasten off.

First Cross
Row 7: With right side facing and working along last row, skip first 6 sts, join C in next st with a slip st, ch 1, sc in same st, sc in next 5 sts, leave remaining sts unworked – 6 sts.
Rows 8-12: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across. 
Fasten off. 

Second Cross
Working along opposite edge of foundation ch, repeat Rows 7-12 of First Cross. 

WHITE CIRCLE
With size 2.25mm [US B-1] crochet hook and B, make an adjustable loop.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in adjustable loop – 6 sts. 
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each st around, slip st in first sc to join – 12 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, [sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times, slip st in first sc to join – 18 sts.
Round 4: Ch 1, [sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times, sc in space before join, slip st in first sc – 25 sc. 
Round 5: Ch 1, [sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc] 6 times, sc in last st, slip st in first sc – 31 sc.
Round 6: Ch 1, [sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc] 6 times, sc in last sc, slip st in first sc – 37 sc. 
Round 7: Ch 1, [sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc] 6 times, sc in last sc, slip st in first sc – 43 sc. 
Round 8: Ch 1, [sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 4 sc] 6 times, 2 sc in last sc, slip st in first sc – 50 sc. 
Round 9: Ch 1, [sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc] 6 times, sc in last 2 sc, slip st in first sc – 56 sc. 
Round 10: Ch 1, [sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 6 sc] 6 times, sc in last 2 sc, slip st in first sc – 62 sc. 
Round 11: Ch 1, [sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 4 sc] 6 times, sc in last 2 sc, slip st in first sc – 68 sc. 
Round 12: Ch 1, [sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 5 sc] 6 times, sc in last 2 sc, slip st in first sc – 74 sc. 
Round 13: Ch 1, [sc in next 6 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 5 sc] 6 times, sc in last 2 sc, slip st in first sc – 80 sc. 
Fasten off. 

FINISHING
Sew female side of 2 snaps on right side of each Pocket, about 1” [25 mm] down from last edge before Pocket Flap shaping and 5” [12.5 cm] apart. Sew corresponding male part on wrong side along top edge of Pocket Flaps. 
Fold Pocket fronts together, lining up edges. 
Fold Outer Flap over top edge of Pockets to outside edge of Pocket 2. Sew two buttons, 5” [12.5 cm] apart, just below bind-off edge of Outer Flap. 
Buttonloops
With right side facing and using size 3.75mm [US F-5] crochet hook, join A along edge of Outer Flap with a slip st, lining up with button, ch 5, slip st in next st on Outer Flap. Fasten off. 
Repeat to make second buttonloop above second button. 
Sew Red Cross in center on right side of White Circle. Sew Circle on right side of Outer Flap. 
Weave in ends.

materials: Caron® Colorama Haze™ (8 oz/227 g; 649 yds/593 m)
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice
measurements: To fit calf circumference with approx 2" [5 cm] positive ease. XS/S/M 14" [35.5 cm], L/XL/2XL 15½" [39.5 cm], 3/4/5XL 17" [43 cm]
gauge: 12 sts and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm] in Rib Pat.
instructions: The instructions are written for XS/S/M. If changes are necessary for larger size the instructions will be written XS/S/M (L/XL/2XL-3/4/5XL). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes. Upper Ribbing Ch 12. 1st row: 1 sl st in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sl st in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 11 sl sts. 2nd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sl st in each sl st to end of row. Turn. Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 12 (14-16)" [30.5 (35.5-40.5) cm], when slightly stretched. Turn work sideways. Leg: 1st row: (RS). Ch 2 (does not count as st here and throughout). Work 45 (49-55) hdc evenly across side edge of Upper Ribbing. Turn. 2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. *1 dcbp around next st. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 3rd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. *1 dcfp around next st. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. Rep 2nd and 3rd rows until work from beg measures 19 (20-22)" [48.5 (51-56) cm]. Fasten off. Lower Ribbing Ch 6. 1st row: 1 sl st in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sl st in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 5 sl sts. 2nd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sl st in each sl st to end of row. Turn. Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 15 (16½-18)" [38 (42-45.5) cm], when slightly stretched. Fasten off. Align Lower Ribbing with bottom of Leg with RS tog. Work 45 (49-55) sl sts through both thicknesses of Leg and Lower Ribbing to join. Fasten off. Place marker on side edges 4" [10 cm] up from bottom edge. Sew inseam from top edge to markers, leaving bottom 4" [10 cm] open.

materials: STITCH NATION by Debbie Stoller™ Full o’ Sheep™: 1 ball each 2705 Peony A and 2640 Thyme B
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C etc
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Flower measures 5” diameter before felting; 4” diameter after felting.
gauge: Gauge is not important, but the stitches need to be loose to felt the yarn successfully.
instructions:
ROSE
Flower
Round 1: With A, ch 3; join with slip st to first ch forming a ring. Ch 1, [(sc, ch 2, 2 dc, ch 2) in ring] 5 times; join to first sc – 5 petals.
Round 2: Working behind the petals, ch 1, slip st into back of first sc, ch 2; [slip st into the back of the next sc, ch 2] 4 times; join to first slip st – 5 ch-2 spaces.
Round 3: Ch 1; [(sc, ch 2, 3 dc, ch 2, sc) in next ch-2 space] 5 times; join to first sc – 5 petals.
Round 4: Working behind the petals, ch 1, slip st into back of first sc; [ch 2, skip 1 dc, slip st into the 2 strands at the base of the next dc, ch 2, slip st into the upside down “V” formed by the last sc of one petal and the first sc of the next petal] 4 times; ch 2, skip 1 dc, slip st into back of next dc, ch 2, join to first slip st – 10 ch-2 spaces.
Round 5: Ch 1, [(sc, ch 2, 3 dc, ch 2, sc), in next ch-2 space] 10 times; join to first sc – 10 petals.
Fasten off and weave in ends.
Leaves (Make 2)
Center Vein: With B, ch 7; working into the back of the chains, slip st into the second ch from the hook, slip st in next 5 ch, ch 1 – 6 slip sts.
Round 1: Starting on the opposite side and working into the back loops of the center vein; (slip st, ch 1, hdc) into first ch, dc into next 3 ch, hdc in next ch, sc in next ch, (slip st, ch 2, slip st) into back loop of turning chain; working down the slip st side, sc in next slip st, hdc in next slip st, dc in next 3 slip sts, (hdc, ch 1, slip st) into last slip st; join to turning ch – 16 sts.
Fasten off and weave in ends.

felted rose pin
Add a bright flower to anything you please! This flower is crocheted and then felted so it will last indefinitely. It’s definitely a great idea for updating your look or for gifting.

Backing
Round 1: With A, ch 2, 6 sc in second ch from the hook; join to first sc – 6 sc.
Round 2: Ch1, 2 sc in each sc; join to first sc – 12 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in next sc; [2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc] 5 times; join to first sc – 18 sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in next 2 sc; [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc] 5 times; join to first sc – 24 sc. 
Fasten off and weave in ends.

Felting
Before assembling the flower, put the pieces into pillowcases and tie closed. Place them in a washing machine with hot water and a small amount of detergent. Check during the wash cycle regularly until desired amount of felting is achieved. Rinse soap and squeeze out excess water. Block into desired shapes and let dry. Hint: Overlap the outer petals of the rose, pin into place and let dry.

ASSEMBLY
Sew bead or button into the middle of the rose. Arrange two leaves on the back of rose; pin into place and stitch to the rose with B. Place backing on the rose, over the leaves; pin and stitch into place with A. Sew bar pin onto back.

materials: Patons® Grace™ (1.75 oz/50 g; 136 yds/125 m) Night (62040) 1 ball or 66 yds/ 60 m
Size U.S. F/5 (3.75 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Picot = Ch 3. Sl st in 3rd ch from hook.
measurements: Approx 8½" [21.5 cm] wide across Armband, excluding Button Loops and Picots. Approx 7¼" [18.5 cm] long, excluding Finger Loop.
gauge: 21 sc and 24 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
Notes:
• Ch 5 at beg of row counts as dc and ch-2 sp.
• Ch 3 at beg of row counts as dc.
Wristers (Make 2 alike).
Armband
Ch 36. See diagram on page 3.
1st row: Set-up row. (RS). 1 dc in 6th ch from hook (counts as dc and ch-2 sp). *Ch 3. Skip next 4 ch. 1 sc in next ch. Ch 3. Skip next 4 ch.** (1 dc. Ch 5. 1 dc) all in next ch. Rep from * once, then from * to ** once. (1 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in last ch. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *Ch 3. (1 dc. Ch 5. 1 dc) all in next sc. Ch 3. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp. Rep from * twice more. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 5 (counts as dc and ch-2 sp). 1 dc in first sc. *Ch 3. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp. Ch 3.** (1 dc. Ch 5. 1 dc) all in next sc. Rep from * once, then from * to ** once. (1 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in last sc. Turn.
4th and 5th rows: Rep 2nd and 3rd rows once more.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. 1 sc in ch-2 sp. 1 sc in next dc. *3 sc in next ch-3 sp. Skip next sc. 3 sc in next ch-3 sp.** Skip next dc. 6 sc in next ch-5 sp. Skip next dc. Rep from * once, then from * to ** once. 1 sc in next dc. 1 sc in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in last dc. Turn. 36 sc.
7th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 9 sc. Ch 3. Skip next 2 sc. Sl st in next sc. Ch 10. Skip next 12 sc. Sl st in next sc. Ch 3. Skip next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 9 sc.
Do not fasten off.
Cont for Button Band as follows:
Button Band
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. Working around sts down side edge of Armband, work 13 sc evenly across. Turn.
2nd to 4th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Do not fasten off.
Cont for Edging as follows:
Edging: 1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. (Picot. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) 4 times. (Picot. Sc) in same sp as last sc. Working around sts at edge of Button Band, 1 sc in each of next 2 rows. Picot. 1 sc in next row. Working into ch sps of foundation ch, (2 sc. Picot. 3 sc) in first ch-4 sp. *(Picot. 3 sc. Picot. 2 sc) in next ch-4 sp. (1 sc. Picot. 3 sc. Picot. 1 sc) in next ch-4 sp.* (2 sc. Picot. 3 sc.) in next ch-4 sp. Rep from * to * once more. Working around sts at edge of Armband, [2 sc. Ch 6. Sl st in 6th ch from hook – button loop made. (4 sc. Ch 6. Sl st in 6th ch from hook) twice. 2 sc] evenly up side edge of Armband. Fasten off.
Hand Top
With RS facing, join with sl st to first ch-3 sp of 7th row of Armband.
1st row: (RS). Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same ch-3 sp as sl st. Ch 3. 5 sc in ch-12 sp. Ch 3. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in last ch-3 sp. Turn.
2nd row: Sl st in each of first 3 dc and ch-2 sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same ch-2 sp as last sl st. Ch 2. 2 hdc in next sc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 sc. 2 hdc in next sc. Ch 2. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in last ch-2 sp. Turn.
3rd row: Sl st in each of first 3 dc and ch-2 sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same ch-2 sp as last sl st. Ch 1. 1 hdc in first hdc. Ch 4. Skip next 2 hdc. 1 sc in next hdc. Ch 4. Skip next 2 hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in last ch-2 sp. Turn.
4th row: Sl st in each of first 3 dc and ch-2 sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same ch-2 sp as last sl st. Ch 2. 2 sc in next ch-4 sp. Ch 1. 2 sc in next ch-4 sp. Ch 2. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in last ch-2 sp. Turn.
5th row: Sl st in each of first 3 dc and ch-2 sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same ch-2 sp as last sl st. Ch 3. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sc. 1 sc in ch-1 sp. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sc. Ch 3. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in last ch-2 sp. Turn.
6th row: Sl st in each of first 3 dc and ch-2 sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same ch-2 sp as last sl st. Ch 1. 1 sc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 sts. 1 sc in next hdc. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in last ch-2 sp. Turn.
7th row: Sl st in each of first 3 dc and ch-2 sp. Ch 3. 2 dc in same ch-2 sp as last sl st. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 hdc. Skip next sc. Ch 1. 3 dc in last ch-2 sp. Turn.
8th row: Ch 3. Skip next 9 sts (dc, sc, and ch sps). Sl st in last dc. Turn.
9th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in ch-3 sp. Ch 14. Sl st in 14th ch from hook – Finger Loop made. 2 sc in ch-3 sp. Turn.
10th row: Sl st in each of first 2 sc. Work 16 sc into Finger Loop opening. Sl st in next sc. Fasten off.
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Holiday®: 1 skein 9090 Red/Red A and 140 White/Silver B
double-sided tape or hot glue gun
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Red bow measures approximately 4” (10cm) wide; white bow measures approximately 6” (15cm) wide.
gauge: Gauge is not essential for this project.
instructions:
RED BOW
Center Rosette
[With A, ch 14, dc in 3rd ch from hook and in each ch across, fold in half and sc through first and last dc to join] 10 times—10 loops. Fasten off. Draw tail through all 10 sc and pull tightly to form rosette. Secure.
Curls
[With A, ch 20, 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across] 3 times. Sew behind bow.
WHITE BOW
With B, ch 9.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across, turn—8 sc.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as first dc), dc in each sc across, turn—8 dc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each dc across, turn.
Rows 4 – 29: Repeat rows 2 and 3 for pattern. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Fold in half and sew first and last rows tog (center seam of bow).
Tie Ends (make 2)
With B, ch 9.
Rows 1 – 7: Repeat Rows 1 – 7 of bow.
Row 8: Ch 4 (counts as tr), tr in next st, dc in next st, hdc in next st, (slip st, hdc) in next st, dc in next st, tr in last 2 sts. Fasten off. Sew each tie to center back of bow.
Knot
With B, ch 6.
Rows 1 – 9: Work same as Rows 1 – 9 of bow—5 sts. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Wrap around center of bow and sew in place.

materials: RED HEART® Soft®: 1 ball of 9010 Charcoal or 9851 Royal Blue A
RED HEART® Boutique Sashay®: 1 ball of 1936 Waltz or 1870 Blue B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5 mm [US H-8]
Yarn needle, sewing needle and matching thread.
abbreviations: * = Directions are for size small; changes for medium and large are in parentheses.
measurements: Finished Size: 9 (11½,14)” (23 (29,35.5) cm) circumference x 8” (20.5 cm) long, unstretched
gauge: 17 sts = 4” (10 cm); 16 rows = 4” (10 cm) in pattern.
instructions:
BOOT TOPPER (Make 2)
With A, ch 21.
Row 1 (Right side): Sc in second ch from hook and in each ch across: 20 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn; sc in each sc across in back loop only.
Rows 3-40 (50, 60): Repeat Row 2, at the end of Row 40(50,60) fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing.
FINISHING
Thread yarn needle with long end. With wrong sides together, sew Row 40 (50, 60) to foundation ch.
RUFFLE
Yarn Note: Stretch one end of B open for 10” (25.5 cm) and lay flat, with the edge with the metallic thread at the bottom. Work stitches into the top two mesh loop threads of the yarn, leaving the metallic edge loose to form Ruffle.
With right side of Boot Topper facing, join eighth mesh loop of B with slip st in end of row.
Round 1 (Right side): *Skip next end of row st, skip next mesh loop, insert hook in next end of row st and next mesh loop and pull up a loop, skip next mesh loop, insert hook in next mesh loop, Yo and pull through 2 loops on hook (sc made); repeat from * around; join with slip st to first sc: 20 (25, 30) sc.
Round 2: *Skip next mesh loop, insert hook into next sc and next mesh loop, skip next mesh loop, Yo and pull through 2 loops on hook; repeat from * around; join with slip st to first sc.
Round 3: Repeat Round 2, fasten off.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m) Main Color (MC) Aruba Sea (0505) 1 ball or 57 yds/52 m
Contrast A Black (0312) 1 ball or 10 yds/9 m
Contrast B White (0311) 1 ball or 10 yds/9 m
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Lp st = Loop stitch (worked on WS) = Insert hook in next stitch. Wrap working yarn over top of index/finger, from front to back, to form loop. Placing tip of hook behind yarn at front of index/finger, Yoh and draw up a loop onto hook. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook, dropping loop off index/finger to back of work (see diagram). Loop will be formed on RS of work.
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 8" x 4" [20.5 x 10 cm], excluding ties.
gauge: 12 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
MASK (make 2 pieces alike)
Notes:
• Mask is worked from side to side and seamed in Finishing.
• Eyes are worked separately and sewn on.

With MC, ch 8.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 7 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 9 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 11 sc.
5th to 10th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
11th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of last 9 sc. Turn. 10 sc.
12th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to last sc. Turn.
13th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of last 8 sc. Turn. 9 sc.
14th and 15th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
16th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 8 sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 10 sc.
17th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. Turn.
18th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 9 sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 11 sc.
19th to 24th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. Turn.
25th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 9 sc.
26th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
27th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 7 sc.
28th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row.
Fasten off.

EYE
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: (RS). 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
2nd rnd: (RS). Join B with sl st to any sc. Ch 2 (counts as 1 dc). 2 dc in same sp as last sl st. 2 sc in each of next 2 sc. (2 dc. PM at top of last dc. 1 dc) all in next sc. 2 sc in each of next 2 sc. Join with sl st to top of first ch-2. Fasten off.
Turn work so WS is facing.
Next row (Eyelashes): (WS). Join A with sl st at marker. Ch 1. 1 Lp st in same st as last sl st. 1 Lp st in each of next 7 sts.
Fasten off.

EYELASH
With A, ch 9.
1st row: (WS). 1 Lp st in 2nd ch from hook. 1 Lp st in each ch to end of chain. 8 Lp sts.
Fasten off.

FINISHING
Attaching Eye and Eyelash: Sew Eye and Eyelash, approx 1½" [4 cm] apart, to RS of one Mask piece as shown in photo.
Joining Mask Pieces: Align 2 Mask pieces with WS facing each other. With RS facing (piece with eyes attached), join MC with sl st to any st of Mask. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work sc evenly around entire Mask. Join with sl st in first sc. Fasten off.
Right-side Tie: (RS). Join A with sl st to sc approx 1" [2.5 cm] down from top edge along RS of Mask. Ch 51. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Sl st in same space as first sl st. Fasten off.
Left-side Tie: Work as for Right-side Tie along left side of Mask.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Classic Crochet Thread, Size 10: 1 ball each 494 Victory Red A, 12 Black B, and 424 Peach C
AUNT LYDIA’S® Metallic Crochet Thread, Size 10: 1 ball 1P White/Pearl D
abbreviations: A, B, C, D = color A, B, C, D
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Assembled Santa measures 1¾” x 3” (4.4 x 8 cm)
gauge: 10 dc = 1” (4 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Hat
With A, ch 10.
Row 1 (Right Side): Hdc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn – 9 hdc.
Row 2: Ch 2, skip first st, dc in next st, dc in each st to last 2 sts, dc2tog; turn – 7 dc.
Rows 3 and 4: Repeat Row 2 – 3 dc.
Row 5: Ch 2, skip first dc, dc2tog; turn; turn – 2 dc.
Row 6: Ch 3, dc in next dc; turn – 2 dc.
Row 7: Ch 3, dc in next dc changing to B; turn.
Row 8: With B, ch 3, 2 dc in first dc, ch 1, turn, slip st in top of ch-3. Fasten off.
Beard
With D, ch 11.
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across; turn – 10 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, 2 hdc in each sc across; turn – 20 hdc.
Row 3: Ch 1, skip first hdc, slip st in next 5 hdc, skip next hdc, [3 hdc in next hdc] twice, tr in next 3 hdc, [3 hdc in next hdc] twice, skip next hdc, slip st in last 5 hdc. Fasten off. 
Finishing
Weave in ends. Block if pieces won’t lie flat. With right side facing on all pieces and following photo for placement, glue Arms to Body, glue Face to tip of Body, glue Beard and Hat on Face. Glue assembled Santa to front of card.
Special Abbreviation
dc2tog (worked over 2 sts) = [yarn over and draw up a loop in next st, yarn over and draw through 2 loops] twice, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
Body
With A, ch 17.
Row 1 (Right Side): Hdc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across; turn – 16 hdc.
Row 2: Ch 2, skip first st, dc in next st (counts as dc2tog), dc in each st to last 2 sts, dc2tog; turn – 14 dc.
Rows 3-7: Repeat Row 2 – 4 dc.
Row 8: Ch 1, skip first dc, hdc in next 2 dc, ch 1, slip st in last dc – 2 hdc. Fasten off.
Left Arm
With right side facing, join A in end of Row 5 of Body.
Row 1: Ch 1, 3 hdc around post of dc on Row 5 of Body; turn – 3 hdc
Rows 2-4: Ch 1, hdc in each hdc; turn. At end of Row 4 change to B.
Row 5: With B, ch 1, hdc in each hdc; turn.
Row 6: Ch 2, skip first hdc, 2 dc in next hdc, ch 2, slip st in last hdc. Fasten off.
Right Arm
With right side facing, join A in end of Row 5 of Body opposite Left Arm. Repeat Rows 1-6 of Left Arm.
Face
With C, ch 4; join with slip st to form ring; ch 1, 8 sc in ring; do NOT join; sc in each sc around without joining until circle measures 1” in diameter, working 2 sc in next sc whenever ...

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m) Version 1 Color 1 Ecru (00004) 1 ball or 10 yds/9 m
Color 2 Rose Pink (00046) 1 ball or 10 yds/9 m
Version 2 Color 1 Warm Brown (01130) 1 ball or 10 yds/9 m
Color 2 Soft Violet (00093) 1 ball or 10 yds/9 m
Version 3 Color 1 Ecru (00004) 1 ball or 10 yds/9 m
Color 2 Blueberry (01725) 1 ball or 10 yds/9 m
Anchor® Embroidery Floss in Black (0403). Embroidery needle.
Pair of safety eyes. Keychain clasp. Stuffing.
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 2" [5 cm] tall, excluding keychain clasp.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first sc.
Head
With Color 1, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Break Color 1. Join with Color 2.
6th rnd: With Color 2, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
7th and 8th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
9th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 12 sc.
Fasten safety eyes following manufacturer’s directions. Stuff Head firmly.
10th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 6 times. Join. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts.

Ears (make 2)
With Color 2, ch 3, leaving a long end to sew Ears to Head.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in last ch. Turn. 2 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Fasten off.
Sew Ears to Head as shown in photo.
Sew keyring clasp to top of Head as shown in photo.
Using length of black embroidery floss and straight stitch, embroider nose.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 334 Buff (A), 313 Aran (B), 319 Cherry Red (C), and 312 Black (D).
abbreviations: s-inc (sc increase) = 2 sc in next st.
dec (decrease) = [draw up a loop in next st] twice, yo and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
h-inc (hdc increase) = 2 hdc in next st.
measurements: Not specified.
gauge: 16 sts = 4”; 16 rounds = 4” in sc rounds. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
MONKEY 
Head 
Round 1: With A, make a loop over your fingers, insert hook into the loop and draw up 1 ch; 6 sc into loop; draw up end to tighten loop – 6 sc. Do not join but work in continuous rounds. Mark last sc of round. Move marker up each round.
Round 2: [S-inc] 6 times – 12 sc.
Round 3: [S-inc, sc in next sc] 6 times – 18 sc.
Rounds 4-7: Sc in each sc around.
Round 8: [Dec, sc in next 4 sc] 3 times – 15 sc.
Round 9: Sc in each sc around. Fasten off.
Muzzle 
Rounds 1-2: With B, work as for Head through Round 2.
Round 3: [S-inc, sc in next 3 sc] 3 times – 15 sc. Fasten off.
Ears (Make 2) 
Row 1: With A, ch 3; 8 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Fasten off.
Hat 
Round 1: With B, make a loop over your fingers, insert hook into the loop and draw up 1 ch; 9 hdc into loop; join with a slip st in first hdc; draw up end to tighten loop – 9 hdc.
Round 2: Ch 2 (counts as hdc), hdc in same st as joining, [h-inc] 8 times; join with a slip st in top of ch-2 – 18 sts.
Round 3: Ch 2, hdc in same st as joining, hdc in next 5 hdc, [h-inc, hdc in next 5 hdc] twice – 21 sts.
Round 4: Ch 1, slip st in each st around. Fasten off.
Finishing 
Stuff Head and Muzzle. Sew Muzzle and Ears to Head. Run yarn through each slip stitch of last round of Head and pull tight to close up hole. Fasten off.
Embroider eyes with D French knots. Embroider mouth with C and make 6 satin sts across Muzzle. For topknot, cut six (6) 10” strands of C; thread strands through a st at top of hat. Knot strands together with an overhand knot.
Sock Monkey Key Fob 
Designed by Linda Cyr. 
Use this cute little crocheted fellow as a key ring or attach him to a backpack or purse. Sock monkey lovers will enjoy having him go wherever they go!

materials: Patons® Metallic™ (3 oz/85 g; 252 yds/230 m) Blue Steel (95134) 1 ball
Size U.S. D/3 (3.25 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Length of elastic ½” [1 cm] wide.
measurements: Approx 2½” x 4¼” [6 x 11 cm].
gauge: 30 sts and 28 rows = 4” [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Bow
Ch 20.
**1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 
*Ch 1. Skip next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Rep from 
* to end of chain. Turn. 19 sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next 
ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last 
2 sts. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 1. Skip next 
sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 
Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.**
Rep last 2 rows for pat until work from beg 
measures 8½” [21.5 cm]. Fasten off.
Center Strip
Ch 8.
Work from ** to ** as given for Bow. 7 sts.
Rep last 2 rows for pat until work from beg 
measures 3¼” [8.5 cm]. Fasten off. Fold 
Center Strip in half lengthwise and sew 
edges tog.
FINISHING
Sew ends of Bow tog. Position seam at 
center back. Work a running st (see Diagram) 
through all thicknesses at center and gather 
Bow to measure 1½” [4 cm] wide and fasten 
securely. Wrap Center Strip around Bow. Sew 
ends of Center Strip tog. Measure a length 
of elastic to fit comfortably around your 
neck, then sew center-point of elastic to 
back of Bow. Sew button at 1 end of elastic 
and create a buttonhole at opposite end 
by making a slit in elastic that button will fit 
through snuggly. With needle and thread, 
stitch securely around slit/buttonhole to 
prevent elastic from unraveling.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® Super Craft Kit™ – 1 kit
Sizes U.S. H/8 (5 mm) and I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
Coats & Clark® Yarn Zip 9" [23 cm] in Black.
Optional: 2 Charm backs for Bogg Bag. Hot glue gun and glue sticks.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 5" x 8" [12.5 x 20.5 cm].
gauge: 12 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
Notes:
• To use Coats & Clark™ Yarn Zip, a foundation of chain stitches will be worked directly into the zipper. 
• Body of Pouch is then worked directly into these chains on zipper.
• To change colors, work to last 2 loops on hook of first color, yoh with new color and proceed.
Setting Up Stitches on Coats & Clark™ Yarn Zip
Prepare zipper:
Using a pen or pencil, make small dots along right side of zipper ¼" [0.6 cm] up from bottom zipper stop and 8" [20.5 cm] up from this bottom mark. Make small markings every evenly spaced between these 2 points along right side of loose-weave channel on zipper tape so there are 25 dots spaced evenly along side of zipper.
Repeat on left side of zipper.
Begin working into zipper: 
With smaller hook, insert hook into top of zipper at bottom mark ¼" [0.6 cm] up from zipper stop. With A, holding yarn behind zipper, draw up a loop. Insert hook at next marking and draw up a loop (2 loops on hook). Draw this loop through first loop, being sure to not pull too tightly.
Continue in this manner, inserting hook at each marking, pulling up a loop and drawing it through loop on hook. Once top of zipper is reached, you should have 24 chain sts along right side of zipper.
Pull zipper head down below top marking. Working across top of zipper, insert hook into top marking on left side, drawing up a slightly longer loop to span across top of zipper.
Work down left side of zipper as on opposite side to bottom marking. Make 1 last chain st across bottom of zipper, into same space as first chain.
Pull loop from top of zipper to WS and fasten off. Cut yarn leaving approx 4" [10 cm] tail.
POUCH
1st rnd: With larger hook, join A with sl st to first ch st on right side. Ch 1. Working through right ‘leg’ of chain only, 1 sc in each ch to top of zipper (24 sc). Work 1 sc in ch across top of zipper. 1 sc in each of next 24 ch down left side of zipper. Work 1 sc in ch across bottom of zipper. Join with sl st to first sc. 50 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 20 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * once more. Join with sl st to first st. 46 sts.
3rd and 4th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
Join MC with sl st to first sc at end of 4th rnd. Fasten off B.
5th to 20th rnds: With MC, rep last rnd.
Fasten off, leaving a long yarn end to seam bottom of Pouch. 
FINISHING
Beg with 1st rnd (pick up rnd) at top of work, work cross stitch, using Cross Stitch Chart onto one side of Pouch over 5th to 19th rnds. Note that 1 sc is equal to 1 square on Chart. With F, work straight stitch over indicated sc, as shown on Chart.
Lay Pouch flat, aligning sts of last rnd. Using yarn tail, sew bottom of Pouch closed.
Zipper Pull
Cherries  (Make 2).
With B and smaller hook, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Do not join. PM on last st.
Cont working in spiral, moving end of rnd marker up each rnd.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc.
3rd to 5th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
Note: To stuff cherries, wrap B around two fingers 5 times.
Stuff Cherries after 5th rnd.
6th rnd: (Sc2tog) 6 times. 6 sts.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. With yarn needle, draw end through rem sts and pull tightly. Fasten securely and weave in ends.
Cord
With C and smaller hook, leaving long tail, ch 40. Fasten off, leaving long tail.
Feed cord through zipper pull opening, so even length of chains are on either side. Tie Cord in a bow, having loops approx 1¼" [3 cm] long. Sew Cherries to each end of Cord using long tails. 
Optional: Bogg Bag Charms
Using hot glue gun, secure 2 plastic Bogg Bag charms to back of pouch (opposite side from cross stitch) using hot glue gun, over 2nd and 3rd rnds, spaced to align with Bogg Bag openings.

materials: 1 skein each 256 Carrot B and 672 Spring Green C
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: X-Large Cover measures 18" [45.5 cm] long x 11" [28 cm] circumference. Large Cover measures 16" [40.5 cm] long x 10" [25.5 cm] circumference. Medium Cover measures 16½" [42 cm] long x 9" [23 cm] circumference. Small Cover measures 14½" [37 cm] long x 8" [20.5 cm] circumference.
gauge: 18 sc = 5" [12.5 cm]; 10 rows = 3" [7.5 cm] in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
X-LARGE COVER
Bottom Ribbing
With A, ch 37.
Row 1: Working in back bars only, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across – 36 sc.
Rows 2-28: Ch 1, turn, working in back loops only, sc in each sc across.
Joining Row: Ch 1, turn, with right sides together, fold ribbing in half, bringing first row up behind last row, working through back loops of sts of both layers, sc in each st across. Do not fasten off. Turn right side out (joining row to the inside).
Top
Round 1 (Right Side): Turn to work along long edge, ch 1, sc in end of each row around, join with slip st in first sc – 28 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, *sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around, join with slip st in first sc – 35 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc around, join with slip st in first sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, *sc in next 6 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around, join with slip st in first sc – 40 sc.
Round 5: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc and change to B in join.
Round 6: With B, ch 1, sc in each sc around, join with slip st in first sc and change to A in join. Cut B.
Round 7: With A, ch 1, sc in same st as join, sc in each st around, join with slip st in first sc.
Round 8: Ch 1, sc in each sc around, join with slip st in first sc and change to C in join.
Rounds 9-11: With C, ch 1, sc in each sc around, join with slip st in first sc, changing to A in join of Round 11. Cut C.
Rounds 12-13: With A, repeat Round 7, changing to B in join of Round 13.
Round 14: With B, repeat Round 6.
Rounds 15-19: Repeat Rounds 7-11, changing to A in join of Round 19.
Round 20: With A, ch 1, *sc2tog, sc in next 6 sc; repeat from * around, join with slip st in first sc – 35 sc.
Round 21: Ch 1, sc in each sc around, join with slip st in first sc, changing to B in join.
Round 22: With B, ch 1, *sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog; repeat from * around, join with slip st in first sc, changing to A in join – 28 sc. Cut B.
Round 23: With A, ch 1, *sc2tog, sc in next 5 sc; repeat from * around, join with slip st in first sc – 24 sc.
Round 24: Ch 1, sc in next sc, *sc2tog, sc in next 2 sc; repeat from * to last 3 sc, sc2tog, sc in last sc, join with slip st in first sc – 18 sc.
Round 25: Ch 1, *sc2tog, sc in next sc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc – 12 sc.
Round 26: Ch 1, [sc2tog] 6 times, join with slip st in first sc – 6 sc. Fasten off, leaving a 12" [30.5 cm] tail. With yarn needle, thread tail through sts of last round and draw tight to close hole.

LARGE COVER
Bottom Ribbing
With A, ch 37.
Work Rows 1-24 and Joining Row as for X-Large Cover.
Top
Round 1 (Right Side): Turn to work along long edge, ch 1, sc in end of each row around, join with slip st in first sc – 24 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, *sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around, join with slip st in first sc – 30 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc around, join with slip st in first sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in next sc, [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 4 sc] 5 times, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last 3 sc, join with slip st in first sc – 36 sc.
Round 5: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc and change to B in join.
Round 6: With B, ch 1, sc in each sc around, join with slip st in first sc and change to A in join. Cut B.
Round 7: With A, ch 1, sc in same st as join, sc in each st around, join with slip st in first sc.
Round 8: Ch 1, sc in each sc around, join with slip st in first sc and change to C in join.
Rounds 9-11: With C, ch 1, sc in each sc around, join with slip st in first sc, changing to A in join of Round 11. Cut C.
Rounds 12-13: With A, repeat Round 7, changing to B in join of Round 13.
Round 14: With B, repeat Round 6, changing to A in join.
Round 15: With A, ch 1, *sc2tog, sc in next 4 sc; repeat from * around, join with slip st in first sc – 30 sc.
Round 16: Ch 1, sc in each sc around, join with slip st in first sc.
Round 17: Ch 1, *sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog; repeat from * around, join with slip st in first sc – 24 sc.
Round 18: Ch 1, sc in next sc, *sc2tog, sc in next 2 sc; repeat from * to last 3 sc, sc2tog, sc in last sc, join with slip st in first sc – 18 sc.
Round 19: Ch 1, *sc2tog, sc in next sc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc – 12 sc.
Round 20: Ch 1, [sc2tog] 6 times, join with slip st in first sc – 6 sc. Fasten off, leaving a 12" [30.5 cm] tail. With yarn needle, thread tail through sts of last round and draw tight to close hole.

MEDIUM COVER
Bottom Ribbing
With A, ch 35.
Rows 1-22: Work Bottom Ribbing Rows 1-22 of X-Large Cover – 34 sc.
Work Joining Row as for X-Large Cover.
Top
Round 1 (Right Side): Turn to work along long edge, ch 1, sc in end of each row around, join with slip st in first sc – 22 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc, [sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 5 times, join with slip st in first sc – 28 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc around, join with slip st in first sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, [sc in next 6 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 4 times; join with slip st in first sc, changing to B in join – 32 sc.
Round 5: With B, ch 1, sc in each sc around, join with slip st in first sc and change to A in join. Cut B.
Rounds 6-18: Repeat Rounds 7-19 as for X-Large Cover, changing to A in join of Round 18.
Round 19: With A, ch 1, [sc in next 6 sc, sc2tog] 4 times, join with slip st in first sc – 28 sc.
Round 20: Ch 1, sc in each sc around, join with slip st in first sc, changing to B in join.
Round 21: With B, ch 1, *sc2tog, sc in next 5 sc; repeat from * around, join with slip st in first sc, changing to A in join – 24 sc. Cut B.
Round 22: With A, ch 1, sc in next sc, *sc2tog, sc in next 2 sc; repeat from * to last 3 sc, sc2tog, sc in last sc, join with slip st in first sc – 18 sc.
Round 23: Ch 1, *sc2tog, sc in next sc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc – 12 sc.
Round 24: Ch 1, [sc2tog] 6 times, join with slip st in first sc – 6 sc. Fasten off, leaving a 12" [30.5 cm] tail. With yarn needle, thread tail through sts of last round and draw tight to close hole.

SMALL COVER
Bottom Ribbing
With A, ch 33.
Rows 1-20: Work Bottom Ribbing Rows 1-20 of X-Large Cover – 32 sc.
Joining Row: Work Joining Row as for X-Large Cover.
Top
Round 1 (Right Side): Turn to work along long edge, ch 1, sc in end of each row around, join with slip st in first sc – 20 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, [sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 4 times, join with slip st in first sc – 24 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc around, join with slip st in first sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc, [sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 3 times, sc in last 3 sc; join with slip st in first sc – 28 sc.
Rounds 5-14: Work Rounds 5-14 as for Large Cover, changing to A in join of Round 14.
Round 15: With A, ch 1, [sc2tog, sc in next 5 sc] 4 times, join with slip st in first sc – 24 sc.
Round 16: Ch 1, sc in each sc around, join with slip st in first sc.
Rounds 17-19: Work Rounds 18-20 as for Large Cover. Fasten off, leaving a 12" [30.5 cm] tail. With yarn needle, thread tail through sts of last round and draw tight to close hole.

FINISHING
Weave in ends. Using pompom maker and all colors, make a medium pompom for each Cover. Tie one pompom at tip of each Cover.

abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Cuff measures 5½” high x 11 (12½, 14)” circumference (14 x 28 [32, 35.5] cm).
gauge: 11 sts = 4” (10 cm); 11 rows crochet.
instructions:
CUFF (make 2)
Ribbing
Ch 13.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across, turn—12 sc.
Rows 2–30 (34, 38): Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in each sc across, turn.
Joining Row: With wrong sides of first and last rows held together, ch 1, working through both thicknesses, slip st in each st. Do not fasten off. Turn piece right side out.
Top Edge
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, with right side facing and working across ends of rows, 2 sc in first row, skip next row, [2 sc in next row, skip next row] 14 (16, 18) times; join with slip st in first sc—30 (34, 38) sc.
Round 2: Ch 3 (counts as hdc, ch 1), skip next st, hdc in next st, [ch 1, skip next st, hdc in next st] 13 (15, 17) times, ch 1; join with slip st in 2nd ch of beginning ch—15 (17, 19) hdc and 15 (17, 19) ch-1 spaces.
Round 3: Ch 1, 2 sc in each ch-2 space around; join with slip st in first sc—30 (34, 38) sc. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Heart & Sole®: 1 ball 3931 Berry Bliss
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
dc2tog: [Yarn over, insert hook in next stitch, yarn over and pull up loop, yarn over, draw through 2 loops] 2 times, yarn over, draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Bookmark measures 1¾” [5 cm] wide x 6” [15 cm] high

instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com

RedHeart.com
Page 1 of 1
Tie Bookmark 
Need a suitable gift for the man who enjoys 
reading? This tie bookmark is perfect! It can 
be crocheted quickly with self-striping yarn 
and when he uses it he’ll be reminded of your 
thoughtfulness.

Row 25: Ch 3, turn, dc2tog, dc in next 4 sts, 
dc2tog, dc in last st – 8 sts.
Rows 26-30: Repeat Row 21. 
Fasten off.

TOP 
(Make 2)
Ch 9.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch 
across – 8 sts. 
Row 2 (Right side): Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc 
across.
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, sc in next sc, 2 sc in next 
sc, sc in 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last sc – 
10 sts.
Row 4: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across – 10 sts.
Row 5: Ch 1, turn, sc in next sc, 2 sc in next 
sc, sc in next 6 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last 
sc – 12 sts.
Row 6: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across.
Fasten off.

FINISHING
With right side facing, sew first row of one 
Top piece to last row of Tie. With wrong sides 
together and lining up edges, sew remaining 
Top piece to opposite side of first Top piece 
and Tie. 
Sew running sts back and forth along join of 
Top and Tie, pulling to gather slightly to give 
knotted appearance.
Weave in ends. 

TIE
Ch 2.
Row 1: Work 4 sc in 2nd ch from hook – 4 sts.
Row 2: (Right Side) Ch 1, turn, sc in next sc, 2 
sc in next 2 sc, sc in next sc – 6 sts. 
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across. 
Row 4: Ch 1, turn, sc in next sc, 2 sc in next 
sc, sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last 
sc – 8 sts.
Row 5: Ch 1, turn, sc in next sc, 2 sc in next 
sc, sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last 
sc – 10 sts.
Row 6: Repeat Row 3.
Row 7: Ch 1, turn, sc in next sc, 2 sc in next 
sc, sc in next 6 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last 
sc – 12 sts.
Rows 8-9: Repeat Row 3.
Rows 10-11: Ch 3 (counts as a dc here and 
throughout), turn, dc in each st across.
Rows 12-14: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across. 
Rows 15-16: Repeat Rows 10-11. 
Rows 17-19: Repeat Rows 12-14.
Row 20: Ch 3, turn, dc2tog; dc in next 6 sts, 
dc2tog, dc in last st – 10 sts.
Row 21: Ch 3, turn, dc in each st across.
Rows 22-24: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across.

NOTES
Fabric stiffener may be used for a stiffer 
bookmark.
Tie will be sandwiched between top of tie. Top 
will be stitched together wrong sides facing 
each other.

Designed by Carlotta L. C. Craig

materials: RED HEART® Soft®: 1 ball 9528 Lilac A
RED HEART® Boutique Fur™: 2 balls 9554 Eggplant B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 5.5mm [US I-9] and 6.5mm [US K-10.5]
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
measurements: Topper measures 10” (25.5 cm) circumference x 5” (12.5 cm) high.
gauge: 8 sts = 4” (10 cm); 8 rows
instructions:
CUFF (make 2)
With A and smaller hook, ch 11.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—10 sc.
Row 2: Working in back loops only, ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Rows 3–40: Repeat Row 2.
Joining Row: Holding first and last rows together and working through both thicknesses, ch 1, slip st in each sc across. Do not fasten off.
Edging Round: Working in ends of rows, ch 1, sc in each row around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Top
Round 1 (RS): With larger hook and right side of opposite edge facing, join B with sc in end of any row, working in ends of rows, sc evenly spaced around; join with slip st in first sc.
Rounds 2 and 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

pattern_name: Crochet Fashion Doll Snuggle Up with Sleeves
materials: RED HEART® “Designer Sport™”: 1 skein 3730 Blush Rose.
measurements: Directions are to fit 11½” fashion doll. Finished Width: 8”. Finished Length: 12”.
gauge: 16 sc = 4”; 19 rows = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the specified gauge.
instructions:
Ch 32.
Row 1 (Wrong Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across – 31 sc.
Rows 2-44: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across. 
Divide for Armholes 
Right Side
Row 45 (Wrong Side): Ch 1, turn, sc in first 8 sts. Leaving remaining sts unworked.
Rows 46-47: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across – 8 sts. Fasten off.
Back
Row 45: With wrong side facing, skip next 3 unworked sc on Row 44 of Body, join yarn with slip st in next sc, ch 1, sc in next 9 sc. Leaving remaining sts unworked. 
Rows 46-47: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across – 9 sts. Fasten off.
Left Side
Row 45: With wrong side facing, skip next 3 unworked sc on Row 44 of Body, join yarn with slip st in next sc, ch 1, sc in next 8 sc.
Rows 46-47: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across – 8 sc.
Shape Neck and Shoulders 
Row 48: Ch 1, turn, sc in 8 sc of Left Side, ch 3, sc in next 9 sc of Back, ch 3, sc in next 8 sc of Right Side.
Row 49: Ch 1, turn, sc in next 8 sc, sc in next 3 chs, sc in next 9 sc, sc in next 3 chs, sc in next 8 sc – 31 sc.
Rows 50 – 54: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across. Do not fasten off.  
Border
Turn to work along one side edge, ch 1, working in ends of rows, work 51 sc evenly along side edge, turn to work along opposite edge of Foundation Row, work 3 sc in first ch along bottom edge, sc in next 29 chs, 3 sc in last ch, turn to work along opposite side edge, work 51 sc evenly spaced along side edge, turn to work along last row of Body, 3 sc in first sc, sc in next 29 sc, 3 sc in last sc of row, join with slip st to first sc. 
Fasten off.
Sleeves
Round 1: With right side facing, join yarn with slip st to 2nd st of skipped 3 sc at underarm of Body, ch 1, sc in next sc, 2 sc evenly along edge of 2 rows, sc in each ch on opposite side of next 3 chs, 2 sc evenly along edge of next 2 rows, sc in next 2 dc, join with slip st in first sc – 10 sc.
Rounds 2 – 12: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc around, join with slip st in first sc. 
Fasten off.
Repeat for second sleeve. 
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Classic Crochet Thread size 10: 1 ball 450 Aqua
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 1.4 mm [US 8] steel hook
abbreviations: [] = work directions given in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Bookmark measures approximately 2¼” (6 cm) wide by 6¼” (16 cm) long. Butterfly measures 2¼” (6 cm) wide by 1¼” (3 cm) tall.
gauge: 11 sts = 1” (3 cm); 4 rows = 1” (3 cm) in dc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Bottom Trim
Row 1: With right side facing, working across opposite side of foundation ch, join thread with slip st in 4th ch, ch 3, dc in each of next 21 ch sts (7 blocks made), turn, leaving remaining sts unworked.
Row 2: Slip st in each of first 4 sts (decrease made), ch 3, dc in each of next 15 dc, turn, leaving remaining sts unworked.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first dc, *ch 3, skip next dc, sc in next dc; repeat from * across—7 ch-3 spaces.
BUTTERFLY
Head and Body (make 2)
Ch 10.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next 8 ch (slip st, 3 hdc, slip st) in last ch (head), working across opposite side of foundation ch, slip st in each ch across. Fasten off and set aside.
Large Wing (make 2)
Ch 5.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—4 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in last sc, turn—6 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 4: Ch 5, (counts as tr, ch 1), skip first sc, tr in next sc, *ch 1, tr in next sc; repeat from * across, turn—5 ch-1 spaces.
Edging
Round 1: Ch 1, sc in each tr and ch-1 space across; working across side edge of wing, work 3 sc in next row-end tr, sc in each of next 3 row-end sc, working across bottom edge of foundation ch, sc in each ch across, working across other side edge, sc in each of next 3 row-end sc, 3 sc in next row-end tr, join with slip st in first sc.
Bookmark measures approximately 2¼” (6 cm) wide by 6¼” (16 cm) long. Butterfly measures 2¼” (6 cm) wide by 1¼” (3 cm) tall.
SPECIAL ABBREVIATIONS
dc3tog: *Yarn over, insert hook in next st, yarn over, draw yarn through st, yarn over, draw yarn through 2 loops on hook; repeat from * twice, yarn over, draw yarn through 4 loops on hook.
HOW TO READ PATTERN
Each solid square is equal to a “block” of “dc in next dc, dc in next 2 sts or ch-2 space, dc in next dc”. Each open square is equal to a “space” of “dc, ch 2, skip next 2 sts, dc.” The dc at the end of each square also counts as the first dc of the next block or space. For example, a block followed by a space = dc in next 4 sts, ch 2, skip next 2 sts, dc in next dc.
BOOKMARK
Starting at bottom, ch 30. 
Row 1 (Right Side): Dc in 4th ch from hook, dc in each ch across 9 blocks made), turn.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), dc in next 3 dc (block made), *ch 2, skip next 2 sts, dc in next 7 dc (1 space and 2 blocks made); repeat from * once, ch 2, skip next 2 sts, dc in last 4 dc (1 space and 1 block made), turn.
Rows 3-24: Continue to work in blocks and spaces following chart.
Row 25: Slip st in each of first 4 sts (decrease made), ch 3, dc in each st across to last 4 dc, turn, leaving remaining sts unworked (decrease made) (7 blocks made), turn.
Rows 26-28: Repeat Row 25 (1 block at end of last row). Fasten off.
Designed by Carlotta L. C. Craig
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first sc, *ch 3, skip next sc, sc in next sc; repeat * 4 more times. Fasten off and set aside. Fasten off and set aside.
Large Wing (make 2)
Ch 3.
Row 1 (wrong side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next ch, turn—2 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc across, turn—4 sc.
Row 3: Ch 4 (counts as dc, ch 1), skip first sc, d in next sc, *ch 1, dc in next sc; repeat from * across, turn—3 ch-1 spaces.
Edging
Round 1: Ch 1, sc in each dc and ch-1 space across; working across side edge of wing, work 2 sc in next row-end dc, sc in each of next 2 row-end sc, working across bottom edge of foundation ch, sc in each ch across, working across other side edge, sc in each of next 2 row-end sc, 2 sc in next row-end dc, join with slip st in first sc. 
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first sc, *ch 3, skip next sc, sc in next sc; repeat * twice. Fasten off and set aside. 
Antennae 
Ch 25. Fasten off. Make an overhand knot on both ends and set aside.
Right Side Assembly
Row 1: With right side facing, hold one large wing with smaller end up. Join thread in first sc, ch 1, sc in first sc, sc in next 2 sc. With right side facing, place small wing behind large wing; insert hook through 4th sc of large wing and first sc of small wing, working through double thickness, work 2 sc in same st, sc in next sc of small wing. Fasten off.
Left Side Assembly
Row 1: With right side facing, hold other small wing with smaller end up. Join thread in first sc, ch 1, sc in first sc. With right side facing, place remaining large wing behind small wing; insert hook through 2nd sc of small wing and first sc of large wing, working through double thickness, work 2 sc in same st, sc in next 3 sts of large wing. Fasten off.
FINISHING  
With tapestry needle, and right sides facing, placing both large wings on same end, sew wings together across last row of wings. 
Place one head and body on both sides of assembled wings (right side facing out and with head at large wing end) and sew in place. Before head is sewn together, slip center of antennae between head pieces and complete sewing heads together. 
With right side of bookmark facing, join thread to first st on last row, ch 3, dc3tog over next 3 dc, ch 50, slip st to bottom of butterfly’s body.  
Fasten off. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Soft®: 1 ball each 4420 Guacamole A and 9518 Teal B
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Turtle shell measures 8” (20.5 cm) diameter. Hat measures 12 (14)” [30.5 (35.5)] cm) circumference at brim. Directions for hat are for size Small. Changes for size Large are in parentheses.
gauge: 14 sts = 4” (10 cm); 7 rows = 4” (10 cm) in double crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE.
instructions:
This crocheted turtle set is ideal to use for photos taken while newborn baby is curled up sleeping. Perfect to give for showers or to welcome baby.
Round 4: Ch 1, dc in first 5 (2) sts, 2 dc in next st, [dc in next 5 (2) sts, 2 dc in next st] 5 (11) times; join with slip st in first st—42 (48) dc.
Rounds 5–7 (8): Ch 1, dc in each st around; change to B; join with slip st in first st.
Rounds 8 (9)–11 (12): Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first st.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.
SHELL
Pentagon Motif (make 6)
With A, make an adjustable ring, ch 1.
Round 1 (right side): Work 10 hdc in ring; join with slip st in first st—10 hdc. Pull gently, but firmly, on tail to tighten ring.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 hdc in each st around; change to B; join with slip st in first st—20 hdc.
Round 3: Ch 1, hdc in first 4 sts, [ch 2, hdc in next 4 sts] 4 times, ch 2; join with slip st in first st—20 hdc and 5 ch-2 spaces.
FINISHING
Cut ten 6” (15 cm) strands of B. With right side facing, arrange 5 pentagon motifs around the 6th, aligning ch-2 spaces at inner edges. Using assembly diagram as a guide and joining same color ch-2 spaces, *thread a strand through any ch-2 space of center motif and the ch-2 spaces of 2 neighboring outer motifs (you’ll be threading through 3 ch-spaces). Tie in a knot on the wrong side of piece. Repeat from * 4 times. Tie each of remaining 5 strands through 2 outer ch-2 spaces of the same color between neighboring motifs, leaving ch-2 space at outer point unworked.
HAT
With A, make an adjustable ring, ch 1.
Round 1 (right side): Work 12 dc in ring; join with slip st in first st—12 dc. Pull gently, but firmly, on tail to tighten ring.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 dc in each st around; join with slip st in first st—24 dc.
Round 3: Ch 1, dc in first st, 2 dc in next st, [dc in next st, 2 dc in next st] 11 times; join with slip st in first st—36 dc.
Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
Edging
Round 1: With right side facing, join B with slip st in any unworked ch-2 space on outer edge, ch 2 (counts as first hdc), 3 hdc in same ch-2 space, *hdc in each st to next ch-2 space, [4 hdc in next ch-2 space] twice; repeat from * to last 4 sts, hdc in last 4 sts—100 hdc. Fasten off.
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 skein each 256 Carrot or 254 Pumpkin A, 389 Hunter Green B, 312 Black C.
Safety pin or other pin back, stitch marker, yarn needle.
abbreviations: A, B, etc= color A, B, etc
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Pin measures 3½” in diameter.
gauge: 12 single crochet = 4”; 16 rows = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge. Gauge is not essential for this project but will affect finished size.
instructions:
PUMPKIN
With A, chain 2. 
Round 1: Work 6 single crochet in 2nd chain from hook – 6 single crochet. Working in continuous rounds, place marker for beginning of round.
Round 2: Work 2 single crochet in each stitch around – 12 single crochet.
Round 3: Work [2 single crochet in next stitch, single crochet in next stitch] 6 times – 18 single crochet.
Round 4: Work [2 single crochet in next stitch, single crochet in next 2 stitches] 6 times – 24 single crochet.
Round 5: Work [2 single crochet in next stitch, single crochet in next 3 stitches] 6 times – 30 single crochet.
Fasten off.

STEM
Join B with a slip stitch in any stitch.
Row 1: Chain 1, single crochet in next 2 stitches, slip stitch in next stitch.
Row 2: Chain 1, turn, slip stitch in slip stitch, single crochet in each single crochet across. 
Repeat Rows 1 & 2 once more. 
Fasten off. 

FINISHING 
Weave in ends. With C and straight stitches, embroider face on Front. Attach a pin to Back.

measurements: BATH POUF Approx 6" [15 cm] diameter. FLORAL FACECLOTHS Approx 10" [25.5 cm] in diameter. STASH BASKET Approx 5 x 10 x 6" [12.5 x 25.5 x 15 cm]. BATH MITT One size to fit adult. SCRUBBY Approx 5" [12.5 cm] long.
