instructions:
Ch 5. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring. Ch 40 for hanging loop and sl st back into ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. Work 25 sc in ch-5 ring. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3 (does not count as st). 3 dc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first dc. 75 dc.
3rd rnd: Ch 3 (does not count as st). 3 dc in each dc around. Join with sl st to first dc. 225 dc.
4th rnd: Ch 3 (does not count as st). 3 dc in each dc around. Join with sl st to first dc. 675 dc. Fasten off.

FLORAL FACECLOTHS
Note: Ch 2 does not count as hdc in 1st to 3rd rnds.
With MC, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 2. 10 hdc in ring. Join with sl st to first hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 20 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 40 hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. (1 hdc. Ch 1. 2 hdc) in same sp as sl st. *Skip next 2 hdc. (2 hdc. Ch 1. 2 hdc) in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 2.
5th rnd: Sl st in next st and ch-1 sp. Ch 2. (1 hdc. Ch 1. 2 hdc) in same ch-1 sp. *(2 hdc. Ch 1. 2 hdc) in next ch-1 sp – shell made. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 2.
6th and 7th rnds: Sl st in next st and ch-1 sp. Ch 2. (2 hdc. Ch 1. 3 hdc) in same ch-1 sp. *(3 hdc. Ch 1. 3 hdc) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around. Join A with sl st to top of ch 2 at end of 7th rnd.
8th rnd: With A, ch 2. *8 dc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in sp between 2 shells. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dc.
9th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. Ch 1. (1 sc in next dc. Ch 1) 7 times. *(1 sc in sp between next 2 shells 1 row below. Ch 1) 4 times. 1 sc in same ch-1 sp as last sc. (Ch 1. 1 sc in sp between next 2 shells 1 row above) 3 times.** (1 sc in next dc. Ch 1) 8 times. Rep from * 11 times more, then from * to ** once. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

STASH BASKET
The instructions are written for small basket. If changes are necessary for medium basket the instructions will be written thus ( ).
Sides
Ch 28.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 27 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 5" [12.5 cm], ending with a WS row.
Next row: (RS). (Fold line). Ch 1. Working through back loops only, 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
***Next row: Ch 1. Working through both loops, 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
Rep last row until work from last fold line measures 10" [25.5 cm], ending with a WS row.***
Next row: (RS). (Fold line). Ch 1. Working through back loops only, 1 sc in each sc across. Turn. Next row: Ch 1. Working through both loops, 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
Rep last row until work from last fold line measures 5" [12.5 cm], ending with a WS row.
Rep from *** to *** once more. Next row: (RS). (Joining row). Place foundation ch behind last row with WS of work tog. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, 1 sc in each sc across. Fasten off.
Base
Ch 46.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 45 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 5" [12.5 cm], ending with a WS row. Do not fasten off.
Join Base to Sides: Place lower edge of Sides behind Base with WS of work tog, aligning corners of Base with fold lines and joining row of Sides.
Next rnd: (RS). Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work 1 rnd of sc around all 4 sides of Base. Join with sl st in first sc. Fasten off.

BATH MITT
SIZE
One size to fit adult.
GAUGE
14 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm].
INSTRUCTIONS
Ch 34.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. 33 sts. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row 6 times more.
Shape thumb gusset: 1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 17 sts. 2 sc in each of next 2 sts. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
2nd, 4th, 6th, 8th, 10th and 12th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 17 sts. 2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. 2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 17 sts. 2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. 2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
7th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 17 sts. 2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 6 sts. 2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
9th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 17 sts. 2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 8 sts. 2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
11th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 17 sts. 2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 10 sts. 2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
13th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 17 sts. Ch 2. Skip next 14 sts. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
14th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st or ch 1 sp to end of row. 33 sts. Cont even until work from beg measures 8" [20.5 cm] ending with a WS row.
Shape top: 1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 11 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 11 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in last st. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 9 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 9 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in last st. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 7 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 7 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in last st. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in last st. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in last st. Fasten off.

Thumb: With RS facing, join yarn with sl st to ch sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 1 sc in each of next 14 sts. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep last rnd 4 times more.
Next rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 8 times. Join with sl st to first st. 8 sts.
Next rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 4 times. 4 sts. Fasten off. Thread end through a tapestry needle and draw yarn through rem sts. Fasten securely.

SCRUBBY
MEASUREMENT
Approx 5" [12.5 cm] long.
GAUGE
15 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm].
INSTRUCTIONS
Front and Back (make 2 pieces alike)
Ch 22.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 21 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2 sts. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2 sts. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
4th row: As 2nd row.
5th row: As 3rd row.
6th and 7th rows: As 2nd row. 11 sts rem at end of 7th row.
8th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2 sts. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 8 sts rem.
9th and 10th rows: As 2nd row. 4 sts rem at end of 10th row. Fasten off.
With RS facing, join yarn with sl st to second loop of foundation ch.
1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 18 ch. Turn. 19 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2 sts. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn.
3rd row: As 2nd row.
4th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2 sts. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn.
6th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2 sts. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn.
7th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2 sts. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc3tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 7 sts rem.
8th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2 sts. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Turn.
9th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2 sts. 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. 3 sts rem.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
With WS of pieces tog, join yarn with sl st to bottom. Working through both thicknesses, work sc to tip, work 3 sc in tip. Insert sponge, cutting sponge to shape if necessary. Cont working sc along other side to end of rnd. Ch 9 (loop). Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: 1 Ball each 3650 Lotus A, 3810 Lake B and 3620 Fern C.
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Belt Length: 23 (27, 31, 35, 40, 45)”, excluding ties
gauge: 12 hdc = 4”; 10 rows = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions: With A, ch 70 (82, 94, 106, 121, 136). Row 1: Dc in 2nd ch from hook, dc into each ch across, ch 100 – 69 (81, 93, 105, 120, 135) hdc. Fasten off and turn work. Row 2: With B, ch 100, hdc in first 2 sts, [skip next st, ch 1, hdc in next st] across to last st, hdc in last st, ch 100. Fasten off and turn work. Row 3: With A, ch 100, hdc in each hdc and ch-1 space across, ch 100. Fasten off and turn work. Row 4: With B, repeat Row 2. Row 5: With C, repeat Row 3. Row 6: With B, repeat Row 2. Row 7: With A, repeat Row 3. Row 8: With B, repeat Row 2. Row 9: With A, ch 100, dc in each hdc and ch-1 space across, ch 100. Fasten off. Edging Row: Turn to work along opposite foundation ch. Beginning at edge without A 100-ch length, with C, ch 100, sc in each st across. Fasten off. FINISHING Weave in ends.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Classic Crochet Thread, Size 10: 1 ball each 484 Myrtle Green A, 422 Golden Yellow B, 401 Orchid Pink C and 494 Victory Red D
abbreviations: A, B, C, D = color A, B, C, D
measurements: Assembled Cupcake measures 1½” x 1¼” (3.8 x 3.1 cm)
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
Cherry (Make 4)
With D, ch 4; join with slip st to form ring; ch 2, 10 hdc in ring; join with slip st to top of ch-2. Fasten off.
Finishing
Weave in ends. Pair Cake A with Icing C, Cake B with Icing A, Cake B with Icing C, and Cake C with Icing B. Glue to card with small dots of glue, gluing each Icing slightly overlapping unfinished edge of Cake. Glue cherry to top of each Icing.

CUPCAKEs
Cake (Make 1 with A, 2 with B, and 1 with C)
Ch 9.
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across; turn – 8 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, working in front loops only sc in each sc across; turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, working in back loops only sc in each sc across; turn.
Rows 4-9: Repeat Rows 2 and 3 three more times. At end of Row 9, pivot to work along ends of rows.
Lower Edging: With right side still facing, work 8 sc evenly across ends of rows. Fasten off.

Icing (Make 1 with A, 1 with B, and 2 with C)
Ch 13.
Row 1 (Right Side): Hdc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across; turn – 12 hdc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in next 8 hdc, sc2tog; turn – 10 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, skip first sc, hdc in next 8 sc, ch 1, slip st in last sc; turn – 8 hdc.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in first 7 hdc, ch 1, slip st in last hdc; turn – 7 sc.
Row 5: Ch 1, skip first 3 sc, 7 dc in next sc, skip last 2 sc, slip st in last sc. Pivot to work along ends of rows.
Edging: With right side still facing, slip st evenly down the ends of the rows, ch 1, working across opposite side of foundation ch, sc in each ch, ch 1, slip st up the other ends of rows, slip st in first dc of Row 5. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Anne Geddes Baby™: 1 ball 902 Ladybug
abbreviations: sc2tog = [draw up a loop in next st] twice, yo and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
measurements: Bowtie measures 1½” wide x 3” long (4 x 7.5 cm)
gauge: 20 sc = 4” (10 cm); 20 rows = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook/needles to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
BOWTIE
Tie
Ch 6.
Row 1 (Wrong Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch; turn—5 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each st across; turn.
Row 3: Repeat Row 2.
Row 4: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in each st to last st, 2 sc in last st; turn—7 sc.
Rows 5-8: Repeat Row 2.
Row 9-Fold Row: Ch 1; working in front loops only, sc in each st; turn.
Rows 10-12: Repeat Row 2.
Row 13: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each st to last 2 sts, sc2tog—5 sc.
Rows 14-19: Repeat Row 2.
Row 20-29: Repeat Rows 4-13.
Rows 30-32: Repeat Row 2.
Fasten off, leaving long tail for sewing.
Cinch Band
Ch 7.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across—6 sc. Fasten off, leaving long tail for sewing.
Neck Band
Work as many ch sts as needed to fit comfortably around wearer’s neck.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; do not turn.
FINISHING
Fold Tie at Rows 9 and 25 so that unworked back loops form outer edges. Sew edges of first and last rows together. Pinch center of Tie and wrap Cinch Band tightly around middle of Tie over seam. Sew ends together at back of Tie (do not sew to Tie). Slip Neck Band under Cinch Band. Sew button to end of Neck Band opposite Buttonhole. Weave in ends.

materials: STITCH NATION by Debbie Stoller™ Full o’ Sheep™: 1 ball each 2701 Cupcake A and 2640 Thyme B.
Sharp yarn needle, 1 ½” bar pin, straight pins.
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color a, Color B, Color C etc
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
3-ch-picot = ch 3, insert hook in front loop (horizontal bar) of the dc just made and in the left strand (vertical bar) of the same st, yo and pull through all three loops.
measurements: Flower measures 8” in diameter before felting, 5 ½” after felting.
gauge: Gauge is not important, but the stitches need to be loose to felt the yarn successfully.
instructions:
Round 1:  With A, ch 2, 6 sc in second ch from the hook; join to first sc – 6 sc.
Round 2: (First row of petals) working in the front loops only of the previous round, slip st into first sc, [ch 4, working in the back humps of the chain, sc in second ch from the hook and the next 2 ch, slip st in front loop of next sc] 5 times; ch 4, working in the back humps of the chain, sc in second ch from the hook and the next 2 ch, slip st into back loop of first sc – 6 petals.
Round 3: Working behind the petals and in the back loops only of round 1 ch 1, 2 sc in each sc in the round; join to first sc – 12 sc.
Round 4: (Second row of petals) working in the front loops only of the previous round, slip st into first sc, [ch 5, working in the back humps of the chain, sc in second ch from the hook and the next 3 ch, slip st in front loop of next sc] 11 times; ch 5, working in the back hump of the chain, sc in second ch from the hook and the next 3 ch, slip st into back loop of first sc – 12 petals.
Round 5: Working behind the petals and in the back loops only of round 3, ch 1, [2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc] 6 times; join to first sc – 18 sc.
Round 6: (Third row of petals) working in the front loops only of the previous round, slip st into first sc, [ch 5, working in the back hump of the chain sts, sc in second ch from the hook and the next 3 ch, slip st in next sc] 17 times; ch 5, working in the back hump of the chain, sc in second ch from the hook and the next 3 ch, slip st into back loop of first sc – 18 petals.
Round 7: Working behind the petals and in the back loops only of round 5, ch 1, [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc] 6 times; join to first sc – 24 sc.
Round 8: (Fourth row of petals) working into both loops of the round 7, [ch 6, sc in the back hump of the second ch from the hook and the next 4 ch, slip st in next sc] 23 times; ch 6, sc in the back hump of the second ch from the hook and the next 4 ch, join to first petal – 24 petals. Fasten off.  Weave in ends.
Leaves (Make 2)
Round 1: Ch 2, 7 sc in second ch from the hook; do not join; turn.
Round 2: Ch 1, (hdc, dc) in first sc; ch 2, (sc, hdc, dc) in next sc; ch 2, (sc, hdc) in next sc; (2 dc, 3-ch-picot, dc) in next sc; (hdc, sc) in next sc; ch 2, (dc, hdc, sc) in next sc; ch 2, (dc , hdc) in next sc; ch 1, slip st into same sc.
Fasten off. Weave in ends.
Backing
Round 1:  With C, ch 2, 6 sc in second ch from the hook; join to first sc – 6 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc; join to first sc – 12 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, [2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc] 6 times; join to first sc – 18 sc.
Round 4:  Ch 1, [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc] 6 times; join to first sc – 24 sc. 
Fasten off.  Weave in ends.
Felting
Before assembling the flower, put the pieces into pillowcases and tie closed. Place them in a washing machine with hot water and a small amount of detergent. Check regularly during the wash cycle until desired amount of felting is achieved. Rinse soap and squeeze out excess water. To shape flower, curve the petals inward, shaping them toward the center; pin or tie petals in place. Let dry. Block remaining pieces into desired shapes and let dry. 
ASSEMBLY
arrange leaves on back of flower, pin into place and stitch to the chrysanthemum with B. Place backing on the chrysanthemum over the leaves; pin and stitch into place with A. Sew bar pin onto back.

materials: Size 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Glue gun and glue stick to cover hanger hook with yarn if desired
measurements: Not specified
gauge: 14 sts and 10 rows = 4 ins [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
BACK and FRONT (make 2 pieces alike).
With MC, ch 57.
1st row:(WS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 56 sc.
2nd row:Ch 3 (counts as dc). Miss first sc. 1 dc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 4 (counts as tr). (Yoh and draw up a loop in next st. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – dc2tog made. Dc2tog over next 2 sts. 1 dc in each dc to last 5 sts. (Dc2tog over next 2 sts) twice. 1 tr in last st. Turn.
4th row:Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sts. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook – sc2tog made. Sc2tog over next 2 sts. 1 sc in each st to last 5 sts. (Sc2tog over next 2 sts) twice. 1 sc in last st. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows 5 times more. 8 sts. Fasten off. Place marker at end of last row.
Joining Back and Front: Place WS of Back and Front tog with hanger in between both pieces, matching shapes and pin them tog. With RS of work facing, join MC with sl st to left marked corner of Front.
Proceed as follows: 1st rnd: Working through both thicknesses: ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. Work 30 sc evenly down left “shoulder” and 3 sc down left side. 3 sc in corner. 1 sc in each of next 54 sc across bottom. 3 sc in corner. 3 sc up right side. Stuff lightly, wrapping stuffing around metal hanger, then work 30 sc evenly up right “shoulder”. Work 16 sc evenly around top edge. Join with sl st in first sc.
2nd rnd: Working around top 16 sc only: ch 1. (Sc2tog) 8 times. Join with sl st in first st.
3rd rnd:Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 4 times. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Edging: Join A with sl st in bottom right corner. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 3. 2 dc) in same sp as last sl st. *Miss next 2 sc. (1 sc. Ch 3. 2 dc) in next sc. Rep from * across to opposite corner. Fasten off.
FLOWER
With A, ch 4. 1st rnd: 1 dc in 4th ch from hook. Ch 3. (Sl st. Ch 3. 1 dc. Ch 3) 4 times in same sp. Sl st in same sp. Fasten off.
Sew Flower to front of hanger as shown in picture.
If desired, use hot glue to attach MC to hanger hook wrapping 2 strands tog at same time around hook.

materials: Bernat® Velvet Minis™ 1 Kit includes: 20 balls (1.2 oz/35 g; 41 yds/38 m) each. Total (25 oz/700 g)
Contrast A  Chocolate 1 ball or 2 yds/ 2 m
Contrast B  Joyful Gold 1 ball or 2 yds/ 2 m
Contrast C  Orchid Hush 1 ball or 6 yds/ 5.5 m
Contrast D  Velveteal 1 ball or 2 yds/ 2 m
Contrast E  Sandy Cream 1 ball or 6 yds/ 5.5 m
Contrast F  Red 1 ball or 7 yds/ 6.5 m
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 2"–3" [5-7 cm] tall.
gauge: 14 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Sunflower
With A, make a Magic Ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 12 sc in magic loop. Pull magic loop tight. Break A. Join B with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.
2nd rnd: With B, working in back loops only, sl st in each sc around. Do not join.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. Working in front loops only, *1 sc in next sl st. Ch 3. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sl st in previous rnd.
Fasten off.

Framed Flower
Front and Back (make alike).
With C, ch 6.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 5 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 2½" [6 cm].
Fasten off.
With D, embroider stem using Chain Stitch and petals using Lazy Daisy stitch.
With E, embroider petals using Lazy Daisy stitch.

Edging: Holding Front and Back tog, join E with sl st to any corner.
1st rnd: Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work sc evenly around edge, having 3 sc in each corner. Join with sl st to first sc.
Fasten off.

Jam Jar
See Diagram on page 4.
Front and Back (make alike).
With F, ch 6.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 5 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 7 sc.
3rd to 9th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
10th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. 5 sts.
Fasten off.

Edging: Holding Front and Back tog, join F with sl st to any corner.
1st rnd: Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work sc evenly around edge, having 3 sc in each corner. Join with sl st to first sc.
Fasten off.

Lid
With RS facing of assembled Jam Jar, join E with sl st to 3rd sc from top right corner.
1st row: (RS). Ch 2. 2 hdc in same sp as sl st. 1 hdc in each of next 3 sc. 1 hdc in next sc. Ch 2. Sl st in same sc as last hdc. Turn work and surface sl st below row of hdc just worked.
Fasten off.

Label
With E, ch 3.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in last ch. Turn. 2 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row 7 times more. 9 rows total.
Fasten off.
Turn work so long edges of Label are top and bottom.
With RS facing, join E with sl st to top left corner of label and work across longer side into side sc of each row as follows:
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in side sc of first 2 rows. Skip next 2 rows. 5 hdc in next sc. Skip next 2 rows. 1 sc in side sc of last 2 rows. Fasten off.
With F, embroider strawberry on label using Satin Stitch.
With D, embroider leaves on label using Straight stitch.
Sew Label to Jam Jar as shown in photo.
Glue bag charm to back of Framed Flower.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 skein each 316 Soft White A, 373 Petal Pink B, and 312 Black C.
RED HEART® “Pomp-a-Doodle™”: 1 ball 9785 Cotton Candy Pink D.
Split-ring stitch marker; stuffing; yarn needle; 2 ½” black buttons (for eyes); black embroidery floss; sewing thread and needle; grosgrain ribbon.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = [draw up a loop in next st] twice, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Cover is 13½” tall.
gauge: 24 sts = 4”; 20 rows = 4” in sc with smallest hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
CLUB COVER
Head
With A and smaller hook, ch 2.
Round 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook – 6 sts.
Round 2: 2 sc in each st around – 12 sts.
Round 3: * 2 sc in next st, sc in next st; repeat from * around – 18 sts.
Round 4: * 2 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts; repeat from * around – 24 sts.
Round 5: * 2 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sts; repeat from * around – 30 sts.
Round 6: * 2 sc in next st, sc in next 4 sts; repeat from * around – 36 sts.
Round 7: * 2 sc in next st; sc in next 5 sts; repeat from * around – 42 sts.
Round 8: * 2 sc in next st; sc in next 6 sts; repeat from * around – 48 sts.
Round 9: * 2 sc in next st, sc in next 7 sts; repeat from * around – 54 sts.
Round 10: Sc in each st around.
Rounds 11-14: Repeat Round 10.
Round 15: * Sc2tog, sc in next 7 sts; repeat from * around – 48 sts.
Round 16: Repeat Round 10.
Round 17: * Sc2tog, sc in next 6 sts; repeat from * around – 42 sts.
Round 18: Repeat Round 10.
Round 19: * Sc2tog, sc in next 5 sts; repeat from * around – 36 sts.
Rounds 20-21: Repeat Round 10.
Round 22: * Sc2tog, sc in next 4 sts; repeat from * around – 30 sts.
Round 23: * Sc2tog, sc in next st; repeat from * around – 20 sts.
Rounds 24-27: Repeat Round 10.
Round 28: * Sc2tog, sc in next st; repeat from * around to last 2 sts; sc2tog – 13 sts.
What lady golfer wouldn’t want to sport our cute poodle in her golf bag. Our clever cover adapts to fit clubs of a variety of sizes. The poodle cover is the perfect gift for Mother’s Day.

Inner Sock
With B and larger hook, ch 31.
Row 1: Working in back loop ONLY, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn – 30 sts.
Rows 2-30: Working in back loop ONLY, ch 1, sc in each st across; turn.
Next Row: Hold sides together and matching sts, slip st together to form tube. Use yarn tail to gather one of the openings closed.

FINISHING
With sewing thread and needle, attach buttons for eyes according to photograph. With embroidery floss, stitch 3 straight lines for eyelashes. Attach Ears to Head. Attach Top Pouf to top of Head. Attach Nose to Head.
Turn Body inside out and sew Inner Sock to neck opening. Turn right side out.
Sew Head to neck opening.
Weave in all ends.
Tie ribbon through st at very top of Top Pouf.

Body
With B and larger hook, ch 15; join with a slip st in 1st st to form ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, 17 sc in ring – 17 sts.
Round 2: * 2 sc in next st, sc in next st; repeat from * around to last st; 2 sc in last st – 26 sts.
Round 3: * 2 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts; repeat from * around to last 2 sts; sc in next 2 sts – 34 sts.
Round 4: * Sc in next st, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around – 51 sts.
Round 5: * Sc in next 4 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around to last st; sc in next st – 61 sts.
Rounds 6-7: Sc in each st around.
Round 8: Ch 2, hdc in each st around.
Rounds 9-12: Hdc in each st around.
Rounds 13-26: Sc in each st around. Fasten off.
With larger hook, join D to any st in Round 8. Slip st in every 3rd st of Rounds 8-12. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

Ears (Make 2)
With A and smaller hook, ch 6; join.
Round 1: Ch 1, 8 sc in ring – 8 sts.
Rounds 2-10: Sc in each st around.
Round 11: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sts] twice – 10 sts.
Round 12: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 4 sts] twice – 12 sts.
Round 13: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 5 sts] twice – 14 sts.
Round 14: Ch 3 (counts as 1st dc), skip first st, dc in each st around; join – 14 sts.
Round 15: Ch 2 (counts as 1st hdc), hdc in each st around; join.
Round 16: Ch 1, * sc2tog, sc in next st; repeat from * around to last 2 sts; sc2tog; do NOT join – 9 sts.
Round 17: * Sc2tog, sc in next st; repeat from * around – 6 sts. Fasten off. Weave tail through sts to close opening.

Nose
With C and smaller hook, ch 2.
Round 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook – 6 sts.
Round 2: 2 sc in each st around – 12 sts.
Rounds 3-4: Sc in each st around.
Round 5: Sc2tog, sc in next 9 sts, slip st in last st – 11 sts. Fasten off.

Top Pouf
With D and larger hook, ch 12; join.
Round 1: 10 slip st in ring.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (Solids: 7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 - Print, Multis, & Heathers: 5 oz/141 g; 236 yds/215 m)
Size U.S. H/8 [5 mm] crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
measurements: Size 1 Small Dog Approximately (Approx) 8" [20.5 cm] wide, Size 2 Large Dog Approximately (Approx) 12" [30.5 cm] wide, Size 3 Human Approximately (Approx) 18" [45.5 cm] wide
gauge: 13 single crochet (sc) and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
The instructions are written for Size 1 size. If changes are necessary, the instructions will be written Size 1 (Size 2 - Size 3). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes.
USING THIS GUIDE
Click on the underlined words throughout the pattern to access our library of helpful tools.

Ch 4. Make a slip knot and place on hook. 
Ch 2.
Work 3 dc in ring. Turn.
1st row is complete.
2nd row: Ch 2. 3 dc in first dc. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in ch-2 space (sp).
Ch 1. 3 dc in last dc. Turn.
2nd row is complete. 
3rd row: Ch 2. 3 dc in first dc. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in ch-2 sp. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 3 dc in last dc. Turn. 
4th row: Ch 2. 3 dc in first dc. Ch 1. *3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * to center ch-2 sp. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in ch-2 sp. Ch 1. **3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Rep from ** to end of row. 3 dc in last dc. Turn. 
Rep 4th row until work across long edge measures 8 (12 - 18)" [20.5 (30.5 - 45.5) cm], ending on a Wrong Side (WS) row. Ch 30 (30 - 45) for Tie. Fasten off.
With RS facing, join yarn with sl st to top right corner of work. Ch 31 (31 - 46). Next row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 29 (29 - 44) ch. Work evenly in sc across width of Bandana. 1 sc in each of next 30 (30 - 45) ch left at end of last row. Fasten off.

materials: Patons® Classic Wool (100 g/3.5 oz) 77732 (That’s Pink) 1 ball
Size 4.5 mm (U.S. 7) crochet hook or size needed to obtain tension.
measurements: Approx 4 ins [10 cm] wide.
gauge: 18 dc and 6 rows = 4 ins [10 cm].
instructions:
Small Petals (make 5)
Ch 4.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working into rem loops on opposite side of ch, 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 hdc in next sc. 2 dc in next sc. 5 dc in next sc. 2 dc in next sc. 1 hdc in next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Fasten off.

Medium Petals (make 6)
Ch 6.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working into rem loops on opposite side of ch, 1 sc in each of next 4 ch. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sc. 2 dc in next sc. 5 dc in next sc. 2 dc in next sc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Fasten off.

Large Petals (make 5)
Ch 9.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 6 ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working into rem loops on opposite side of ch, 1 sc in each of next 7 ch. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sc. 1 dc in each of next 2 sc. 2 dc in next sc. 5 tr in next sc. 2 dc in next sc. 1 dc in each of next 2 sc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Sew ends of each group of petals tog tightly (small, medium and large) overlapping petals slightly to form spirals. Ends of petals will curl. Sew 3 layers of petals tog placing medium layer on top of large layer and small layer on top of medium layer.

materials: Red Heart Super Saver Super Mega Craft Kit
Plastic Charm Backs for Bogg Bag
measurements: Varies based on charm shape, average size of each charm is approximately 3-5 inches in size.
gauge: Not specified.
instructions:
SUN
Round 1: Magic Ring, Chain 1 and make 6 SC in ring, join, chain 1
Round 2: 2 SC in each stitch around, join (12 SC)
Round 3: *chain 3, SC in third chain from hook, slip stitch to join to next SC, chain 4, SC in third chain from hook, HDC in last, slip stitch to join to next SC, repeat from * around making 12 points. 
Fasten off and weave in ends.
Chain 15, SC in second chain from hook, HDC in next two, DC in next two, 2 Triple Crochet in next two, DC in next two, HDC in next two, SC in last. 
Fasten off and weave in ends.
CRESCENT MOON
Magic Ring, chain 1 and make 10 SC in ring, join to first SC
Round 2: *chain 4, SC in second chain, HDC in next, DC in last, skip a stitch and slip stitch to join to the next, repeat around from * making 5 points. 
Fasten off weave in ends.
5-POINT STAR
Round 1: Magic Ring, chain 1 and make 8 SC in ring, join, chain 1
Round 2: 2 SC in each stitch around, join, chain 1 (16 SC)
Round 3: SC in each stitch around, (16 SC)
 Join in planet ring color, chain 1
SC in first stitch, chain 8, skip 8 stitches, join with a SC to next, fasten off.
PLANET
Row 1: With turquoise yarn, Chain 6, SC in second chain from hook and remaining 4 chains, chain 1, turn
Row 2: SC in each stitch, chain 1, turn (5 SC)
Row 3: SC Decrease, SC, SC Decrease, chain 1, turn (3 SC)
Rocket Wings
On last 3 stitches of each of the sides of the rocket join in red yarn, SC, HDC, 2 DC in last stitch. Fasten off and weave in ends.
Row 4-5: SC in each stitch, chain 1, turn (3 SC)
Row 6: Decrease over remaining 3 stitches, continue to SC around the edges of the rocket. When you get back to the top, join in red yarn and make 3 SC in the top stitch, fasten off weave in ends.
Rocket Fire
At the bottom middle stitch, join in yellow yarn, chain 3, slip stitch to join to same middle stitch, chain 5, slip stitch to same middle stitch, chain 3 and slip stitch to join to same bottom middle stitch. Fasten off and weave in ends.
Rocket Window 
With white yarn, magic ring, chain 1 and make 8 SC in ring, join to first SC, fasten off leaving long tail to stitch window onto middle of rocket.
FINISHING
Hot glue plastic charm backs onto backside of crochet motifs.

materials: RED HEART® With Love®: 1 skein each 1101 Eggshell A and 1012 Black B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 5.5 mm [US I-9] and 3.75 mm [US F-5]
Susan Bates® Easy-wrap pompom maker, 1.75” (4.5 cm) diameter
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Cuff measures 3¾” (9.5 cm) wide and 14½ (17)” [37 (43) cm] in circumference.
gauge: 12 sc = 4” (10 cm); 14 rows = 4” (10 cm) with larger hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE.
instructions:
CUFFS (make 2)
With A and larger hook, ch 22.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each sc across – 21 sc.
Rows 2-50 (59): Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

SPOTS (make 4)
With B and smaller (larger) hook, ch 3.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next ch, turn – 2 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc, turn – 4 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 4: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each of next 2 sc, 2 sc in last sc, turn – 6 sc.
Rows 5-6 (7-8): Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 7 (9): Ch 1, sc2tog over first 2 sc, sc in each of next 2 sc, sc2tog over last 2 sc, turn – 4 sc.
Row 8 (10): Ch 1, sc2tog over first 2 sc, sc2tog over last 2 sc, turn – 2 sc.
Row 9 (11): Ch 1, sc2tog over 2 sc, turn – 1 sc.
Row 10 (12): Ch 1, sc in sc.
Fasten off.

EYES (make 4)
With A and smaller hook, ch 3 (4), join with slip st to form ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, 5 (6) sc in ring, join with slip st in first sc.
Fasten off.

PUPILS (make 4)
With B and smaller hook, ch 3 (5), join with slip st in first ch to form ring.
Fasten off.

NOSE (make 2)
With B and smaller hook, ch 2,
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, turn.
Row 2: Ch 1, 3 sc in sc, turn.
Row 3 (for adult size only): Ch 1, sc in each sc across.
Fasten off.

FINISHING
With yarn needle and A, whip stitch first and last rows together. This will be center back seam. Fold cuff evenly in half. Holding cuff with fold facing downward, join A with sc in center back seam at outer edge of cuff, reverse sc around edge, join with slip st in first sc.
Fasten off.

Attach Features
Fold each cuff in half, placing seam at center back. Press pieces very lightly with a warm steam iron, placing double thickness of fabric between iron and features. Place a small dab of craft glue on backs of all features and press firmly onto cuff, using photo as placement guide. Allow to dry briefly. With yarn needle and matching yarn, sew pieces to cuff. Be sure not to catch back side of folded cuff when sewing.
Weave in ends.

POMPOMS
Make 4 pompoms using both colors held together. With yarn needle and tails of yarn at center of pompom, sew a pompom to each side of cuff at the fold. Pull tails up through pompom and out the top. Trim ends even with rest of pompom.

pattern_name: Crochet Full of Woe Lace Collar & Cuffs
materials: Size U.S. 7 [1.5 mm] Susan Bates® Steelite™ crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next st. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
Picot = Ch 3. Sl st in 3rd ch from hook
measurements: Collar Neckband: Approx 15 ( 17)" [ 38 ( 43) cm] around. Cuff Band: Approx 7 ( 9)" [ 18 ( 23) cm] around.
gauge: 10 dc and 4 rows = 1" [2.5 cm].
instructions:
The instructions are written for smaller size. If changes are necessary for larger size the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to both sizes.

Notes:
• Neckband is worked first, then Lace Collar is worked along longer edge of Neckband.
• Ch 3 at beg of row counts as dc.

Neckband
Ch 12. See diagram on page 4.
1st row: 1 dc in 4th ch from hook. 1 dc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 10 dc.
2nd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 9 dc. Turn.
Rep 2nd row 58 ( 66) times more.
Next row: (Buttonhole row). Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Dc2tog. Ch 2. Dc2tog. 1 dc in each of last 3 dc. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sts. 2 sc in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of last 4 sts. 10 sc.** 62 ( 70) rows total. Do not fasten off.

Lace Collar
Turn work sideways and proceed across long side as follows:
1st row: Ch 3. 3 dc around post of first dc. 1 dc around post of next dc. *(2 dc. Ch 2. 2 dc) all around post of next dc. 1 dc around post of next dc. Rep from * 28 ( 32) times. 4 dc around post of next dc. Turn. 29 ( 33) groups of (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc).

2nd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Skip next 3 dc. *(4 tr. Ch 2. 4 tr) all in next ch-2 sp. Skip next 5 dc. 1 dc in next ch-2 sp. Skip next 5 dc. Rep from * 13 ( 15) times more. (4 tr. Ch 2. 4 tr) all in next ch-2 sp. Skip next 3 dc. 1 dc in each of last 4 dc. Turn. 15 ( 17) groups of (4 tr, ch 2, 4 tr).

3rd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. *Ch 1. (1 tr in next tr. 2 tr in next tr) twice. Ch 3. Skip next ch-2 sp. (2 tr in next tr. 1 tr in next tr) twice. Ch 1.** Skip next 5 sts. 1 dc in next ch-2 sp. Skip next 5 sts. Rep from * 6 ( 7) times more, then rep from * to ** once. 1 dc in each of last 4 dc. Turn. 8 ( 9) ch-3 sps.

4th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Skip next ch-1 sp. *Ch 6. Skip next 6 tr. (2 dc. Ch 2. 2 dc) all in next ch-3 sp. Ch 6. Skip next 6 tr.** 1 tr in next ch-1 sp. Skip next dc. 1 tr in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * 6 ( 7) times more, then rep from * to ** once. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of last 4 dc. Turn. 16 ( 18) ch-6 sps.

5th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. *Ch 3. 1 sc in next ch-6 sp. Skip next 2 dc. (4 tr. Ch 2. 4 tr) all in next ch-2 sp. Skip next 2 dc. 1 sc in next ch-6 sp. Ch 3.** 2 tr in next tr. Ch 1. 2 tr in next tr. Rep from * 6 ( 7) times more, then rep from * to ** once. 1 dc in each of last 4 dc. Turn. 8 ( 9) groups of (4 tr, ch 2, 4 tr).

6th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. *Skip next (ch-3 sp, sc). (1 tr in next tr. 2 tr in next tr) twice. Ch 3. Skip next ch-2 sp. (2 tr in next tr. 1 tr in next tr) twice.** Ch 1. Skip next (sc, ch-3 sp and 2 tr). 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next 2 tr. Rep from * 6 ( 7) times more, then rep from * to ** once. Skip next (sc, ch-3 sp). 1 dc in each of last 4 dc. Turn. 8 ( 9) ch-3 sps.

7th to 12th rows: Rep last 3 rows twice more.

13th row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 4 dc. *1 sc in each of next 6 tr. (2 sc. Picot. 2 sc) all in next 3-ch sp. 1 sc in each of next 6 tr.** 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * 6 ( 7) times more, then rep from * to ** once. 1 sc in each of next 4 dc. 8 ( 9) Picots. Fasten off.

Cuff Band (Make 2)
Ch 12. 
1st row: 1 dc in 4th ch from hook. 1 dc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 10 dc.
2nd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 9 dc. Turn.
Rep 2nd row 26 ( 35) times more.
Next row: (Buttonhole row). Ch 3. 1 dc in each of first 2 dc. Dc2tog. Ch 2. Dc2tog. 1 dc in each of last 3 dc. Turn.
Next row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 dc. 2 sc in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of last 4 dc. 10 sc. 30 ( 38) rows total. Do not fasten off.

Lace Cuff
Turn work sideways and proceed across long side as follows:
1st row: Ch 3. 3 dc around post of 1st dc. 1 dc around post of next dc. *(2 dc. Ch 2. 2 dc) all around post of next dc. 1 dc around post of next dc. Rep from * 13 ( 16) times. 4 dc around post of next dc. Turn. 14 ( 17) groups of (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc).

2nd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Skip next 3 dc. *(4 tr. Ch 2. 4 tr) all in next ch-2 sp. Skip next 5 dc. 1 dc in next ch-2 sp. Skip next 5 dc. Rep from * 5 ( 7) times more. (4 tr. Ch 2. 4 tr) all in next ch-2 sp. Skip next 3 dc. 1 dc in each of last 4 dc. Turn. 7 ( 9) groups of (4 tr, ch 2, 4 tr).

3rd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. *Ch 1. (1 tr in next tr. 2 tr in next tr) twice. Ch 3. Skip next ch-2 sp. (2 tr in next tr. 1 tr in next tr) twice. Ch 1.** Skip next 5 sts. 1 dc in next ch-2 sp. Skip next 5 sts. Rep from * 2 ( 3) times more, then rep from * to ** once. 1 dc in each of last 4 dc. Turn. 4 ( 5) ch-3 sps.

4th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Skip next ch-1 sp. *Ch 6. Skip next 6 tr. (2 dc. Ch 2. 2 dc) all in next ch-3 sp. Ch 6. Skip next 6 tr.** 1 tr in next ch-1 sp. Skip next dc. 1 tr in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * 2 ( 3) times more, then rep from * to ** once. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of last 4 dc. Turn. 8 ( 10) ch-6 sps.

5th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. *Ch 3. 1 sc in next ch-6 sp. Skip next 2 dc. (4 tr. Ch 2. 4 tr) all in next ch-2 sp. Skip next 2 dc. 1 sc in next ch-6 sp. Ch 3.** 2 tr in next tr. Ch 1. 2 tr in next tr. Rep from * 2 ( 3) times more, then rep from * to ** once. 1 dc in each of last 4 dc. Turn. 4 ( 5) groups of (4 tr, ch 2, 4 tr).

6th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. *Skip next (ch-3 sp, sc). (1 tr in next tr. 2 tr in next tr) twice. Ch 3. Skip next ch-2 sp. (2 tr in next tr. 1 tr in next tr) twice.** Ch 1. Skip next (sc, ch-3 sp and 2 tr). 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next 2 tr. Rep from * 2 ( 3) times more, then rep from * to ** once. Skip next (sc, ch-3 sp). 1 dc in each of last 4 dc. Turn. 4 ( 5) ch-3 sps.

7th to 9th rows:  Rep last 3 rows once more.

10th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 dc. *1 sc in each of next 6 tr. (2 sc. Picot. 2 sc) all in next 3-ch sp. 1 sc in each of next 6 tr.** 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * 2 ( 3) times more, then rep from * to ** once. 1 sc in each of next 4 dc. 4 ( 5) Picots. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Pin all pieces to measurements and to the desired shape. Cover with a damp cloth leaving cloth to dry. Sew button to Neckband and Cuff Bands centered in 1st row to correspond to Buttonhole. To wear, wrap Collar around neck with Neckband down. Fasten button and fold Lace Collar down over Neckband to create high neck collar. Repeat process for Cuffs on wrists.

materials: 1 ball of AUNT LYDIA'S® Metallic Crochet Thread, Size 10, Art.154M available in 100 yd (91 m) balls
¼" (.5 cm) wide ribbon measuring 10" (25.5 cm) long
abbreviations: () = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Bookmark measures 7½" (19 cm), excluding ribbon.
gauge: Rounds 1 and 2 = 6" (15 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Ch 66.
Foundation Row: Slip st in 12th ch from hook (beginning skipped ch count as first slip st, ch 5, 5 skipped ch), [ch 5, skip next 5 ch, slip st in next ch] 9 times, turn—10 ch-5 spaces.
Round 1: Ch 1, 6 sc in first ch-5 space, (ch 1, 5 sc) in next 8 ch-5 spaces, ch 1, (6 sc, ch 2, 6 sc) in beginning ch space, working in opposite side of Foundation Row, (ch 1, 5 sc) in next 8 ch-5 spaces, ch 1, 6 sc in last ch-5 space, hdc in first sc (hdc counts as last ch-2 space), turn—104 sc, 18 ch-1 spaces, and 2 ch-2 spaces.
Round 2: Ch 4 (counts as first dc and ch-1 space), (dc, [ch 1, dc] twice) in same ch-2 space, **ch 1, dc in next sc, ch 1, skip next 2 sc, sc in next sc, ch 1, skip next 2 sc, {(dc, [ch 1, dc] 3 times) in next ch-1 space, ch 1, skip next 2 sc, sc in next sc*, ch 2, sc in next ch-1 space, ch 2, skip next 2 sc, sc in next sc, ch 1, skip next 2 sc} 5 times, ending last repeat at *, ch 1, skip next 2 sc, dc in next sc, ch 1**, (dc, [ch 1, dc] 3 times) in next ch-2 space, repeat from ** to **; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch, do not turn—28 sc, 52 dc, 64 ch-1 spaces, and 16 ch-2 spaces.
Round 3: Slip st in next ch-1 space, ch 3 (counts as first dc), small picot, *[dc, cl in dc just made, triple picot, (slip st, cl) in dc of last cl made, dc] in next ch-1 space, small picot, dc in next ch-1 space, [small picot, dc] twice in next 2 ch-1 spaces, skip next sc and ch-1 space, sc in next dc, ch 2, skip next ch-1 space, {(sc, picot, sc) in next ch-1 space, sc in next ch-1 space, ch 2, sc in next ch-1 space, sc in next ch-2 space, picot, ch 1, sc in next ch-2 space, sc in next ch-1 space, ch 2, sc in next ch-1 space} 4 times, (sc, picot, sc) in next ch-1 space, ch 2, skip next dc, sc in next dc, skip next ch-1 space and sc, [dc, small picot] twice in next 2 ch-1 spaces*, dc in next ch-1 space, small picot, repeat from * to *; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch—24 dc and 72 sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.
Blocking is optional but recommended for best appearance. To block, fill a bowl with water, add liquid starch if a lightly stiffened finish is preferred. Soak bookmark, then gently finger press out excess liquid, taking care not to pull or twist stitches. Lay piece on a blocking mat and pin out edges to open and emphasize picots. Allow to dry thoroughly before handling. Referring to photograph, weave ribbon from back to front through each ch-5 space. Fold each ribbon end in half lengthwise and trim to make a “V” shape.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby Smoothie™: 1 (2) balls 2168 Capri
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Cover measures 10 (17)" wide x 5½" long [25.5 (43) x 14 cm].
gauge: 16 sts = 4" (10 cm); 14 rows = 4" (10 cm) in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain gauge.
instructions:
COVER
Ch 19.
Row 1 (right side): Ch 1, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—18 sc.
Rows 2–14: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 15: Ch 2 (counts as first hdc here and throughout), slip st in next sc, *hdc in next sc, slip st in next sc; repeat from * across, turn—9 hdc and 9 slip sts.
Rows 16–38 (66): Ch 2, *slip st in next hdc, hdc in next slip st; repeat from * across to beginning ch, slip st in top of beginning ch, turn.
Rows 39–52 (67–80): Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn—18 sc.
Border round: Slip st in each st across, *ch 1; working in ends of rows of long edge, evenly space 62 (90) sc across, ch 1*; working in opposite side of foundation ch, slip st in each ch across, repeat from * to * once; join with slip st in first slip st—160 (216) sts. Fasten off.
FINISHING
With wrong sides together, fold in 3" (7.5 cm) of each flap toward center base. Align top and bottom sts evenly with 38 (66) sts facing and pin in place. Joining row: With right side of long edge facing and working through inner loops only, join yarn with slip st in first st at top corner, slip st in each st across—38 (66) sts. Fasten off. Turn piece so bottom edge is facing and repeat Joining Row. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 400 Grey Heather A and 313 Aran B
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Legwarmer measures 12½” long x 15” circumference at top edge (32 x 38 cm).
gauge: 6 sts = 2” (5 cm); 9 rounds = 4” (10 cm) in pattern. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Edging
Round 1: With right side of top edge facing and working across opposite side of foundation ch, join B with slip st in any ch, ch 3, 2 dc in same ch, skip next 2 ch, slip st in next ch, *3 dc in next ch, skip next 2 ch, slip st in next ch; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—11 3-dc groups.
Cording (make 2)
With A, ch 91.
Row 1: Work 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 9 ch, sc in next 70 sts, 2 sc in last 10 ch—110 sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
With right side of legwarmer facing and seam in back, weave cording through ch-2 spaces of Round 3, beginning and ending at outer side of legwarmer. Evenly adjust ends and tie to fit around leg. 
Weave in ends.
Notes
1. Legwarmer is made in joined rounds from top edge down.
2. To make wider or narrower legwarmers, increase or decrease beginning chains in multiples of 4.
Special Stitch
Fpdc (Front post double crochet) = Yarn over, insert hook from front side of work to back and to front again around post of indicated stitch; yarn over and pull up a loop (3 loops on hook), yarn over and draw through 2 loops (2 loops on hook), yarn over and draw through 2 loops (1 loop on hook).
LEGWARMER (make 2)
With A, ch 44; taking care not to twist, join with slip st in first ch.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 2 (counts as first hdc here and throughout), hdc in each ch around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch, turn—44 hdc.
Round 2: Ch 2, hdc in each st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch, turn.
Round 3: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in next st, *ch 2, skip next 2 sts, dc in next 2 sts; repeat from * around, ch 2, skip last 2 sts; join with slip st in top of beginning ch, 22 dc and 11 ch-2 spaces.
Round 4: Ch 3, dc in next st, 2 dc in first ch-2 space, *dc in next 2 sts, 2 dc in next ch-2 space; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch, turn—44 sts.
Rounds 5–27: Ch 3, dc in next 2 sts, Fpdc around next st, *dc in next 3 sts, Fpdc around next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 28: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Red Heart® Super Glow™ (1.8 oz/50 g; 50 yds/46 m) Aurora Yellow (2001) 1 ball or 25 yds/23 m
Size U.S. 7 [4.5 mm] Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 4½" [11.5 cm] at widest point.
gauge: 16 sc and 18 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: All rnds are joined with sl st to first sc.
STAR (make 2)
With A, beg using magic loop method demonstrated here.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 10 sc in ring. Join. 10 sc. See diagram on page 2.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in same sc as sl st. 1 sc in next sc. *(1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sc as sl st. (2 sc. Ch 2. 2 sc) in next ch-2 sp. [1 sc in each of next 3 sc. (Ch 2. 2 sc) in next ch-2 sp] 4 times. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Join.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sc as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. (2 sc. Ch 2. 2 sc) in next ch-2 p. [1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. (2 sc. Ch 2. 2 sc)] 4 times. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Skip last sc. Join.
5th rnd: Sl st in next sc (2nd sc of rnd). Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. (2 sc. Ch 2. 2 sc) in next ch-2 sp. [1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Skip next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. (2 sc. Ch 2. 2 sc) in next ch-2 sp] 4 times. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Skip next 2 sc. Join. Fasten off.
With WS facing, working into back loops only stitch Stars tog, stuffing lightly as you work. If desired, attach base of key ring chain to top point of Star or create a hanging loop with yarn as shown.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® Super Craft Kit™
Gradients: includes 12 balls (50 g/1.7 oz each; 600 g/21 oz total), yardage (85 m/93 yds each; 1020 m/1116 yds total)
Size U.S. G/6 [4 mm] Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Hot glue gun and glue sticks
abbreviations: Sc3tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 3 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Flower: Approx 1¾" [4.5 cm] wide. Bow: Approx 2½" [6.5 cm] wide x 1¾" [4.5 cm] tall. Heart: Approx 1½" [4 cm] at widest point.
gauge: 16 sc and 17 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
FLOWER
Shown in photos as follows:
With H as Color 1 and E as Color 2. 
With L as Color 1 and I as Color 2. 
With D as Color 1 and A as Color 2. 
With J as Color 1 and C as Color 2. 
With F as Color 1 and K as Color 2.
With O as Color 1 and S as Color 2.
With U as Color 1 and M as Color 2. 
With V as Color 1 and O as Color 2.
With D as Color 1 and P as Color 2.
With M as Color 1 and D as Color 2. 
With Color 1, beg using magic loop method demonstrated here. 
1st rnd: Ch 1. 12 sc in ring. Join Color 2 with sl st to first sc. Break Color 1.
2nd rnd: With Color 2, (1 hdc. 1 dc. 1 hdc) all in same sp as sl st. Sl st in next sc. *(1 hdc. 1 dc. 1 hdc) all in next sc. Sl st in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to base of first hdc. Fasten off.

BOW
Shown in photos in B, D, E, F, J, L, M, N, P , and S. 
Ch 6.
1st row: (WS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 5 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc3tog. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 3 sts.
4th row: Ch 1. Sc3tog. Turn. 1 st.
5th row: Ch 1. 3 sc in next sc. Turn. 3 st.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 5 sc.
7th and 8th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Do not fasten off.
Final rnd: (Work 7 sc evenly across long edge of Bow. 2 sc in next corner sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

BOW TIE
Ch 6.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Fasten off. 5 sc.
Wrap Tie around Bow as shown in photo. Join first st to last st of row to secure, with join on WS of work.

HEART
Shown in photos in A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, M, N, O, and P.
Make Magic Loop.
1st rnd: (Sl st. 1 dc. 3 tr. 3 dc. 1 tr. 3 dc. 3 tr. 1 dc) all in ring. Join with sl st to first sl st. Fasten off. Cinch loop closed tightly.

FINISHING
Apply Charms charm backs using hot glue.

STITCH KEY
= chain (ch)
= slip stitch (sl st)
= double crochet (dc)
= half double crochet (hdc)
= treble crochet (tr)
= single crochet (sc)
= single crochet 3 together (sc3tog)

materials: Feather Trim on Bias Tape, 26 (29, 32)” long
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Finished Length: 28 (31, 34)”
gauge: 14 hdc = 4”; 12 rows = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
BELT/COLLAR
Ch 101 (111, 121).
Row 1: Hdc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across - 100 (110, 120) sts.
Row 2: Ch 2 (counts as hdc), turn, hdc in each hdc across.
Row 3: Repeat Row 2.
Fasten off.
Ties
Ch 78, with right side facing, join yarn at edge of Row 2, ch 1, sc in edge of Row 3, sc in each hdc across, sc in opposite edge of Row 3, sc in edge of Row 2, ch 75.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.
Center right side of feather trim along wrong side of belt/collar and sew in place.
Beading
String bronze seed beads onto beading thread. Beginning 2” from one short edge of belt/collar and working down center of Row 3, *anchor beading thread to belt/collar, slip 10 beads off needle, take a stitch onto belt/collar to anchor thread and secure beads in place; repeat from * across length of belt/collar, ending 2” from opposite short end of belt/collar.
String red beads onto beading thread. Mark center 7” on belt/collar. In same manner, sew a length of red beads in center 7”, working 5 beads between each anchor stitch.

materials: Lily® Sugar ’n Cream (Solids: 70.9 g/2.5 oz/109 m/120 yds) 1 ball each of: White (MC) and Lt Blue (A)
Size 3.5 mm (U.S. E or 4) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
1 yd [95 cm] of ribbon ¼ inch [0.5 cm] wide
measurements: Not specified
gauge: 16 sc and 20 rows = 4 ins [10 cm]
instructions:
FRONT AND BACK (make alike)
With MC, ch 2.
1st row: (RS). 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn. 2 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next sc. Turn. 4 sc.
3rd to 13th rows: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn.
14th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 26 sc.
15th row: As 3rd row. 28 sc.
16th to 22nd rows: As 14th row.
23rd row: (RS). Ch 1. Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook - Sc2tog made. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
24th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sts. Sc2tog over last 2 sts. Turn.
25th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2 sts. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sts. Sc2tog over last 2 sts. Turn.
26th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2 sts. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sts. Fasten off.
With RS of work facing, miss 2 sc of 22nd row. Join MC with sl st to next sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog over last 2 sc. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2 sts. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2 sts. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sts. Sc2tog over last 2 sts. Turn.
Next row: Sl st in each of first 2 sts. Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sts. Sc2tog over last 2 sts. Fasten off.
With A, embroider phrase “Baby’s Room” on Front of pillow with stem st.
Note: When joining Front and Back, place stuffing inside.
Joining Back and Front: Place WS of Front and Back tog. With RS of Front facing you, join MC with sl st to first ch of foundation ch, working through both thicknesses, Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each sp around.
Join A with sl st to first sc. Work 1 sc in each sc around, working 3 sc at bottom point. Join with sl st to first sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right instead of from right to left, as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Make a loop and bow with ribbon and sew on Pillow as shown in picture.
Baby’s Room Sign (to crochet)

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein 254 Pumpkin A
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5 mm [US I-9]
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C etc.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Finished Sizes: Pumpkin 2.25” x 2.75” (5.5 cm x 7 cm), Frankenstein 2.25” x 3” (5.5 cm x 7.5 cm), Bat 2.25” x 5” (5.5 cm x 12.5 cm)
gauge: 2 rounds hdc worked in pattern = 2.25” (5.5 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
PUMPKIN
Round 1: (Right Side) With A, form a magic ring, ch 2 (counts as first hdc), work 9 hdc in ring; slip st in top of ch-2 to join—10 hdc.
Round 2: Ch 1 (does not count as a st), 2 sc into each of next 2 sts, 2 dc into each of next 8 sts, slip st in top of ch-1 to join; fasten off—20 sts.
Pumpkin Stem
With C, leave a 6” (15 cm) tail, ch 6, hdc into second ch from hook, sc into next 4 sts; fasten off, leaving a 6” (15 cm) tail. Use tail ends to fasten Stem to Pumpkin, attaching sc portion on Round 2 with Right Side facing.
Pumpkin Face
Use fabric scissors to cut two triangle eyes and one jack-o-lantern mouth from the black felt. Referring to photograph for placement, arrange felt pieces. Using hot glue gun, carefully fasten each piece into place.
FRANKENSTEIN
Round 1: (Right Side) With C, form a magic ring, ch 2 (counts as first hdc now and throughout), work 9 hdc in ring; slip st in top of ch-2 to join—10 hdc.
Round 2: Ch 2, hdc in same st, 2 hdc in each st around; slip st in top of ch-2 to join; fasten off—20 hdc.
Frankenstein Hair
With Right Side facing, attach B in any st from Round 2, ch 2 (counts as first dc), dc in the next st, hdc in the next 4 sts, dc into the next st, ch 2 and slip st in the next st; fasten off—8 sts.
Frankenstein Bolt
With Right Side facing, attach D 2 sts below right side of Hair; ch 4, slip st into same space; fasten off. With Right Side facing, attach D 2 sts below left side of Hair; ch 4, slip st into same sp; fasten off.
Frankenstein Stitches
With Right Side facing, attach B and cut 12” (30.5 cm) of yarn. Referring to photograph for placement, use crochet hook or yarn needle to add Frankenstein stitches. Fasten off on Wrong Side.
Frankenstein Eyes
Use fabric scissors and hole punch to cut two flat-topped circles from the black felt. Referring to photograph for placement, arrange felt pieces. Using hot glue gun, carefully fasten each piece into place.
BAT
Round 1: (Right Side) With B, form a magic ring, ch 2 (counts as first hdc now and throughout), work 9 hdc in ring; slip st in top of ch-2 to join—10 hdc.
Round 2: Ch 2, hdc in same st, 2 hdc in each st around; slip st in top of ch-2 to join; fasten off—20 hdc.
Bat Wings (Make 2)
With B, leave a 6” (15 cm) tail; ch 7, turn.
Row 1: Skip 1 ch, sc2tog over next 2 ch, (hdc, picot, hdc) in the next ch, sc in the next ch, (hdc, picot, hdc) in the next ch, sc in the last ch; fasten off.
With Right Side facing and referring to photograph for placement, use end tail to fasten Left Wing to Round 2 of Bat. Flip Right Wing over so it mirrors Left Wing, skip 5 sts on the bottom, and fasten Right Wing to Bat.
Bat Teeth
With E, cut 24” (61 cm) of yarn. With Right Side of Bat facing and referring to photograph for placement, use crochet hook or yarn needle to add Teeth. Fasten off on Wrong Side.
FINISHING (all)
Use fabric scissors to cut out the following shapes from your black felt for each Trim:
• Backing: 2” (5 cm) circle
• Hanger: 1.25” (3 cm) long x ¾” (2 cm) wide rounded-top rectangle (use hole punch to cut a circle out of the rounded-top end)
Arrange Backing and Hanger, so that Hanger is between Backing and Trim, and punched hole is exposed on top. Using hot glue gun, carefully fasten Trim to felt pieces. Cut 15” (38 cm) of B and E. Hold together and knot evenly through punched hole. Use tails to tie onto gift bag.

abbreviations: 3-trCluster (Cl): *Yarn over (twice), insert hook in indicated st or sp, yarn over, draw up a loop, [yarn over, draw through 2 loops on hook] twice; repeat from * twice, yarn over, draw through remaining loops on hook.
Small Shell (shell): Ch 1, [dc, ch 1] 3 times in indicated st.
Heart Shell (Heart): (Dc, [ch 4, dc in top of previous dc, dc] twice) in indicated st.
Beaded Chain Stitch (bch): Side bead up thread, close to hook, yarn over, draw thread through loop.
Beaded Single Crochet (bsc): Insert hook in st or space, yarn over, draw up a loop, slide bead up close to hook, yarn over, draw thread through both loops on hook.

Bride’s Garter
The bridal garter is an honored tradition. 
Create this especially-for-the-bride garter 
crocheted in a beautiful lacy pattern and 
embellished with elegant glass beads.
GARTER
Center Strip 
Ch 256; join into a ring with a slip st in first ch.
Round 1: Ch 1, working in back bump of ch 
sts, sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in each ch 
around; join with a slip st in first sc—256 sc.
Round 2: Ch 5 (counts as tr, ch 1), skip first st, 
skip next st, *Cl in next st, ch 1, skip next st**, 
tr in next st, ch 1, skip next st; repeat from * 
around, ending last repeat **; join with a slip 
st in 4th ch of beginning ch-5—32 Cl, 32 tr.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in first st, sc in each st and 
ch-1 space around; join with a slip st in first 
sc—256 sc. 
First Lace Edging
Round 1: Ch 1, sc in first st, sc in each of next 
2 sts, *skip next st, shell in next st, skip next 
st**, sc in each of next 5 sts; repeat from * 
around, ending last repeat at **, sc in each 
of last next 2 sts; join with a slip st in first 
sc—32 shells; 160 sc.
Rnd 4: Ch 1, sc in first st, *ch 3, skip next 
5 sts, Heart in next st, ch 3, skip 5 sts**, sc 
in next st; repeat from * around, ending last 
repeat at **; join with a slip st in first sc—32 
sc, 32 Hearts, 64 ch-3 spaces. Fasten off.
Second Lace Edging
With right side facing, working across opposite 
side of foundation ch, join thread to in ch at 
base of first sc in Round 1 of Center Strip. 
Rounds 1-2: Repeat Rounds 1-2 of First Lace 
Edging.
Flower Petals
Leaving a sewing length, ch 2.
Round 1 (right side): Work 10 sc in 2nd ch 
from hook; join with a slip st in first sc, tighten 
beginning tail to close center—10 sc.
Finished measurements: 2” (5 cm) wide x 32” 
(81.5 cm) long (adjustable), without elastic 
Fitting Tip: Elastic should be ¾” smaller than 
bride’s thigh measurement once sewn into 
a ring. Crocheted Garter should be 2” (5.1 
cm) less than twice the thigh measurement.
Foundation can be adjusted in increments of 8
ch sts to make larger or smaller as needed.
Special Abbreviations
3-trCluster (Cl): *Yarn over (twice), insert hook
in indicated st or sp, yarn over, draw up a loop,
[yarn over, draw through 2 loops on hook]
twice; repeat from * twice, yarn over, draw
through remaining loops on hook.
Small Shell (shell): Ch 1, [dc, ch 1] 3 times in
indicated st.
Heart Shell (Heart): (Dc, [ch 4, dc in top of
previous dc, dc] twice) in indicated st.
Beaded Chain Stitch (bch): Side bead up
thread, close to hook, yarn over, draw thread
through loop.
Beaded Single Crochet (bsc): Insert hook in
st or space, yarn over, draw up a loop, slide
bead up close to hook, yarn over, draw thread
through both loops on hook.
Pattern Notes
Garter is crocheted in 2 steps. First a mesh 
strip is worked in the round with one side 
of lace edging crocheted off top of strip. 
Then thread is attached to opposite side of 
foundation ch and matching lace edging is 
crocheted around d opposite side of strip. 
Flower is crocheted in 2 parts, then sewn 
together and sewn to center strip of garter.
Once crocheted part of garter is finished, 
elastic is woven through center strip and ends 
are sewn together.
Designed by Andee Graves

Round 2: Ch 1, (sc, ch 5, sc) in first st, ch 1, 
skip next st, *(sc, ch 5, sc) in next st, ch 1; 
repeat from * around; join with a slip st in first 
sc—5 ch-5 spaces.
Round 3: Ch 1, (sc, hdc, 4 dc, ch 1, bch 1, ch 
1, 4 dc, hdc, sc) in each ch-5 space around; 
join with a slip st in first sc—5 petals. Fasten 
off.
Flower Center 
Ch 2.
Round 1 (right side): Work 5 sc in 2nd ch 
from hook; join with a slip st in first sc, tighten 
beginning tail to close center—5 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 bsc in each st around; join 
with a slip st in first sc—10 bsc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends on Garter Strip.
For Flower, weave ends to middle of Petals 
and Center. Using tails, sew center to middle 
of petals, then sew completed flower on right 
side to a cluster on garter center strip.
Weave elastic through Round 2 of Center Strip, 
pushing tr sts to back and clusters to front. 
With sewing needle and thread, sew ends of 
elastic together.  
ABBREVIATIONS
bch = beaded ch; bsc = beaded single 
crochet; ch = chain; hdc = half double 
crochet; dc = double crochet; sc = single 
crochet; st(s) = stitch(es); ( ) = work 
directions in parentheses into same st; [ ] = 
work directions in brackets the number of 
times specified; * = repeat whatever follows 
the * as indicated.

RED HEART® Boutique Sassy Fabric™: 1 hank 9936 Pink Dot OR 9334 Red Dot B

[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Pin measures about 5” (12.5 cm) diameter
gauge: 3 rounds in pattern measures about 1½” (38 mm) across. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.

Ruffled Rose Pin
Crochet a fabric rose to adorn a jacket, wear at your waist or update a hat. We’re sure you’ll find many occasions to enjoy wearing this pin…or perhaps giving it! Make it in any of the trendy fabrics available in Boutique Sassy. Each hank has enough yardage to make two flowers.
Round 1 (right side): Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Place marker in first sc to indicate beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is completed. Draw about 2½” (6.5 cm) of beginning tail of B through open center of round from right side to wrong side. Pull on beginning tail of A to close opening tightly around tail of B; join with slip st in first (marked) sc—6 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 RfldSC in each of next 6 sts, hold B to wrong side of work; join with slip st in first st—12 RfldSC.
Fasten off A. Cut B, leaving a 2½” (6.5 cm) tail.
Pin Back Circle
With A, leaving an 8” (20.5 cm) beginning tail, make an adjustable slip knot and place it on hook, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc—12 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, [sc in next st, 2 sc in next st] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—18 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a 10” (25.5 cm) tail.
FINISHING
Finish Ruffled Circle: Weave in tails of A. On wrong side, tie ends of B together tightly with a square knot. Trim excess fabric.
Finish Pin Back Circle: With beginning tail, sew pin back to right side of pin back circle. Weave in remainder of beginning tail on wrong side.
Assemble: Hold ruffled circle and pin back circle with wrong sides together and pin back circle centered on ruffled circle. With ending tail sew pin back circle to ruffled circle sewing through tops of Round 2 sts of ruffled circle and in to gully between Rounds 2 and 3 of pin back circle. Weave in any remaining ends.
Special Stitch
RfldSC (ruffled single crochet) = With loop of A on hook and holding B with holes along top, insert hook through a hole from front of fabric to back, [lift hook over top edge of fabric and insert through next hole from front to back] 4 times, insert hook into indicated stitch or space on project, yarn over and draw loop through project and through fabric on hook until only 2 loops of A remain on hook, yarn over and draw through remaining 2 loops.
Special Technique
Adjustable-slip knot = Create your beginning slip knot as usual but pull up the loop from the beginning tail instead of the working yarn. This allows the first chain loop to be expanded when working the first round of stitches and then closed tightly by pulling on the beginning tail.

Rep from * to opposite corner of hanger (approx 11 shells total). Fasten off.
