instructions:
USING THIS GUIDE
Click on the underlined words throughout the pattern to access our library of helpful tools.
NOTES
• Emoticon is made from two circular Head pieces.
• Each Head piece is worked in continuous rounds (spiral).
• One Head piece is embroidered with a smiley face. Then the Head pieces are sewn together and lightly stuffed using extra yarn.
• Optionally, a split key ring is attached to the top of each finished Emoticon.

Head (make 2 the same)
Make a slip knot and place it on the hook.
Slip knot
Make a loop with yarn and fold it on itself to make a pretzel shape. Then pull through to make slip knot.

Chain (ch) 2.
Yarn over hook (Yoh), draw through loop – 1 chain made.
Repeat (rep) last step once more – 2 chains made.
1st rnd: Work 6 single crochet (sc) in second ch from hook. Do not turn.
Insert hook into second ch from hook under the two top loops (do not count loop on hook as a chain); yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through both loops on hook – 1 sc made.
Rep last step 5 times more – 6 sc made. Continue (cont) working in a spiral as follows:
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each of next 6 sc. 12 sc total.
Rep 5 times more around – 12 sc made.
3rd rnd: (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. 18 sc total.
4th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. Slip stitch (sl st) into first sc. 24 sc total.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Repeat (rep) Head instructions for 2nd piece.
With small amount of black yarn, and yarn needle, embroider face details onto one Head piece, using photo as guide.
Finishing
Using yarn needle and long tails from Head pieces, whipstitch (see diagram) two Head pieces together (tog) halfway around outside of circle, with smiley face facing out. Using leftover yarn, wrap around 3 fingers 30 times. Trim yarn, leaving a long tail, and slide wraps off fingers. Using the tail, tie around bundle of yarn to create stuffing. Stuff Head pieces with yarn bundle before completing the seam. Weave in all yarn tails. Optionally, attach split key ring to top of Emoticon.
We love seeing your makes! Share your photos using #YARNSPO and tag us @yarnspirations on Instagram or find us on Facebook.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Size U.S. F/5 [3.75 mm] Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Picot = Ch 3. Sl st in 3rd ch from hook
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Small (Table Lamp) – 20" [51 cm] circumference x 8" [20.5 cm] tall, excluding pompom trim. Large (Floor Lamp) – 40" [101.5 cm] circumference x 11" [28 cm] tall, excluding pompom trim.
gauge: 19 sc and 21 rows = 4" [10 cm]. 19 sts (dc and ch-1 sps) and 9 rows = 4" [10 cm] in Stripe Pat.
instructions: Note: Only use LED bulbs with this acrylic lampshade. Do not use incandescent, halogen, or any other type of bulb as they may generate excessive heat, which could damage the acrylic material or pose a fire risk. The instructions are written for Small size. If changes are necessary for larger size the instructions will be written Small (Large). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to both sizes. MOTIFS Motif I: Make 2 (4) using A as Color 1, B as Color 2, and C as Color 3. Motif II: Make 2 (4) using B as Color 1, C as Color 2, and A as Color 3. Motif III: Make 2 (4) using C as Color 1, A as Color 2, and B as Color 3. Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st. See Diagrams on page 4. With Color 1, beg using magic loop method, demonstrated here. 1st rnd: Ch 2. (3 dc in ring. Ch 3) 4 times. Join with sl st to first dc. Fasten off Color 1. 2nd rnd: Join Color 2 with sl st to any ch-3 sp. Ch 2. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. [Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp] 3 times. Ch 1. 3 dc in first ch-3 sp. Ch 3. Join with sl st to first dc. Fasten off Color 2. 3rd rnd: Join Color 3 to any ch-3 sp. Ch 2. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. [Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp] 3 times. Ch 1. 3 dc in first ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. Join with sl st to first dc. Fasten off. Following Assembly Diagram on page 3, join Motifs tog into a strip, whipstitching through back loops only. Join first and last Motifs to form a ring. WHIPSTITCH Upper Granny Stripes Stripe Pat With A, work 1 rnd. With B, work 1 rnd. With C, work 1 rnd. These 3 rnds form Stripe Pat. With RS facing, join A with sl st to top right ch-3 sp of any Motif. **1st rnd: Ch 2. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. (Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp) twice. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. *3 dc in next ch-3 sp (next Motif). (Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp) twice. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first dc. Break A. 2nd rnd: Join B with sl st to any ch-1 sp. Ch 2. 3 dc in same ch-1 sp. Ch 1. *3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dc.  Break B.** First 2 rnds of Stripe Pat are now complete. Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep 2nd rnd 4 (10) times more. Do not fasten off C. Top Edging See Diagram on page 4. 1st rnd: With C, ch 1. 1 sc in each dc and ch-1 sp around. Join. 96 (192) sts. 2nd rnd: Ch 1. [Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Ch 3. Sl st in 3rd ch from hook – Picot made. (1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Picot) 18 times] once (twice).  Fasten off. Lower Granny Stripes With RS facing, join A with sl st to bottom right ch-3 sp of any Motif. Work from ** to ** as given for Upper Granny Stripes. With C, rep 2nd rnd once more. Do not fasten off C. Lower Edging See Diagram on page 4. 1st rnd: With C, ch 1. 1 sc in each dc and ch-1 sp around. Join. 96 (192) sts. 2nd rnd: Ch 1. [Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Picot. (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Picot) 18 times] once (twice).  Join. Fasten off. Bobble Trim With RS facing, join A with sl st to any ch-2 sp along bottom of Lampshade.

materials: RED HEART® Boutique™ Sashay™: 1 ball Salsa
RED HEART® Soft: 1 ball 9275 Paprika B.
measurements: Flower measures 6½” diameter
gauge: Gauge is not important to this project.
instructions:
Ruffled Chain
Stretch out a length of A (continue to stretch out area before you work it). Insert hook into edge of A without the metallic and form a chain that is 16” long using the Sashay crochet chain method in the video.
Row 1: Sc along side of the chain. Place stitch holder in last stitch to keep it from unraveling, and set aside.
Circular Base
Ch 6; Join.
Round 1: 9 sc in center.
Round 2: 2 sc in each sc—18 sc. Join.
Round 3: 2 sc in each sc—36 sc; join, leaving a 21” for sewing.
Thread an 18” length of yarn B into needle. Starting at outer edges, sew ruffled chain around circular base. Continue to spiral toward center filling in all areas, and securing with small stitches as you go. Take small stitches to secure; weave in ends.

materials: Patons® Classic Wool Worsted™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 194 yds/177 m) Honey (77756) 3 balls
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Cr4B = Skip next 2 stitches. 1 dcfp around post of each of next 2 stitches. Working behind 2 dcfp just made, 1 dcfp around post of each of 2 skipped stitches 2 rows below.
Cr4F = Skip next 2 stitches. 1 dcfp around post of each of next 2 stitches. Working in front of 2 dcfp just made, 1 dcfp around post of each of 2 skipped stitches 2 rows below.
Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: Front: Approx 12" [30.5 cm] wide x 10” [25.5 cm] deep from shoulder. Back: Approx 12” [30.5 cm] wide x 8” [20.5 cm] deep from shoulder.
gauge: 14 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes:
• Ch 2 at beg of row counts as hdc.
• When working Cr4F, Cr4B and Dcfp sts in cable pat on RS rows, always skip sts directly behind them from previous row.
• Front has Cable Pat and is 2" [5 cm] longer than Back.
• Back has side details with plain center section.

FRONT
***Ribbing: Ch 46. See diagram on page 4.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook (counts as 2 hdc). 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 45 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. *1 dcbp around post of next hdc. 1 dcfp around post of next hdc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 dcbp around post of next hdc. 1 hdc in top of turning ch-2. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. *1 dcfp around post of next st. 1 dcbp around post of next st. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 dcfp around post of next st. 1 hdc in top of turning ch-2. Turn.
4th row: Ch 2. *1 dcbp around post of next st. 1 dcfp around post of next st. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 dcbp around post of next st. 1 hdc in top of turning ch-2. Turn.***
Proceed in pat as follows:
Set-up 1st row: (RS). Ch 1. (1 sc in next st. 1 dcfp around post of next st 2 rows below) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. Cr4F. 1 sc in each of next 6 sts. Cr4F. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Cr4F. 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. (1 dcfp around post of next st. 1 sc in next st) 3 times. Turn. 46 sts.
2nd and WS rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. (1 sc in next sc. 1 dcfp around post of next st 2 rows below) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. *1 dcfp around post of each of next 2 dcfp 2 rows below. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. 1 dcfp around post of each of next 2 dcfp 2 rows below. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. Rep from * twice more. (1 dcfp around post of next dcfp 2 rows below. 1 sc in next sc) 3 times. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. (1 sc in next sc. 1 dcfp around post of next st 2 rows below) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. *1 dcfp around post of each of next 2 dcfp 2 rows below. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. 1 dcfp around post of each of next 2 dcfp 2 rows below.** 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * once more, then from * to ** once. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. (1 dcfp around post of next dcfp 2 rows below. 1 sc in next sc) 3 times. Turn.
7th row: Ch 1. (1 sc in next sc. 1 dcfp around post of next st 2 rows below) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. 1 dcfp around post of each of next 2 dcfp 2 rows below. *1 sc in each of next 6 sts. 1 dcfp around post of each of next 4 dcfp 2 rows below. Rep from * once more. 1 sc in each of next 6 sts. 1 dcfp around post of each of next 2 dcfp 2 rows below. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. (1 dcfp around post of next dcfp 2 rows below. 1 sc in next sc) 3 times. Turn.
9th row: Ch 1. (1 sc in next sc. 1 dcfp around post of next st 2 rows below) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. 1 dcfp around post of each of next 2 dcfp 2 rows below. *1 sc in each of next 6 sts. Cr4B. Rep from * once more. 1 sc in each of next 6 sts. 1 dcfp around post of each of next 2 dcfp 2 rows below. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. (1 dcfp around post of next dcfp 2 rows below. 1 sc in next sc) 3 times. Turn.
11th row: Ch 1. (1 sc in next sc. 1 dcfp around post of next st 2 rows below) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. *1 dcfp around post of each of next 2 dcfp 2 rows below. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. 1 dcfp around post of each of next 2 dcfp 2 rows below.** 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * once more, then from * to ** once. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. (1 dcfp around post of next dcfp 2 rows below. 1 sc in next sc) 3 times. Turn.
13th row: Ch 1. (1 sc in next sc. 1 dcfp around post of next st 2 rows below) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. *1 dcfp around post of each of next 2 dcfp 2 rows below. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. 1 dcfp around post of each of next 2 dcfp 2 rows below. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. Rep from * twice more. (1 dcfp around post of next dcfp 2 rows below. 1 sc in next sc) 3 times. Turn.
15th row: Ch 1. (1 sc in next sc. 1 dcfp around post of next st 2 rows below) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. *1 dcfp around post of each of next 4 dcfp 2 rows below. 1 sc in each of next 6 sts. Rep from * once more. 1 dcfp around post of each of next 4 dcfp 2 rows below. 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. (1 dcfp around post of next dcfp 2 rows below. 1 sc in next sc) 3 times. Turn.
17th row: Ch 1. (1 sc in next sc. 1 dcfp around post of next st 2 rows below) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. (Cr4F. 1 sc in each of next 6 sts) twice. Cr4F. 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. (1 dcfp around post of next st. 1 sc in next st) 3 times. Turn.
18th row: As 2nd row.
Rep 3rd to 18th rows for Cable Pat until work from beg measures approx 7½" [19 cm], ending on a 18th row of pat.

Shape neck: Next row: (RS). Pat across 16 sts (neck edge). Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. Pat to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows twice more, then 1st row once. 9 sts rem.
Work 3 rows even in pat.
Fasten off.
With RS facing, skip next 14 sts. Join yarn with sl st to next st. Ch 1 (does not count as st). Pat to end of row. Turn.
1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Pat to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows twice more, then 1st row once. 9 sts rem.
Work 3 rows even in pat.
Fasten off.

BACK
Work from *** to *** as given for Front.
Set-up 1st row: (RS). Ch 1. (1 sc in next st. 1 dcfp around post of next st 2 rows below) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 16 sts. 2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 16 sts. (1 dcfp around post of next st. 1 sc in next st) 3 times. Turn. 46 sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. (1 sc in next sc. 1 dcfp around post of next st 2 rows below) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 34 sts. (1 dcfp around post of next st. 1 sc in next st) 3 times. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows until work from beg measures 8" [20.5 cm], ending on a WS row.
Fasten off.

COLLAR
Sew shoulder seams.
Note: Collar is worked side to side.
Ch 30.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook (counts as 2 hdc). 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 29 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. *1 hdc in horizontal bar created below next hdc (below loops normally worked – see diagram). Rep from * to last st. 1 hdc in top of ch-2. Turn.
Rep last row until Collar (when slightly stretched) measures length to fit around neck edge. Fasten off.
Sew side of Collar to neck edge, having Collar seam at left shoulder. Sew Collar seam. Fold Collar in half towards RS as shown.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (198 g/7 oz; 333 m/364 yds)
Contrast A Black (0312) 1 ball or 18 yds/16.5 m
Contrast B Cherry Red (0319) 1 ball or 11 yds/10 m
Contrast C Soft White (0316) 1 ball or 11 yds/10 m
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcf = Double crochet in front of work
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
Scbl = Single crochet through back loop only
measurements: Approx 5” [12.5 cm] tall.
gauge: 14 sc and 16 rows = 4”[10 cm].
instructions:
BOOTS (make 2) 
With A, ch 5. See diagram on page 2.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 
1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 3 sc in 
last ch. Do not turn. Working in 
rem loops of foundation ch, 1 sc in 
each of next 2 ch. 2 sc in last ch. 
Join with sl st to first sc. 10 sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc 
in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in each of 
next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 
2 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join with 
sl st to first sc. 16 sc. 
3rd rnd:  Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc 
around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 
5 sc. (Sc2tog) 3 times. 1 sc in each 
of last 5 sc. Join with sl st to first 
sc. 13 sts. 
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 
3 sc. (Sc2tog) 3 times. 1 sc in each 
of last 4 sc. Join with sl st to first 
sc. 10 sts. 


6th to 8th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each 
st around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Fasten off.

CHIMNEY 
Note: Ch 3 at beg of rnds counts 
as dc. 
With B, ch 20. Join with sl st to first 
ch, taking care not to twist ch. 
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch 
around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
20 sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 
2 sc. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 dc in 
each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to last 
sc. Ch 1. Skip last sc. Join C with 
sl st to top of ch 3. 
3rd rnd: With C, ch 1. *1 sc in each 
of next 3 dc. Working in front of 
and not around rows,  work 1 dc 
in skipped sc 2 rnds below – dcf 
made. Rep from * around. Join B 
with sl st to first sc. 
4th rnd:  With B, ch 4 (counts as 
dc and ch 1). *Skip next sc. 1 dc 
in each of next 3 sts (sc and dcf ). 
Ch 1. Rep from * to last 3 sts. Skip 
next sc. 1 dc in each of last 2 sts. 
Join C with sl st to 3rd ch of ch 4. 
5th rnd: With C, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 
*1 dcf in skipped sc 2 rnds below. 
1 sc in each of next 3 dc. Rep from 
* to last 3 sts. 1 dcf in skipped sc 2 
rnds below. 1 sc in each of last 2 dc. 
Join B with sl st to first sc. 
6th rnd: With B, as 2nd rnd. Join  C. 
Break B. 
7th rnd: As 3rd rnd.
8th rnd:  With C, *1 tr in next st. 
Sl st in next st. Rep from * around. 
Join with sl st to first tr. Fasten off. 

Top 
With C, ch 2. 
1st rnd: 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 
Join with sl st to first sc. 5 sc. 
2nd rnd:  Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc 
around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
10 sc. 
3rd rnd: As 2nd rnd. 20 sc. Fasten 
off.  

FINISHING 
Stuff Boots. Sew top of Boots to 
RS of Chimney Top. Attach Top to 
Chimney as shown in picture.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream Main Color (Blue) 1 ball
Size 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
2 tea-towels and 2 buttons for both Towel Toppers.
measurements: 5 ins [12.5 cm] for the buttonhole.
gauge: 14 hdc and 10 rows = 4 ins [10 cm].
instructions:
Stripe Version
Note:To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook. Draw loop of next color through 2 loops on hook to complete st and proceed.
Stripe Pattern
Work 2 rows with MC.
Work 2 rows with A.
Work 2 rows with MC.
Work 2 rows with B.
Work 2 rows with MC.
Work 2 rows with A.
Work 2 rows with MC.
These 14 rows form Stripe Pat.
With MC, ch 9.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 8 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: (Buttonhole row). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of ﬁrst 3 sc. Ch 2. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Turn.
4th row:Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in ch 2 sp. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. 8 sc. Turn.
5th row:Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 5 ins [12.5 cm] ending with WS facing for next row.
Next row:Ch 2. 1 hdc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Working in Stripe Pattern, proceed as follows:
1st row: With MC, ch 2. 2 hdc in ﬁrst hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Turn. 10 hdc.
2nd and alt rows:Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. 2 hdc in ﬁrst hdc. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 14 hdc.
5th, 7th and 9th rows:As 1st row.
20 hdc after 9th row.
11th row: Ch 2. 2 hdc in ﬁrst hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
24 hdc.
13th row: With MC, ch 2. 2 hdc in ﬁrst hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Turn. 26 hdc.
14th row:Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Fasten off.
Edging:With RS of work facing, join B with sl st to any corner sc. Ch 1. 3 sc in same sp as last sl st. Work 1 rnd of sc, having 3 sc in corners. Join with sl st to ﬁrst sc. Fasten off.
Solid Version
Work as given for Stripe Version, omitting all references to color changes.
Edging:With RS of work facing, join B with sl st to any corner sc. Ch 1. 3 sc in same sp as last sl st. Work 1 rnd of sc, having 3 sc in corners. Join with sl st to ﬁrst sc. Fasten off.
Daisy Motif:Make 2 Daisy Motifs (one for each Towel Topper).
With Yellow, ch 5. Join in rnd.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 10 sc in rnd. Join White with sl st to ﬁrst sc.
2nd rnd: With Yellow, ch 1. 1 sc in ﬁrst sc. *Ch 7. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 3 ch. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to ﬁrst sc. 5 petals.
3rd rnd:Ch 1. 1 sc in missed sc in last rnd. *Ch 7. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 3 ch. 1 sc in next missed sc in last rnd. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to ﬁrst sc. 5 petals.
Note:5 petals from 2nd rnd should alternate with 5 petals from 3rd rnd.
Fasten off.
Fold top down 3½ ins [9 cm] and mark position for button. Sew button in position. Sew Daisy Motif to Towel Topper as shown in picture. Pleat tea-towel to ﬁt and sew in position.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Fashion Crochet size 3: 1 ball each 775 Warm Rose A and 12 Black B
black satin ribbon ¼” (6.35 mm) x 10” (25 cm)
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C etc
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Bookmark measures 2” x 6½” (5.1 x 16.5 cm), without ribbon.
gauge: circle = 1¼” (3.2 cm) diameter. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain gauge given.
instructions:
Bookmark
Circle (Make 4)
With A, make adjustable ring.
Round 1: Ch 3 (counts as dc), work 25 dc in ring; join with slip st in first dc; pull loose end to close ring as much as possible—26 dc. Fasten off.
Border
Round 1 (Joining Round): Join B in any dc of first circle, (ch 4 (counts as dc, ch 1), dc) in same st, *[ch 1, skip 2 dc, dc in next dc, ch 1, skip 2 dc, work Double V-st in next dc] twice, ch 1, skip 2 dc, dc in next dc, ch 1, skip 2 dc, V-st in next dc (leaving remaining sts on circle unworked)*; [in any dc of next circle, work V-st, ch 1, skip 2 dc, dc in next dc, ch 1, skip 2 dc, V-st in next dc] twice; in any dc of last circle, work V-st, repeat from * to *; [skip 7 sts from last V-st of next circle, V-st in next dc, ch 1, skip 2 dc, dc in next dc, ch 1, skip 2 dc, V-st in next dc] twice; join with slip st in 3rd ch of first ch-4—12 V-st, 4 Double V-st and 10 dc.
Round 2: Working loosely, ch 1, *[2 sc in next V-st, sc in next ch sp, sc in next dc, sc in next ch sp, 2 sc in next V-st, (sc, ch 2, sc) in center dc of next Double V-st] twice*, **[2 sc in next V-st, sc in next ch space, sc in next dc, sc in next ch sp, 2 sc in next V-st, (sc, ch 2, sc) in center dc of next Double V-st] twice; repeat from * to *; join with slip st in first sc—78 sc and 4 ch-2 spaces. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends. Block lightly as desired on Wrong Side with warm iron. Insert ends of ribbon on either side of center dc on one end of bookmark; pass ends through loop and pull gently to tighten.

materials: RED HEART® Team Spirit™: 1 skein 947 Royal/White
13” [33 cm] x 13” [33 cm] foam stadium seat
abbreviations: sc2tog: [Draw up a loop in next st] twice, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
measurements: Sized to fit a 13” [33 cm] x 13” [33 cm] foam sporting seat, available at most sporting goods stores.
gauge: 12 sc = 4” [10 cm]; 12 rows = 4” [10 cm] in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SEAT COVER (Make 2)
Ch 32. 
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across – 31 sts.
Rows 2-5: Ch 1, turn, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each sc to last sc, 2 sc in last sc – 39 sc on last row worked.
Rows 5-24: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across. 
Row 25: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc in each sc to last 2 sc, sc 2tog – 37 sc.
Rows 26-32: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across. 
Row 33: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc in each sc to last 2 sc, sc2tog – 35 sc.
Rows 34-35: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across. 
Shape First Side
Row 36 (Right Side): Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc in next 10 sc, leave remaining sts unworked – 11 sc.
Row 37: Ch 1, turn, sc in next 9 sc, sc2tog – 10 sc.
Row 38: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc in next 8 sc – 9 sc.
Row 39: Ch 1, turn, sc in next 7 sc, sc2tog – 8 sc.
Cut yarn, placing last loop of st on a stitch holder or safety pin to be picked up on Joining Row.
Shape Second side 
Row 36 (Right Side): Skip next 11 unworked sc on Row 35, join yarn with ch 1 in next sc, sc in same sc, sc in 10 sc, sc2tog – 11 sc.
Row 37: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc in next 9 sc – 10 sc.
Row 38: Ch 1, turn, sc in next 8 sc, sc2tog – 9 sc.
Row 39: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc in next 7 sc – 8 sc. Fasten off.
Joining Row 40 (Right Side): With right side facing, join yarn in st on stitch holder or safety pin on First Side, ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc across next 6 sc, ch 11, working across sts of Second Side, sc in next 6 sc, sc2tog.
Row 41: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc in next 5 sc, sc in next 11 ch, sc in next 5 sc, sc2tog – 23 sc.
Row 42: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across. 
Row 43: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc in each sc to last 2 sts, sc2tog – 21 sc. 
Row 44: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc in each sc to last 2 sts, sc2tog – 19 sc. Fasten off.
Outside Edging
Round 1: With right side facing and working along opposite edge of foundation ch, join yarn in last ch of Row 1, sc in same ch, sc in next 30 ch, turn to work alongside edge, work 44 sc evenly spaced alongside edge, turn to work along top edge, sc across next 19 sc, turn to work along opposite side edge and work 44 sc evenly spaced along edge to first sc, slip st in first sc to join – 138 sc. 
Round 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc around, slip st in first sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
FINISHING
With wrong sides together, sew Seat Covers together alongside and bottom edges, leaving space to insert foam seat. Insert foam seat. Sew remaining sides and top closed. Overlap Handle pieces and sew closed. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Classic Crochet Thread, Size 10: 1 ball of 201 White
¼” (6 mm) wide smooth braided elastic. Note: Sample uses 18” (45.5 cm)
15 - White Pearl Size 6/0 Czech glass “E” beads
abbreviations: 3-trCluster (Cl): *Yarn over (twice), insert hook in indicated st or sp, yarn over, draw up a loop, [yarn over, draw through 2 loops on hook] twice; repeat from * twice, yarn over, draw through remaining loops on hook.
Small Shell (shell): Ch 1, [dc, ch 1] 3 times in indicated st.
Heart Shell (Heart): (Dc, [ch 4, dc in top of previous dc, dc] twice) in indicated st.
Beaded Chain Stitch (bch): Side bead up thread, close to hook, yarn over, draw thread through loop.
Beaded Single Crochet (bsc): Insert hook in st or space, yarn over, draw up a loop, slide bead up close to hook, yarn over, draw thread through both loops on hook.
measurements: Finished measurements: 2” (5 cm) wide x 32” (81.5 cm) long (adjustable), without elastic.
gauge: 8 sts = 1” (2.5 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
GARTER
Center Strip
Ch 256; join into a ring with a slip st in first ch.
Round 1: Ch 1, working in back bump of ch sts, sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in each ch around; join with a slip st in first sc—256 sc.
Round 2: Ch 5 (counts as tr, ch 1), skip first st, skip next st, *Cl in next st, ch 1, skip next st, tr in next st, ch 1, skip next st; repeat from * around, ending last repeat; join with a slip st in 4th ch of beginning ch-5—32 Cl, 32 tr.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in first st, sc in each st and ch-1 space around; join with a slip st in first sc—256 sc.
First Lace Edging
Round 1: Ch 1, sc in first st, sc in each of next 2 sts, *skip next st, shell in next st, skip next st, sc in each of next 5 sts; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **, sc in each of last next 2 sts; join with a slip st in first sc—32 shells; 160 sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in first st, *ch 3, skip next 5 sts, Heart in next st, ch 3, skip 5 sts, sc in next st; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; join with a slip st in first sc—32 sc, 32 Hearts, 64 ch-3 spaces. Fasten off.
Second Lace Edging
With right side facing, working across opposite side of foundation ch, join thread to in ch at base of first sc in Round 1 of Center Strip.
Rounds 1-2: Repeat Rounds 1-2 of First Lace Edging.
Flower Petals
Leaving a sewing length, ch 2.
Round 1 (right side): Work 10 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with a slip st in first sc, tighten beginning tail to close center—10 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, (sc, ch 5, sc) in first st, ch 1, skip next st, *(sc, ch 5, sc) in next st, ch 1; repeat from * around; join with a slip st in first sc—5 ch-5 spaces.
Round 3: Ch 1, (sc, hdc, 4 dc, ch 1, bch 1, ch 1, 4 dc, hdc, sc) in each ch-5 space around; join with a slip st in first sc—5 petals. Fasten off.
Flower Center
Ch 2.
Round 1 (right side): Work 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with a slip st in first sc, tighten beginning tail to close center—5 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 bsc in each st around; join with a slip st in first sc—10 bsc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends on Garter Strip.
For Flower, weave ends to middle of Petals and Center. Using tails, sew center to middle of petals, then sew completed flower on right side to a cluster on garter center strip.
Weave elastic through Round 2 of Center Strip, pushing tr sts to back and clusters to front. With sewing needle and thread, sew ends of elastic together.

materials: Bernat® Maker Minis™ Kit includes 10 balls (50 g/1.7 oz each; 500 g/17.6 oz total), yardage (56 m/61 yds each; 560 m/610 yds total)
Contrast A  Pink 1 ball or 33 yds/30 m
Contrast B  Purple 1 ball or 10 yds/9 m
Contrast C  Green 1 ball or 32 yds/29 m
Contrast D  Cream 1 ball or 12 yds/11 m
Contrast E  Yellow 1 ball or 1 yd/1 m
Contrast F  Blue 1 ball or 16 yds/15 m
Contrast G  Orange 1 ball or 20 yds/18 m
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Pair of 4 mm Safety Eyes for each creature.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 3½" - 6" [9-15 cm] tall.
gauge: 14 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
WORM
Note: Do not join at end of rnds. Work in spiral in continuous rnds. Move marker onto first st at beg of each rnd.
Body: With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. PM on first st. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
Rep 3rd rnd until work from beg measures 6" [15 cm].
Secure safety eyes, placing them 3 rnds below last rnd and 1 sc apart.
Stuff Worm.
Next rnd: (Sc2tog) 6 times. 6 sc.
Fasten off, leaving long end. Draw end through rem sts.
WORM

STITCH KEY
= chain (ch)
= slip stitch (sl st)
= double crochet (dc)
= half double crochet (hdc)
= single crochet (sc)
= worked in back loop
= single crochet 2 together (sc2tog)
Girdle
With B, ch 14.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 13 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row twice more.
Fasten off, leaving long end. Use long end to sew side edges tog, wrapping Girdle around Worm below eyes.

= single crochet 2 together (sc2tog)
MOTH
Note: Wing is worked from outer tip, inward.
Left Top Wing: **With C, ch 3.
1st row: (WS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in last ch. Turn. 2 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 3 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 4 sc.
4th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 5 sc.
5th and 6th rows: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 9 sc at end of 6th row.
7th row: 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. 10 sc.
8th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
9th and 10th rows: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 8 sts at end of 10th row.
11th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn. 7 sts.
12th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn. 5 sts.
13th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn. 4 sts.
14th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of last 2 sts. 3 sts.
Fasten off.**
Note: Rem sts will be where Wing is sewn to Body.
Left Top Wing Edging: With RS facing, join B with sl st to top left corner.
1st row: Ch 1. Work sc evenly down left side of Left Wing to foundation chain. Work 2 sc in each of 2 rem loops of foundation chain. Join D. Break B. With D, work sc evenly up right side of Wing to 14th row, having 2 sc at side edge of 8th row of Wing.
Fasten off, leaving 14th row of Wing unworked. Rotate Left Top Wing clockwise 90 degrees so B edging will be at top and D edging at bottom.

MOTH LEFT TOP WING
STITCH KEY
= chain (ch)

= double crochet (dc)
