= single crochet (sc)
= worked in back loop
= single crochet 2 together (sc2tog)
Right Top Wing: Work from ** to ** as given for Left Top Wing, noting Right Top Wing will be mirror image of Left Top Wing. 
Right Top Wing Edging: With RS facing of Right Top Wing, join D with sl st to top left corner.
1st row: Ch 1. Work sc evenly down left side of Right Wing to foundation chain, having 2 sc at side edge of 8th row of Wing. Join B. Break D. With B, 2 sc in each of 2 rem loops of foundation chain. Work sc evenly up right side of Wing to 14th row.
Fasten off, leaving 14th row of Wing unworked.
Left Bottom Wing: Note: Wing is worked from outer tip, inward.
***With C, ch 3.
1st row: (WS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in last ch. Turn. 2 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in each of next 2 sc. 4 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 6 sc.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 7 sc.
5th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 8 sc.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 9 sc.
7th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Ch 8. Turn. 
8th row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 6 ch. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. 16 sc.
Fasten off.***
Left Bottom Wing Edging:
With RS facing, join D with sl st to side of last sc of 8th row.
1st row: Ch 1. Work sc evenly down left side to foundation chain. 2 sc in each of 2 rem loops of foundation chain. Work sc evenly up right side of Wing to ch-8 of 7th row. 1 sc in each of next 7 rem loops of 7th row.
Fasten off.
Right Bottom Wing: Work from *** to *** as given for Left Bottom Wing, noting Right Bottom Wing will be mirror image of Left Bottom Wing.
Right Bottom Wing Edging:
With RS facing of Right Bottom Wing, join D with sl st in first rem loop of ch-8 of 7th row.
1st row: Ch 1. Work sc evenly in each of 7 rem loops of ch-8 of 7th row. Work sc evenly down left side of Wing to foundation chain. 2 sc in each of 2 rem loops of foundation chain. Work sc evenly up right side to end of 8th row. 
Fasten off.
Body: 
With D, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. PM on first sc. 6 sc.
2nd to 5th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
6th rnd: *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 9 sc.
7th to 11th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
Secure safety eyes, placing them 3 rnds below last rnd and 1 sc apart.
Stuff Body.
Fasten off, leaving long end. Draw end through rem sts.
Sew Top Wings to sides of Body as shown in photo.
Sew Bottom Wings slightly lower and behind Top Wings to Body as shown in photo.
Antenna (make 2).
With E, ch 3.
1st row: Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in last ch. 
Fasten off.
Sew Antenna to Body as shown in photo.
Glue one bag charm bit to each Wing, ensuring they match space between holes on the bag.
BEETLE
Note: Do not join at end of rnds. Work in spiral in continuous rnds. Move marker onto first st at beg of each rnd.
Head: With F, ch 2.
See diagram on page 7.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. PM on first st. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: 1 sc in next sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in last sc. 10 sc.
3rd rnd: 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. 14 sc.
4th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. Join G at end of rnd. Break F.
Secure 2 safety eyes between 2nd and 3rd rows and 1 sc apart as shown in photo.
Cont for Body as follows:
5th rnd: With G, working in back loops only,  1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. 20 sc.
6th rnd: 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 2 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 4 sc. 24 sc.
7th to 12th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
13th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 18 sts.
14th rnd: 1 sc in each st around.
15th rnd: *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 12 sts.
16th rnd: 1 sc in each st around.
Stuff Head and Body.
17th rnd: (Sc2tog) 6 times. 6 sts.
Fasten off, leaving long end. Draw end through rem sts. Pull tightly. Fasten securely.
Left Wing
With F, ch 9.
**1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 6 ch. 3 sc in last ch. Do not turn. Working in rem loops of opposite side of foundation ch, 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Turn. 17 sc.**
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each of next 5 sc. 2 dc in each of next 2 sc. (1 dc. Ch 3. 1 hdc) all in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of last 7 sc.
Fasten off.
Right Wing
With F, ch 9.
Work from ** to ** as given for Left Wing.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 7 sc. 2 sc in next sc. (1 hdc. Ch 3. 1 dc) all in next sc. 2 dc in each of next 2 sc. 1 dc in each of last 6 sc.
Fasten off.
Antenna (make 2).
With G, ch 3.
1st row: Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in last ch. 
Fasten off.
Sew Antenna to Head as shown in photo.
Legs (make 6 alike).
With G, ch 5.
Fasten off.
Sew Legs to Body as shown in photo.
Glue bag charm bit to bottom of Beetle.

materials: RED HEART® Boutique Treasure™: 2 (3, 3) balls 1919 Watercolors
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 6mm [US J-10] and 8mm [US L-11]
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Each boot cuff measures 13½ (15½, 17½)” [34.5 (39.5, 44.5) cm] circumference and 10” (25.5 cm) long.
gauge: 20 sts = 4” (10 cm); 15 rows = 4” (10 cm) in pattern, slightly stretched.
instructions:
CUFF (make 2)
Note: No chains are worked at the beginning of each row.
With smaller hook, ch 69 (81, 89).
Row 1 (right side): Slip st in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—68 (80, 88) sts.
Row 2: With larger hook, *2 Fsl, 2 Bsl; repeat from * to end of row, turn—34 (40, 44) Fsl and 34 (40, 44) Bsl.
Repeat Row 2 until piece measures 10” (25.5 cm) from beginning, end with a wrong side row.
Last Row (right side): *Fsl, picot, Fsl, 2 Bsl; repeat from * to end of row—17 (20, 22) picots.  Fasten off, leaving long tail for sewing.
FINISHING
With right sides together, sew side seam. 
Weave in ends. 
Insert into boot and fold over top.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream (Solids: 70.9 g/2.5 oz) or (Ombres: 56.7 g/2 oz)
Size 4.5 mm (U.S. 7) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Small amount of yellow for Bullion st.
measurements: Work from beginning measures approximately 5 ins [12.5 cm] before proceeding with final finishes.
gauge: 13 sc and 15 rows = 4 ins [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook. Draw loop in next color through 2 loops on hook to complete st and proceed in next color.
With MC, ch 7.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 6 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: As 2nd row.
4th row: (Buttonhole row). Ch 1. 1 sc in first 2 sc. Ch 2. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn. Rep last row until work from beg measures 5 ins [12.5 cm] ending with RS facing for next row.
Proceed as follows: 1st row: Working in back loop only of each st, ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. 8 sc. Turn.
2nd row: Working in both loops, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc) 4 times. Turn. 12 sc.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
5th row: Working in back loop only of each st, as 2nd row.
6th row: Working in both loops, ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. 16 sc. Turn.
7th and 8th rows: As 4th row.
9th row: Working in back loop only of each st, ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. 20 sc. Turn.
10th row: Working in both loops, as 2nd row.
11th row: As 4th row.
12th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each of last 4 sc. 24 sc. Turn.
13th row: Working in back loops only, as 2nd row.
14th and 15th rows: Working in both loops, as 4th row. Fasten off.
With RS of work facing, join B with sl st to first front loop of 1st row.
**1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
2nd row: With A, ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1). 1 dc in next sc. *(Ch 1. 1 dc) twice all in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Fasten off. ** With RS of work facing, join B with ss to first front loop of 5th row. Work from ** to ** as given above. With RS of work facing, join B with ss to first front loop of 9th row. Work from ** to ** as given above. With RS of work facing, join B with sl st to first front loop of 13th row. Work from ** to ** as given above. Fold top in half to WS and sew button in position. Sew Pansy at RS as illustrated.
Pansy: With D, ch 4. Join with sl st to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in ring. Ch 2) 5 times. Join with sl st to first sc. Break D.
2nd rnd: Join B with ss to any ch-2 sp. Ch 2. (2 hdc. Ch 3. 1 ss in first ch – Picot made. 3 hdc) all in same ch 2 sp. [Miss next sc. 1 sc in next sc. (3 hdc. Picot. 3 hdc) all in next ch 2 sp] twice. [Miss next sc. 1 sc in next sc. (1 hdc. 9 dc. 1 hdc) all in next ch 2 sp] twice. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Join with ss to top of ch 2. Fasten off. Embroider bullion st at center of Pansy.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 316 Soft White A, 319 Cherry Red B, and 624 Tea Leaf C.
abbreviations: A, B, C = color A, B, C
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Hat measures 2” x 2”; Capelet measures 13” wide x 2”.
gauge: 16 sts = 4”; 16 rounds = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
Round 1: With A, ch 2; 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook changing to B in last sc; do NOT join but work in continuous rounds – 6 sc. Place a marker in last sc and move up each round.
Round 2: 2 Sc in each sc around changing to C in last sc – 12 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in first sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times changing to A in last sc – 18 sc.
Round 4: Sc in each sc around changing to B in last sc.
Round 5: Sc in each sc around changing to C in last sc.
Round 6: Sc in each sc around changing to A in last sc.
Rounds 7-9: Repeat Rounds 4-6 except do not change color at end of Round 9.
Round 10: Slip st in back loop of each sc around.
Fasten off.
FiniSHinG
Cut two 6” pieces of each color and insert into center of top of hat. Tie yarn together to form knot on inside. On outside, make two braids using one strand of each color for each braid and tie a knot at each end. Weave in all ends.
CApLET
With B, ch 14.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across changing to A in last sc; turn – 13 sc.
Row 2 (Right Side): Ch 3 (counts as dc), [2 dc in next sc, dc in next sc] 6 times changing to C in last dc; turn – 19 sts.
Row 3: Ch 4 (counts as dc, ch 1), dc in first dc, [ch 1, dc next dc] 17 times, ch 1, (dc, ch 1, dc) all in top of ch-3 changing to B in last dc; turn.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in first dc, [ch 3, sc in ch-1 space] 19 times, ch 3, sc in ch-4 space, ch 3, sc in 3rd ch of ch-4.
Fasten off.
This clever hat and caplet adds holiday cheer to any bottle. Crochet them quickly and present uniquely dressed gifts to one and all.

materials: RED HEART® 'Fiesta®': 1 skein each 6341 Millenium A
RED HEART® 'Super Saver®': 1 skein each 256 Carrot B, 718 Shocking Pink C
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Belt is 2” by desired length.
gauge: 9 sts = 2”. Gauge is not important for this project.
instructions:
Belt
With A, ch 9.
Row 1: Working in back loops only, insert hook into 2nd ch from hook, *yarn over, draw loop through and leave on hook, insert hook into next ch; repeat across chain. Do not turn.
Row 2: Yarn over, draw through one loop, *yarn over and draw through two loops; repeat from * until one loop remains on hook. Turn.
Row 3: *Insert hook from right to left behind single vertical thread, yarn over, draw loop through and leave on hook; repeat from * across. Do not turn.
Repeat Row 2-3 until piece measures desired length plus 2” for buckle, end with Row 2.
Slip st across.
Fasten off.
Finishing
Following Chart and using B, cross-stitch Chart along the length of Belt. Repeat with C.
Fold one end of Belt around handle of buckle and sew in place.
Weave in ends.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Metallic Crochet Thread, Size 10: 3 (3, 3, 4, 4, 4) balls 001P White/Pearl
small amount of fiberfill stuffing or 2 crystal buttons ⅝” (1.6 cm) for Center Ball of Large Side Flowers
abbreviations: ( ) = work all directions in parentheses in the indicated stitch or space
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Finished Length: 25 (27, 29, 31, 33, 35)" [63.5 (68.5, 73.5, 79, 84, 89) cm], Finished Width: 6" (15 cm) for all sizes
gauge: Frilled Rose Center Motif, Rounds 1-11, measures 2¾” (7 cm) across. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
First End and First Side
Row 1 (Right Side): Ch 19, sc in 2nd ch from hook and next 17 chs; turn—18 sc.
Row 2: Skip first sc, (slip st, ch 1, sc) in next sc, sc in next 16 sc; turn—17 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first 16 sc (leave last sc unworked); turn—16 sc.
Row 4: Skip first sc, (slip st, ch 1, sc) in next sc, sc in next 14 sc; turn—15 sc.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in first 14 sc (leave last sc unworked); turn—14 sc.
Row 6: Skip first sc, (slip st, ch 1, sc) in next sc, sc in next 12 sc; turn—13 sc.
Row 7: Ch 1, sc in first 12 sc (leave last sc unworked); turn—12 sc.
Row 8: Skip first sc, (slip st, ch 1, sc) in next sc, [ch 5, skip next 4 sc, sc in next sc] twice; turn—3 sc, 2 ch-5 loops.
Row 9: Ch 5, sc in first ch-5 space, ch 5, sc in next ch-5 space, ch 2, dc in last sc; turn—2 ch-5 loops, 2 sc, 1 dc.
Row 10: Ch 1, sc in first dc, [ch 5, sc in next ch-5 space] twice; turn—3 sc, 2 ch-5 loops.
Repeat Rows 9 and 10 until Belt is 11 (12, 13, 14, 15, 16)” [28 (30.5, 33, 35.5, 38, 40.5) cm] long without stretching. Do not fasten off.
Center Section
Row 1 (Right Side): Ch 5, sc in dc, [ch 5, sc in next ch-5 space] twice; turn—3 ch-5 loops, 3 sc.
Row 2: [Ch 5, sc in next ch-5 space] 3 times, ch 2, tr in same ch-5 space; turn—3 ch-5 loops, 3 sc, 1 ch-2 loop, 1 tr.
Row 3: Ch 5, sc in tr, [ch 5, sc in next ch-5 space] 3 times; turn—4 ch-5 loops, 4 sc.
Row 4: [Ch 5, sc in next ch-5 space] 3 times, dc in next sc; turn—3 ch-5 loops, 3 sc, 1 dc.
Row 5: Ch 3, sc in first ch-5 space, [ch 5, sc in next ch-5 space] twice; turn—1 ch-3 loop, 3 sc, 2 ch-5 loops.
Row 6: [Ch 5, sc in next ch-5 space] twice, ch 2, dc in next sc; turn—2 ch-5 loops, 2 sc, 1 ch-2 loop, 1 dc.
Second Side
Repeat Row 10 of First Side, then repeat Rows 9 and 10 until Belt is 23 (25, 27, 29, 31, 33)” [58.5 (63.5, 68.5, 73.5, 79, 84) cm] long without stretching. Do not fasten off.
Second End with Buttonholes
Row 1 (Right Side): Ch 1, sc in first sc, [5 sc in next ch-5 space] twice, sc in last sc; turn—12 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each sc across; turn—13 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first 12 sc, 2 sc in last sc; turn—14 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each sc across; turn—15 sc.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in first 14 sc, 2 sc in last sc; turn—16 sc.
Row 6: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each sc across; turn—17 sc.
Row 7: Ch 1, sc in first 16 sc, 2 sc in last sc; turn—18 sc.
Row 8: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, [ch 3, skip 3 sc, sc in next 3 sc] twice, ch 3, skip 3 sc, sc in last 2 sc—10 sc, 3 ch-3 loops. Do not turn, but rotate Belt to continue working along the upper edge.
Edging
Round 1 (Wrong Side): Working into sides of Rows of Second End across upper edge, ch 3, skip Rows 8 and 7, dc in end of Row 6, ch 1, skip Row 5, dc in end of Row 4, ch 1, skip Row 3, dc in end of Row 2, skip Row 1. Working into sides of Rows of Second Side, *ch 1, dc over sc in end of Row 10, ch 1, dc in ch-5 space at end of Row 9; repeat from * across Second Side, ch 1, dc over sc of last sc of Row 10 before Center Section. Working into Sides of Rows of Center Section, ch 1, dc in end of Row 6, ch 1, skip Row 5, dc in end of Row 4, ch 1, skip Row 3, dc in end of Row 2, skip Row 1. Working into sides of Rows of First Side, *ch 1, dc over sc in end of Row 10, ch 1, dc in ch-5 space at end of Row 9; repeat from * across First Side, ch 1, dc over sc in end of Row 8. Working into sides of Rows of First End, ch 1, skip Row 7, dc in end of Row 6, ch 1, skip Row 5, dc in end of Row 4, ch 1, skip Row 3, dc in end of Row 2, ch 1, skip Row 1. Rotate Belt to continue working in the back of the foundation chain of the First End.
Working across First End, sc in first sc and next 16 sc, 2 sc in last sc—19 sc. Rotate Belt to continue working along the lower edge.
Working into sides of Rows of First End, sc in end of next 7 Rows. Working into sides of Rows of First Side, sc in ch-5 space of first Row 9, *ch 5, slip st in 4th ch from hook, ch 2, sc in ch-5 space of next Row 9; repeat from * across to Row 1 of Center Section (first increase on lower edge). Working into sides of Center Section, ch 5, slip st in 4th ch from hook, ch 2, skip next ch-5 space, sc in next ch-5 space, ch 5, slip st in 4th ch from hook, ch 2, (sc, ch 5, slip st in 4th ch from hook, ch 2, sc) in next ch-3 space, ch 5, slip st in 4th ch from hook, ch 2, sc in next ch-5 space, ch 5, slip st in 4th ch from hook, ch 2, skip next ch-5 space, sc in next ch-5 space. Working into sides of Rows of Second Side, *ch 5, slip st in 4th ch from hook, ch 2, sc in ch-5 space of next Row 9; repeat from * across Second Side, ch 2, sc in ch-5 space of last Row 9 before Second End. Working into sides of Rows of Second End, sc in end of next 7 Rows. Do not turn, but rotate Belt to continue working along the Second End with Buttonholes.
Working across Second End, sc in first 2 sc, *(2 sc, ch 2, 2 sc) in next ch-3 space, skip next sc, sc in next sc, skip next sc, repeat from * once, (2 sc, ch 2, 2 sc) in next ch-3 space, skip next sc, sc in next sc—6 sc, 3 ch-2 loops. Do not turn, but rotate Belt to continue working along the upper edge.
Upper Edge Finishing
Working across upper edge, (3 sc, ch-3 p, sc) in first ch-3 space, *2 sc in next ch-1 space, (sc, ch 3, sc) in next ch-1 space; repeat from * across to last ch-1 space, 2 sc in last ch-1 space, slip st in next sc to join. Fasten off, weave in ends.
FRILLED ROSE CENTER MOTIF
Note: See Special Technique for how to string beads.
String 8 bicone crystal beads. Ch 5; join with slip st in first ch to form ring.
Round 1 (Wrong Side): Ch 1, [sc, bsc] 8 times in ring, slip st in first sc to join; turn so beads face up—8 sc, 8 bsc.
Round 2 (Right Side): Ch 1, sc in same sc, ch 3, skip next bsc, *sc in next sc, ch 3, skip next bsc; repeat from * around, slip st in first sc to join—8 sc, 8 ch-3 loops.
Round 3: Slip st into first ch-3 loop, ch 1, *(sc, 5 dc, sc) in same loop; repeat from * in each loop around, slip st in first sc to join—16 sc, 40 dc (8 Petals).
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in same sc, [ch 2, sc in next dc] 5 times, ch 2, sc in next sc, *sc in next sc, [ch 2, sc in next dc] 5 times, ch 2, sc in next sc; repeat from * around, slip st in first sc to join—56 sc, 48 ch-2 loops.
Round 5: Ch 2; working behind Petals just finished, work a sc around first sc from Round 2, ch 4, *sc around next sc on Round 2, ch 4; repeat from * around, slip st in first sc to join—8 sc, 8 ch-4 loops behind Petals.
Round 6: Slip st into first ch-4 loop, ch 1, *(sc, 7 dc, sc) in same loop; repeat from * in each loop around, slip st in first sc to join—16 sc, 56 dc (8 Petals).
Round 7: Ch 1, sc in same sc, [ch 2, sc in next dc] 7 times, ch 2, sc in next sc, *sc in next sc, [ch 2, sc in next dc] 7 times, ch 2, sc in next sc; repeat from * around, slip st in first sc to join—72 sc, 64 ch-2 loops.
Round 8: Ch 2; working behind Petals just finished, work a sc around first sc from Round 5, ch 5, *sc around next sc on Round 5, ch 5; repeat from * around, slip st in first sc to join—8 sc, 8 ch-5 loops behind second set of Petals.
Round 9: Slip st into first ch-5 loop, ch 1, *(sc, 9 dc, sc) in same loop; repeat from * in each loop around, slip st in first sc to join—16 sc, 72 dc (8 Petals).
Round 10: Ch 1, sc in same sc, [ch 2, sc in next dc] 9 times, ch 2, sc in next sc, *sc in next sc, [ch 2, sc in next dc] 9 times, ch 2, sc in next sc; repeat from * around, slip st in first sc to join—88 sc, 80 ch-2 loops.
Round 11: Ch 2; working behind Petals just finished, work a sc around sc from Round 8, ch 6, *sc around next sc on Round 8, ch 6; repeat from * around, slip st in first sc to join—8 sc, 8 ch-6 loops behind third set of Petals.
Round 12: Slip st into first ch-6 loop, ch 1, 7 sc in same loop, [7 sc in next ch-6 loop] 6 times, slip st into next ch-6 loop, ch 2, 13 dc in same loop; turn—49 sc, 14 dc. Do not fasten off. Place stitch markers in the 20th sc and in the 30th sc.
TOP FAN
Row 1: Ch 1, sc in same dc, sc in next 12 dc and top of ch-2; turn—14 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in same sc, ch 4, skip 1 sc, sc in next sc, [ch 4, skip next 2 sc, sc in next sc] 3 times, ch 2, skip 1 sc, dc in next sc; turn—5 ch-4 loops (last ch-2 and dc count as a ch-5 loop).
Row 3: Beg btr cluster (see Special Stitches) in first ch-4 loop, ch 3, btr cluster (see Special Stitches) in next ch-4 loop, ch 3, (btr cluster, ch 3, btr cluster) in next ch-4 loop, [ch 3, btr cluster in next ch-4 loop] twice; turn—6 btr clusters.
Row 4: Slip st in top of btr cluster just made, *(3 sc, ch 3, 3 sc) in next ch-3 space**, skip next btr cluster; repeat from * 3 times, then from * to ** once, slip st in top of last btr cluster. Fasten off, weave ends in.
CENTER SCROLLS
Note: Stitches for Row 1 are worked into the back loops of the foundation chain. For Row 3, Right Scroll is joined to the Frilled Rose Center Motif with Right Sides facing up, and Left Scroll is joined the Rose with Wrong Sides facing up. Refer to photo for placement.
Right Scroll
Row 1 (Right Side): Ch 18, sc in 2nd ch from hook and next 10 chs, [2 sc in next ch, sc in next ch] 3 times; being careful not to twist, slip st in the opposite side of the 9th ch from hook; turn—20 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, skip slip st, sc in next sc, ch 1, hdc in next sc, [ch 2, dc in next sc] 6 times, [ch 1, skip next sc, dc in next sc] 4 times, ch 1, skip next sc, hdc in next sc, ch 1, skip next sc, 3 sc in next sc; continuing to work around top edge, slip st in back loop of first ch of Row 1; turn—4 sc, 2 hdc, 10 dc.
Row 3: Slip st in marked 30th sc on Round 12 of Frilled Rose Center Motif, skip slip st on Scroll, slip st in next sc on Scroll, skip next sc on Rose, slip st in next sc on Rose; working remaining sts on Scroll, sc in next 2 sc, [(2 sc, ch-3 p, sc) in next ch-1 space] 6 times, [(2 sc, ch-3 p, 2 sc) in next ch-2 space] 6 times, (sc, ch-3 p, sc) in next ch-1 space, slip st in next sc, slip st in joining from Row 1—46 sc, 13 picots. Fasten off, weave ends in.
Left Scroll
Rows 1-2: Same as for Right Scroll.
Row 3: Slip st in marked 20th sc on Round 12 of Frilled Rose Center Motif; working toward Right Scroll, skip slip st on Scroll, slip st in next sc on Scroll, skip next sc on Rose, slip st in next sc on Rose; working remaining sts on Scroll, sc in next 2 sc; starting at top of Right Scroll, [(2 sc, ch 1, slip st into picot on Right Scroll, ch 1, slip st in top of last sc made (joined picot made), sc) in next ch-3 space] 3 times, [(2 sc, ch-3 p, sc) in next ch-1 space] 3 times, [(2 sc, ch-3 p, 2 sc) in next ch-2 space] 6 times, (sc, ch-3 p, sc) in next ch-1 space, slip st in next sc, slip st in joining from Row 1—46 sc, 3 joined picots, 10 picots. Fasten off, weave ends in.
CENTER LEAF
Note: Center Leaf is joined to the Center Scrolls with Right Sides facing up. Refer to photo for placement.
Round 1 (Right Side): Ch 10, 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook, hdc in next ch, dc in next 5 chs, hdc in next ch, 3 sc in last ch; working into opposite side of foundation chain, hdc in next ch, dc in next 5 chs, hdc in next ch, sc in last ch, slip st in first sc to join—6 sc, 4 hdc, 10 dc.
Round 2: Ch 1, (2 sc, ch-3 p, sc) in first sc, sc in next sc, sc in next hdc, ch-3 p, sc in next 3 dc, ch-3 p, sc in next 2 dc, sc in next hdc, ch-3 p, sc in next sc, slip st in first sc to join—24 sc, 3 joined picots, 5 picots. Fasten off, weave ends in.
SMALL ACCENT FLOWER (Make 2)
Ch 4; join with slip st in first ch to form ring. [Ch 2, 3 dc in ring, ch 2, slip st in ring] 5 times—15 dc (5 Petals). Fasten off, weave ends in.
LARGE SIDE FLOWERS (Make 2)
Ch 5; join with slip st in first ch to form ring.
Round 1 (Right Side): Ch 1, 16 sc in ring, slip st in first sc to join—16 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, [sc in next 2 sc, ch 7, 2 sc in in 2nd ch from hook, hdc in next 4 chs, sc in next ch] 8 times, slip st in first sc to join—40 sc, 32 hdc (8 Petals).
Round 3: (Ch 1, sc) in first sc; *working in back loops of sts on Petal, ch 1, skip first st, hdc in next st, [ch 1, dc in next st] 4 times, ch 1; continuing to work around top edge, dc in next sc, ch 2, dc in same sc, ch 1, dc in next sc, [ch 1, dc in next hdc] 3 times, ch 1, hdc in next hdc, ch 1, skip next 2 sc**, sc in next sc; repeat from * 6 times, then from * to ** once, slip st in first sc to join—8 sc, 16 hdc, 80 dc.
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in same sc, *sc in next ch-1 space, [2 sc in next ch-1 space] twice, [(sc, ch 2, sc) in next ch-1 space] 3 times, (sc, [ch 2, sc] 3 times) in next ch-2 space, [(sc, ch 2, sc) in next ch-1 space] 3 times, [2 sc in next ch-1 space] twice; fold Petal in half with Right Sides together and work a slip st through the first and last ch-1 spaces held together, sc in next sc between Petals; repeat from * around, slip st in first sc to join—200 sc. Fasten off, weave ends in.
Sew ⅝” (1.6 cm) crystal button into cup formed in center of Flower or make optional Center Ball
Center Ball
Ch 4; join with slip st in first ch to form ring.
Round 1 (Right Side): Ch 1, 8 sc in ring, slip st in first sc to join—8 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, *2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc; repeat from * around, slip st in first sc to join—12 sc.
Rounds 3-4: Ch 1, sc in each sc around, slip st in first sc to join.
Round 5: Ch 1, *sc2tog, sc in next sc; repeat from * around, slip st in first sc to join—8 sc. Stuff Ball with fiberfill.
Round 6: Ch 1, sc2tog around, slip st in first st to join—4 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Tuck first end inside Ball, then use outside end to sew Ball closed. Sew Ball into cup formed in center of Flower.
SIDE SCROLL (Make 2)
Rows 1-2: Same as for Right Scroll.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in next sc, ch-3 p, sc in next sc, (sc, ch-3 p, sc) in next sc, [(2 sc, ch-3 p, sc) in next ch-1 space] 6 times, [(2 sc, ch-3 p, 2 sc) in next ch-2 space] 6 times, (sc, ch-3 p, sc) in next ch-1 space, slip st in next sc, slip st into joining from Row 1—48 sc, 15 picots. Fasten off, weave ends in.
MEDIUM FRILLED ROSE (Make 4 for size Small or as many as desired for larger sizes)
Note: See Special Technique for how to string beads.
String 6 bicone crystal beads. Ch 5; join with slip st in first ch to form ring.
Round 1 (Wrong Side): Ch 1, [sc, bsc] 6 times in ring, slip st in first sc to join; turn so beads face up—6 sc, 6 bsc.
Round 2 (Right Side): Ch 1, sc in same sc, ch 3, skip next bsc; *sc in next sc, ch 3, skip next bsc; repeat from * around, slip st in first sc to join—6 sc, 6 ch-3 loops.
Round 3: Slip st into first ch-3 loop, ch 1, *(sc, 5 dc, sc) in same loop; repeat from * in each loop around, slip st in first sc to join—12 sc, 30 dc (6 Petals).
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in same sc, [ch 2, sc in next dc] 5 times, ch 2, sc in next sc, *sc in next sc, [ch 2, sc in next dc] 5 times, ch 2, sc in next sc; repeat from * around, slip st in first sc to join—42 sc, 36 ch-2 loops.
Round 5: Ch 2; working behind Petals just finished, work a sc around first sc from Round 2, ch 4, *sc around next sc on Round 2, ch 4; repeat from * around, slip st in first sc to join—6 sc, 6 ch-4 loops behind Petals.
Round 6: Slip st into first ch-4 loop, ch 1, *(sc, 7 dc, sc) in same loop; repeat from * in each loop around, slip st in first sc to join—12 sc, 42 dc (6 Petals).
Round 7: Ch 1, sc in same sc, [ch 2, sc in next dc] 7 times, ch 2, sc in next sc, *sc in next sc, [ch 2, sc in next dc] 7 times, ch 2, sc in next sc; repeat from * around, slip st in first sc to join—56 sc, 48 ch-2 loops. Fasten off, weave ends in.
SIDE LEAF (Make 4 for size Small or as many as desired for larger sizes)
Round 1: Same as for Center Leaf.
Round 2: Ch 1, (2 sc, ch-3 p, sc) in first sc, sc in next sc, sc in next hdc, ch-3 p, sc in next 3 dc, ch-3 p, sc in next 2 dc, sc in next hdc, ch-3 p, sc in next sc, (2 sc, ch-3 p, sc) in next sc, sc in next sc, sc in next hdc, ch-3 p, sc in next 3 dc, ch-3 p, sc in next 2 dc, sc in next hdc, ch-3 p, sc in next sc, slip st in first sc to join—24 sc, 8 picots. Fasten off, weave ends in.
SHELL EDGE LEAF (Make 4)
Round 1: Same as for Center Leaf.
Round 2: Ch 4 (counts as dc, ch 2), dc in same sc, ch 2, skip next sc, hdc in next hdc, [ch 2, skip next dc, dc in next dc] twice, ch 2, skip next dc, hdc in next hdc, ch 2, skip next sc, hdc in next sc, ch 2, hdc in same sc, ch 2, skip next sc, hdc in next hdc, [ch 2, skip next dc, dc in next dc] twice, ch 2, skip next dc, hdc in next hdc, ch 2, slip st in 2nd ch of beginning ch-4 to join—4 hdc, 8 dc, 12 ch-2 spaces.
Round 3: Ch 1, 2 sc in first ch-2 space, ch 4, slip st in 2nd ch from the hook and next 2 chs, 2 sc in same ch-2 space, [(sc, 2 dc, sc) in next ch-2 space] 5 times, (sc, 3 dc, sc) in next ch-2 space, [(sc, 2 dc, sc) in next ch-2 space] 5 times, slip st in first sc to join—26 sc, 23 dc, one 3-st Stem. Fasten off, weave ends in.
FINISHING
Block Belt and all pieces before assembly. Refer to photo for arrangement of Flowers, Scrolls, and Leaves.
1. Sew a crystal bead to the center of a Small Accent Flower. Sew the Flower over the Center Scrolls and Center Leaf joining.
2. Sew a crystal bead to the center of the Frilled Rose Center Motif. Center the Rose over the middle of the Belt and sew in place.
3. Sew a Large Side Flower on each side of the Frilled Rose Center Motif as shown. Flowers should overlap slightly.
4. Sew the Side Scrolls in place as shown under the Petals of the Large Side Flowers on each side.
5. Sew the 2 Shell Edge Leaves in place as shown on each side.
6. Sew the Medium Frilled Roses in place as shown on each side.
7. Decide where to place the Medium Frilled Rose with two Side Leaves on the back of the Belt. Sew the 2 Leaves in place, and sew the Rose over the center where the Leaves meet. Repeat on the second side. Add more of these on the larger sizes if desired.
8. Sew a crystal bead to the center of the last Small Accent Flower. Sew the Flower over the picot at the upper edge of the First End of the Belt.
9. Sew the three 3/8” (0.95 cm) crystal buttons on the First End of the Belt.

pattern_name: A BIZARRE & UNEXPECTED TWISTER OF FATE CROCHET WITCH FEET
materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m) Contrast A Soft White (0316) 1 ball or 275 yds/251 m
Contrast B Black (0312) 1 ball or 260 yds/238 m
Red Heart® Super Saver® Metallic™ (5 oz/142 g; 255 yds/233 m) Contrast C Red (0390) 1 ball or 160 yds/146 m
Size U.S. 7 [4.5 mm] Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2(3)tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2(3) sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: Approx 9½" [24 cm] long x 8½" [21.5 cm] wide, assembled.
gauge: 17 sc and 20 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes: 
• Legs are joined onto flat Base piece during Finishing to ensure Legs stay together and secure placement.
• Base can be ‘hidden’ and secured depending on end use.
• Join all rnds with sl st to first sc of rnd unless otherwise indicated. 
• Carry color when not in use loosely up WS of work unless otherwise stated.
Stripe Pat
With A, work 2 rows/rnds.
With B, work 2 rows/rnds. 
These 4 rows/rnds form Stripe Pat. 
BASE
With A, ch 37.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 36 sc. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
First 2 rows of Stripe Pat are now in place. 
Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep 2nd row 18 times more. Fasten off. 
LEG (Make 2)
See diagram on page 4.
With A, beg using magic loop method demonstrated here .  
1st rnd: 6 sc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next sc. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 35 sc.
Beg working in Stripe Pat. 
7th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
8th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Drop A. Join B. 
First 2 rnds of Stripe Pat are now complete. Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep 8th rnd 16 times more. 
Fasten off. 
Heel Flap
Join B with sl st to 28th st of rnd (8th st to right of rnd join.)
1st row: Ch 1. 1 st in same st as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 16 sc. Turn, leaving rem sts unworked. 17 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Drop B. Join A.
Working in Stripe Pat, rep 2nd row 6 times more.
Shape heel: 1st row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 9 sc. (Sc2tog) twice. Turn. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sts. (Sc2tog) twice. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 5 sts. (Sc2tog) twice. Turn. 
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 7 sts. (Sc2tog) twice. Turn. 9 sts.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st across. Do not turn.
Drop A. Join B. 
Stuff leg.
Note: Remainder of Foot is worked in Stripe Pat, beg with 2 rnds of B. 
See diagram on page 4.
Shape instep: 1st rnd: (RS). With B, work 11 sc evenly down left side of Heel. PM between last and next sc. 1 sc in each of next 18 sc of Instep. PM between last and next sc. Work 11 sc evenly up right side of Heel. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc at top of Heel. Join with sl st to first sc. 49 sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to 2 sts before first marker. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to next marker. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. 47 sts. 
3rd to 8th rnds: As 2nd rnd. 35 sts. 
9th to 12th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. 
13th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 5 sc. Sc2tog. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sts. 
14th to 16th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Stuff foot as you go.
Shape toe: Fold Foot flat and PM at each side edge for side shaping. 
1st rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each sc to 2 sts before next marker. (Sc2tog) twice. Rep from * once more. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. 26 sts.
Rep last rnd 3 times more. 14 sts rem. Fasten off. Finish stuffing foot. Fold toe flat and sew seam. 
SHOES (make 2)
See diagram on page 5.
Toe
Note: Work Toe in spiral in continuous rnds. Move marker onto first st at beg of each rnd.
With C, beg using magic loop method. 
1st rnd: 6 sc in ring. 
2nd rnd: *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 9 sc.
3rd rnd: *1 sc in each of 2 next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 12 sc.
4th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 15 sc.
5th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 18 sc.
6th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. Join. 
7th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 21 sc.
8th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 24 sc.
9th rnd: As 6th rnd. 
10th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 27 sc.
11th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 30 sc.
12th rnd: As 6th rnd.
13th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 35 sc.
14th to 18th rnds: As 6th rnd. Turn at end of 18th rnd.
Proceed working Sides of Shoe in rows as follows:
1st row: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 3 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 33 sts.
2nd to 4th rows: As 1st row. 27 sts.
5th to 12th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn. 
13th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each sc to last 3 sts. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn. 29 sts. 
14th row: As 13th row. 31 sts. 
15th to 17th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
18th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 11 sc. PM on last st. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 
19th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
Rep last row until work from marked row measures 1½" [4 cm].
Fasten off. 
With WS facing, join C with sl st to next unworked st after marked st.
1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in same st as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Turn. 
Leave rem sts unworked.
Cont on these 9 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 7 sts.
3rd and 4th rows: As 2nd row. 3 sts rem. Fasten off. 
With WS facing, join C with sl st to next unworked st from 17th row of Side of Shoe.
1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in same st as last sl st. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 11 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from 17th row of Side of Shoe measures 1½" [4 cm].
Fasten off. 
Shoe Heel Seaming
Join back seam of Sides of Shoe at Heel (marked in red on diagram) With Flat Sl St using C.
FLAT SL ST
Align seam to center of Heel (marked with “x” on diagram). 
Sew curved seam for back of heel along light blue section marked on diagram. Shoe Heel Seaming
Bow (make 2). 
See diagram on page 6.
With C, ch 6.
1st row: (WS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 5 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc3tog. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 3 sts. 
4th row: Ch 1. Sc3tog. Turn. 1 st.
5th row: Ch 1. 3 sc in next st. Turn. 3 sc. 
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 5 sc.
7th and 8th rows: As 2nd row. 
Do not fasten off. 
Edging rnd: Turn work. (Work 7 sc evenly across long edge of Bow. 2 sc in next corner sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. 
Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. 
Wrap a strand of C around center of Bow several times. Sew to Shoe as shown in photo. 
FINISHING
Seam Legs to Base as shown in photo. Place Shoes on feet and secure with some stitches if desired.

pattern_name: I'm Feline Fine Crochet Bag Charms
materials: Bernat® Blanket™ Minis™ - Kit includes 10 balls (2.1 oz/60 g; 42 yds/38 m) each; Total (21 oz/600 g; 420 yds/384 m)
Contrast A  White 1 ball or 7 yds/6.5 m
Contrast B  Rose Violet 1 ball or 5.5 yds/5 m
Contrast A  Coal 1 ball or 7.5 yds/7 m
Contrast B  Sunsoaked 1 ball or 2 yds/2 m
Contrast C  Rose Violet 1 ball or 1 yd/.75 m
Contrast A  Dark Gray 1 ball or 7.5 yds/7 m
Contrast B  Rose Violet 1 ball or 2 yds/2 m
Contrast C  Sunsoaked 1 ball or 2yds/2 m
Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sts. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements:
CAT PAW: Approx 4" x 4" [10 x 10 cm] 
CAT: Approx 4" long x 3½" wide [10 x 9 cm] 
MOUSE: Approx 5" tall x 3½" wide [12.5 cm x 9 cm]
gauge: 8 sc and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
CAT PAW 
Paw
With A, ch 2. 
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 8 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2 (counts as hdc). 1 hdc in first sc. *2 hdc in each sc around. Join with sl st to top of ch-2. 16 hdc.
3rd rnd: Skip first hdc. *[(1 dc. Ch 1) twice. 1 dc) in next hdc (Toe made). Sl st in next hdc. Rep from * 3 times more. (4 Toes total). 
Fasten off.

Toebean  (make 4).
With B, ch 2.
1st row: 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
Fasten off leaving a long tail.
Thread tail through top of first sc and pull tightly to create small circle.
Using tail, sew Toebean to Paw in center of each Toe.
Big Bean
With B, ch 4.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. 3 sc in last ch. Do not  turn. Working in rem loops of ch,  1 sc in next ch. 2 sc in last ch. Join with sl st to first sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long end.
Sew Big Bean to Paw below Toebeans.

CAT
Head
With A, ch 5.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 3 sc in last ch. Do not  turn. Working in rem loops of foundation ch, 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 2 sc in last ch. Join with sl st to first sc. 10 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each of first 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in each of next 6 sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in each of last 4 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 28 sc.
4th rnd: (Ears). Sl st in each of first 2 sc. Ch 3. 1 sc 2nd ch from hook. 1 dc in next ch. Skip next sc. Sl st in next sc (Ear made). 
Fasten off.

EYES  (Make 2).
With A, ch 2. 
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
Fasten off.
With A, embroider pupils using straight st.

FINISHING
Sew Eyes to Head.
With C, embroider nose and mouth using straight st.

MOUSE
Body
See diagram on page 5.
With A, ch 9.
1st rnd: 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in next ch. 1 hdc in each of next 2 ch. 1 sc in next ch. (2 sc. Ch 1. 2 sc) in last ch. Do not  turn. Working in rem loops of foundation ch, 1 sc in next ch. 1 hdc in each of next 2 ch. 1 dc in next ch. 4 dc in last ch. Join with sl st to top of beg ch-3. 18 sts.
2nd rnd: Ch 2 (counts as hdc). 1 hdc in first dc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 dc. 1 sc in each of next 2 hdc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in ch-1 sp. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 dc. 2 hdc in each of next 3 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch-2.
Make Tail: Sl st in next hdc. Ch 6. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. 
Sl st in each of next 4 ch. Sl st to same dc as last sl st.
Fasten off.

Arms  (Make 2).
With A, ch 6.
1st row: Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. Sl st in each ch to end of chain.
Fasten off, lea.

Ears  (Make 2).
With B, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Break B. Join A with sl st to first sc. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: With A, ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 9 sc.
Fasten off.

Cheese
With C, ch 5.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 4 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. Turn. 2 sts.
3rd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Turn. 1 st.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in st. 
Fasten off.

FINISHING
Sew Ears to top of Body as shown in photo.
Sew Arms to body at either side. Position Cheese on front of Body and secure arms by sewing through both thicknesses.
With Black, embroider eyes. With B, embroider nose.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Classic Crochet Thread, Size 10, 1 ball 1 White
10” (25.5cm) square light blue hanky or 11” (28cm) square of light blue batiste cloth
abbreviations: shell: Ch 1, [dc, ch 1] 3 times in indicated st.
large shell (lgshell): Ch 1, [dc, ch 1] 5 times in indicated st.
heart: [Dc in indicated st, ch 4, dc in top of previous dc] 2 times, dc in indicated st.
measurements: Hanky measures 12” (30.5cm) square.
gauge: 8 sc = 1” (2.5 cm); 3 rows in pattern = 7/8” (2 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook needed to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
Ch 313.
Foundation: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next 42 chs, [3 sc in next ch, placing marker in 2nd sc, sc in next 77 chs] 3 times, 3 sc in next ch, placing marker in 2nd sc, sc in next 34 chs; without twisting row, join with slip st in first sc to create open square – 320 sc.
Round 1: Ch 1, sc in same st as join, sc in next 2 sts, [*skip next st, shell in next st, skip next st, sc in next 5 sts*; repeat from * to * across to last st before marker, skip next st, lgshell in marked st, moving marker to 3rd dc of lgshell, skip next st, sc in next 5 sts] 4 times; repeat from * to * across to last 5 sts, skip next st, shell in next st, skip next st, sc in next 2 sts; join with slip st in first st – 36 shells, 4 lgshells and 200 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in same st as join, [*ch 3, sk next 2 sc, skip next dc, heart in next dc, ch 3, skip next dc, sk next 2 sc, sc in next sc*; repeat from * to * across to last 2 sc, skip last 2 sc, sk next dc, ch 3, heart in next dc, ch 3, sc in next marked dc, ch 3, heart in next dc, ch 3, skip next dc, skip next 2 sc, sc in next sc] 4 times; repeat from * to * across to last 2 sc before last shell, skip next 2 sc, skip next dc.

materials: STITCH NATION by Debbie Stoller™ Full o’ Sheep™: 1 ball each 2925 Passionfruit A, 2640 Thyme B, and 2205 Little Lamb C.
Crochet Hooks: 8 mm [US L-11], 6 mm [US J-10].
Sharp yarn needle, 1 ½” bar pin, straight pins.
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C etc.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Flower measures 7” diameter before felting; 6” diameter after felting.
gauge: Gauge is not important, but the stitches need to be loose to felt the yarn successfully.
instructions:
SPECIAL ABBREVIATIONS
2-Chain Picot (2-ch-picot) = Ch 2, insert hook in front loop (horizontal bar) of the sc just made and in the left strand (vertical bar) of the same st, yo and pull through all three loops.
3-Chain Picot (3-ch-picot) = Ch 3, insert hook in front loop (horizontal bar) of the dc just made and in the left strand (vertical bar) of the same st, yo and pull through all three loops.
Note: Join rounds with a slip stitch. The leaf is made by working around both sides of the starting chain, keeping the right side facing.

CLEMATIS
Flower Center: 
With C and 6 mm hook, ch 2; [sc in to second ch from the hook, 2-ch-picot] 8 times; join to first sc and fasten off – 8 2-ch picots.

Petals
Round 1: 
Working into the back loops of the flower center with the 8 mm hook, join A in the back loop of a sc; slip st into sc; [ch 5, slip st in back hump of second ch from the hook and in back hump of next 3 ch, slip st into next sc] 7 times; ch 5, slip st in back hump of second ch from the hook and in back hump of next 3 ch; slip st into first slip st – 8 ch-5 petals.
Round 2: 
Work into the back loops of the ch-5 petals; [slip st into the first chain of the petal, sc in the next st, hdc in the next st, dc in the next st, (3 dc, 3-ch-picot, 3 dc) in the back loop of the turning chain at tip of petal, dc in the first slip st, hdc in the next st, sc in the next st, slip st in the next st, slip st into the slip st between the petals] 8 times – 8 petals.
Fasten off and weave in the ends.

Leaves (Make 2)
Center Vein:
With B and 8 mm hook, ch 6; working into the back hump of the chains, slip st in the second ch from the hook, slip st in next 4 ch, ch 1 – 5 slip st.
Round 1:
Starting on the opposite side and working into the back loops of the center vein; slip st in the first ch, sc in next ch, hdc in next ch, dc in next 2 ch, (3 dc, 3-ch-picot, 3 dc) in back loop of turning ch at tip of leaf; working down the slip st side, dc in next 2 slip st, hdc in next slip st, sc in next slip st, slip st in last slip st; join.
Fasten off and weave in ends.

Backing
Round 1:
With A and 8 mm hook, ch 2, 6 sc in second ch from the hook; join to first sc – 6 sc.
Round 2:
Ch1, 2 sc in each sc; join to first sc – 12 sc.
Round 3:
Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in next sc; [2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc] 5 times; join to first sc – 18 sc.
Round 4:
Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in next 2 sc; [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc] 5 times; join to first sc – 24 sc.
Fasten off and weave in ends.

Felting
Before assembling the flower, put the pieces into pillowcases and tie closed. Place them in a washing machine with hot water and a small amount of detergent. Check during the wash cycle regularly until desired amount of felting is achieved. Rinse soap and squeeze out excess water. Slightly overlap the clematis petals, pin into place and let dry. Block remaining pieces into desired shapes and let dry.

ASSEMBLY
Arrange two leaves on the back of flower; pin into place and stitch to the clematis with B. Place backing on the clematis over the leaves; pin and stitch into place with A. Sew bar pin onto back.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver™ (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Pretty ‘n Pink (0722) or Turqua (0512) or Soft White (0316) or Spring Green (0672)
1 ball (50/45.5 yds/m for Small, 65/59 yds/m for Medium, 105/95.5 yds/m for Large)
Size U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Bobble = (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 4 times in indicated stitch. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Sizes S (M-L) Approx 6 (8-10) [15 (20.5-25.5) cm] high.
gauge: 14 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes:
•  Turn at end of each rnd to alternate RS and WS of work.
•  Work ‘Bobble’ on WS rnds.
•  Ch 2 at beg of rnds does not count as stitch.
•  Join all rnds with sl st to first st unless otherwise indicated.
SMALL VERSION
**Ch 3.
1st rnd: (RS). 4 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join. 4 hdc. Turn.
2nd rnd: (WS). Ch 1. (1 sc. Bobble) in each hdc around. Join. 8 sts. Turn.
3rd rnd: (RS). Ch 2. (2 dc in next st. 1 dc in next st) 4 times. Join. 12 sts. Turn.
4th rnd:  (WS). Ch 1. *1 sc in next dc. Bobble in next dc. Rep from * around. Join. Turn.
5th rnd: (RS). Ch 2. 1 dc in each st around. Join. Turn.
6th rnd: As 4th rnd.
7th rnd: (RS). Ch 2. (2 dc in next st. 1 dc in each of next 2 sts) 4 times. Join. 16 sts. Turn.
8th rnd: As 4th rnd.
9th rnd: As 5th rnd.
10th rnd: As 4th rnd.
11th rnd:  (RS). Ch 2. (2 dc in next st. 1 dc in each of next 3 sts) 4 times. Join. 20 sts. Turn.
12th rnd: As 4th rnd.
13th rnd:  (RS). Ch 2. (2 dc in next st. 1 dc in each of next 4 sts) 4 times. Join. 24 sts. Turn.
14th rnd: As 4th rnd.
15th rnd: (RS). Ch 2. 1 dc in each st around. Join. Fasten off, leaving long yarn end.
MEDIUM VERSION
Work from ** to ** as given for Small Version.
15th rnd:  (RS). Ch 2. (2 dc in next st. 1 dc in each of next 5 sts) 4 times. Join. 28 sts. Turn.
16th rnd:  (WS). Ch 1. *1 sc in next dc. Bobble in next dc. Rep from * around. Join. Turn.
17th rnd:  (RS). Ch 2. (2 dc in next st. 1 dc in each of next 6 sts) 4 times. Join. 32 sts. Turn.
18th rnd: As 16th rnd.
19th rnd: (RS). Ch 2. 1 dc in each st around. Join. Fasten off, leaving long yarn end.
LARGE VERSION
Work from ** to ** as given for Small Version.
15th rnd:  (RS). Ch 2. (2 dc in next st. 1 dc in each of next 5 sts) 4 times. Join. 28 sts. Turn.
16th rnd:  (WS). Ch 1. *1 sc in next dc. Bobble in next dc. Rep from * around. Join. Turn.
17th rnd: (RS). Ch 2. 1 dc in each st around. Join. Turn.
18th rnd: As 16th rnd.
19th rnd:  (RS). Ch 2. (2 dc in next st. 1 dc in each of next 6 sts) 4 times. Join. 32 sts. Turn.
20th rnd: As 16th rnd.
21st rnd: (RS). Ch 2. (2 dc in next st. 1 dc in each of next 7 sts) 4 times. Join. 36 sts. Turn.
22nd rnd: As 16th rnd.
23rd rnd:  (RS). Ch 2. (2 dc in next st. 1 dc in each of next 8 sts) 4 times. Join. 40 sts. Turn.
24th rnd: As 16th rnd.
25th rnd: (RS). Ch 2. 1 dc in each st around. Join. Fasten off, leaving long yarn end.
FINISHING
Insert foam form into Tree, stretching Tree slightly to fit and folding final rnd over lower edge of foam form. Thread yarn end onto needle and weave through final rnd to gather and secure around foam. Pin Tree in position to foam if desired.

materials: RED HEART® “Soft Yarn”: 1 ball each 9388 Wheat A, 9937 Garden Print B, and 9522 Leaf C.
abbreviations: A, B, C = color A, B, C
measurements: Belt Length (without ties) = 25½ (27¾, 30)”.
gauge: 14 sts = 4”; 20 rows = 4” in sc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
BELT
With A, ch 90 (98, 106).
Row 1 (Right Side): Hdc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn – 89 (97, 105) hdc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each hdc across; turn.
Rows 3 and 4: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn. Fasten off at end of Row 4.
Row 5: With right side facing, skip first 5 sc, join B in next sc; ch 1, sc in each sc across to last 5 sc; TURN, leaving remaining 5 sc unworked – 79 (87, 95) sc.
Rows 6-8: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn. Fasten off at end of Row 8.
Ruffle Trim-Row 9: With right side facing, join C in first sc of Row 8; ch 3, 2 dc in same sc, 3 dc in each sc across; turn.
Row 10: Ch 1, hdc in each dc across. Fasten off.
Top Ties
With C, ch 80, with right side facing, sc in each ch across foundation ch, ch 80. Fasten off.
Bottom Tie
Join C in next free sc of Row 4; ch 1, sc in same sc and in next 4 sc, ch 80. Fasten off.
Repeat Bottom Tie on opposite side.
Weave in all ends.
Embellishment
Sew cowrie shells evenly across (about 1 inch apart) on right side, along the length of the belt just above Row 5.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 skein 0319 (small tomato) OR 0930 Lipstick (large tomato)
abbreviations: [ ] Work directions in brackets number of times indicated.
measurements: small tomato: Approx 3½”/9cm diameter x 1½”/4cm high and large tomato: Approx 5”/12.5cm diameter x 2½”/6.5cm high
gauge: 14 sc and 14 rows = 4”/10cm using size G-6 (4mm) crochet hook. Exact gauge is not critical for this project. Work tightly to ensure that stuffing will not show through.
instructions:
Note: Tomato bodies are worked in continuous rounds; do not join and do not turn at end of rounds, unless otherwise instructed. Place stitch marker to indicate beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.

LARGE TOMATO
Stem
With B, ch 2.
Round 1: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with sl st in first sc.
Round 2 (leaves/sepals): [Ch 7, sl st in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next ch, hdc in next 2 ch, sc in next 2 ch (leaf/sepal made), sl st in next 2 sc of Round 1] 4 times; join with sl st in first ch. Fasten off.
Body
Round 1: Join A with sc in back loop of any sl st of Round 2 of Stem; sc in back loop of rem sl sts of Round 2 of Stem; do not join—8 sc.
Round 2: [Sc in next st, 2 sc in next st] 4 times—12 sc.
Round 3: Sc in each st around.
Round 4: 2 sc in each st around—24 sc.
Round 5: [Sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st] 8 times—32 sc.
Round 6: Sc in each st around.
Round 7: [Sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st] 8 times—40 sc.
Round 8: Sc in each st around.
Round 9: [Sc in next 4 sts, 2 sc in next st] 8 times—48 sc.
Round 10: Sc in each st around.
Round 11: [Sc in next 5 sts, 2 sc in next st] 8 times—56 sc.
Rounds 12–14: Sc in each st around.
Round 15: [Sc in next 5 sts, sc2tog] 8 times—48 sts.
Round 16: Sc in each st around.
Round 17: [Sc in next 4 sts, sc2tog] 8 times—40 sts.
Round 18: Sc in each st around.
Round 19: [Sc in next 3 sts, sc2tog] 8 times—32 sts.
Round 20: Sc in each st around.
Round 21: [Sc in next 2 sts, sc2tog] 8 times—24 sts.
Stuff Tomato with fiberfill.
Round 22: [Sc in next st, sc2tog] 8 times—16 sts.
Round 23: [Sc2tog] 8 times—8 sts. Fasten off.
Round 24: Join B with sc in any st of Round 23, sc in rem sts around; join with sl st in first sc.
Fasten off leaving a long tail. Weave tail through stitches of last row and pull tight. Weave in end.

SMALL TOMATO
Stem
Work as for Large Tomato.
Body
Rounds 1–8: Work Rounds 1–8 of Large Tomato—40 sc.
Rounds 9 and 10: Sc in each st around.
Rounds 11–16: Work Rounds 19–24 of Large Tomato.
FINISHING
Side Indentations 
With yarn needle and yarn to match body of tomato, *draw needle and yarn through center of tomato from bottom stem area to top stem area, wrap around side of tomato; repeat from * 4 more times to form five indentations and slightly flatten tomato. Fasten off.
Weave in all ends.

materials: STITCH NATION® “Full O’Sheep™”: 1 Ball each 2925 Passionfruit A and 2012 Black Sheep B.
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
measurements: Ankle Circumference: 11 (12, 13”); Spat Length: 5½”
gauge: 13 hdc = 4”; 14 rows = 4” using smaller hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
LEFT SPAT
Foot Edge
With A, ch 47 (50, 54).
Row 1: Hdc in 3rd ch from hook, hdc in each ch across.
Row 2: Ch 2 (counts as hdc here and throughout), turn, hdc in each hdc across – 45 (48, 52) hdc.
Rows 3-4: Repeat Row 2.
Rows 5-13: Ch 2, turn, skip next hdc, hdc in each hdc across – 36 (39, 43) hdc.
Row 14: Ch 2, turn, hdc in each hdc across.
Ruffle Edging
Row 15: Change to B, ch 1, turn to work along side edge, work 15 hdc evenly spaced along rows of side edge, ch 1, turn to work opposite foundation ch, hdc in each st across, ch 1, turn to work along opposite side edge, work 15 hdc evenly spaced along rows of side edge. Leave sts of Row 14 unworked.
Row 16: Ch 3, turn, skip first hdc, work 3 dc in each hdc along one side and bottom edges. Leave remaining side edge unworked.
Fasten off.
Row 17: Join A in first st of Row 1, ch 1, hdc in each st along side, bottom and remaining side edge. Fasten off.
RIGHT SPAT
Work as for Left Spat through Row 14. 
Ruffle Edging
Row 15: Change to B, ch 1, turn to work along side edge, work 15 hdc evenly spaced along rows of side edge, ch 1, turn to work opposite foundation ch, hdc in each st across, ch 1, turn to work along opposite side edge, work 15 hdc evenly spaced along rows of side edge. Fasten off. Leave sts of Row 14 unworked.
Row 16: Join B in first st of Row 15, ch 3, work 3 dc in each st along side and bottom edge. Leave remaining side edge unworked. 
Row 17: Join A in first st of Row 16, ch 2, hdc in each st along side, bottom and remaining side edge. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew 3 buttons evenly spaced along side without Ruffle. Push buttons through sts to close. Weave in ends.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Classic Crochet Thread, Size 10: 1 ball each 493 French Rose A, 401 Orchid Pink B and 428 Mint Green C
6” (15cm) diameter Styrofoam® ball, 6” (15cm) tall Styrofoam® cone, light pink spray paint (Styrofoam® safe), straight pins, pearl head straight pins
20 yds (18 m) 1” (25mm) wide double-faced satin ribbon in antique white
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: The finished rose is 2” (5cm) wide with 2 strands of yarn held together.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com and www.crochettoday.com
©2013 Coats & Clark
Bridal Nosegay
Beautiful shades of pink crocheted roses and carnations are an elegant addition to the bride’s ensemble. Use these flowers as a nosegay, as shown, or to decorate at the bridal reception.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in next sc, hdc in next sc, dc in next sc, tr in next 2 sc, dc in next sc, hdc in next sc, sc in next sc, 3 sc in next sc, sc in next sc, hdc in next sc, dc in next sc, tr in each of next 2 sc, dc in next sc, hdc in next sc, sc in next sc, slip st in first sc.
Fasten off. Weave in ends.
ASSEMBLY
Cut ball in half. Spray paint one half to cover completely and blend with flowers. Allow to dry.
Cut floral wire into 3” (8 cm) lengths and insert into the center of the flowers and edge of leaves forming stems.
1. Insert stems of Roses and Carnations randomly around curved sides of Top piece, covering completely. Tuck in Leaves in between flowers. Reinforce with straight pins if needed.
NOTE
Flowers are worked with 2 strands of yarn held together throughout.
ROSE
Make 15 each with A and B
With 2 strands of yarn held together, ch 5, slip st in first ch to make a ring.
Round 1: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), 11 dc in ring, slip st in top of beginning ch to join – 12 dc.
Round 2: *Ch 3, skip next dc, slip st in next dc; repeat from *, ch 3, skip last dc, slip st in first ch – 6 ch-3 spaces.
Round 3: *(Sc, hdc, 3 dc, hdc, sc) in next ch-3 space for Small Petal; repeat from * around, slip st in first st – 6 Small Petals.
Round 4: Working behind Small Petals, *ch 4, slip st in skipped dc on Round 1; repeat from * around, slip st in first ch – 6 ch-4 spaces.
Round 5: *(Sc, hdc, 5 dc, hdc, sc) in next ch-4 space for Large Petal; repeat from * around, slip st in first st.
Fasten off.
CARNATION
Make 17 each with A and B
With 2 strands of thread held together, ch 18.
Row 1: 2 dc in 4th ch from hook, 3 dc in each ch across – 45 dc.
Row 2: *Ch 3, turn, slip st in next dc; repeat from * to end. Fasten off.
LEAF
Make 12 with C
With 2 strands of C held together, ch 10.
Round 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next 7 ch, 2 sc in next ch, working along opposite edge of foundation ch, sc in next 8 ch, slip st in first sc.
Designed by Nazanin S. Fard
Step 1

Buy Thread
