AUNT LYDIA’S BRIDAL NOSEGAY | CROCHET 1 of 2

2. Pin one ribbon end at center of flat side of Top piece. Form a wheel of loops around outside edge, allowing loops to overlap and extend beyond edge 2” (5cm). Secure loops with pins.
3. Using pearl head pins, pin one ribbon end to narrow end of cone. Wrap ribbon around cone loosely overlapping edges for tiered effect and pin each wrap to secure. Fold in extra ribbon and loops and pin to secure.
4. Attach Handle to Top with pearl head pins inserted at an angle from Handle to flat side of Top to prevent them from poking through bouquet.
Groom and Groomsmen can wear the Carnation as a boutonniere.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 256 Carrot A, 512 Turqua B, 319 Cherry Red C, and 316 Soft White D
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 3.75mm [US F-5], 5 mm [US H-8]
abbreviations: A, B, C, D = color A, B, C, D
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Topper measures 5” (13 cm) high
gauge: 22 sts = 4” (10 cm); 20 rows = 4” (10 cm) in sc with smaller hook. Note: Gauge is not overly important for this project but stitches in the stuffed portion must be tight enough to prevent stuffing showing through.
instructions:
Ears (Make 2)
With A and smaller hook, ch 5; sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 2 ch, 2 sc in last ch, working in remaining loops on opposite side, sc in 3 ch, (slip st, ch 1, slip st) in next sc, slip st in next 3 sc, (slip st, ch 1, slip st) in next sc, slip st in next 3 sc. Fasten off leaving long tail for attaching ear to head.

Antlers (Make 2)
With D and smaller hook, ch 8.
Working in back bumps on wrong side of ch for each section, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and in next 2 ch, ch 4, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and next 2 ch, slip st in next 3 ch on ch-8, ch 4, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and next 2 ch, slip st in last ch of ch-8. Fasten off leaving long tail for sewing.

Scarf
With B and larger hook, ch 43.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across changing to C in last st; turn – 42 sc. Cut B.
Row 2: With C, ch 1, sc in each sc across changing to B in last st; turn. Cut C.
Row 3: With B, ch 1, sc in each sc across. Fasten off. 
Fringe: Cut 4” (10 cm) strands of yarn. Knot fringe across each end of scarf as follows: fold strand in half forming a loop; insert the crochet hook through the fabric from the wrong side and draw the loop through, then draw the yarn ends through the loop and tighten. Trim yarn ends.

REINDEER
Head
Round 1: With A and smaller hook, ch 2; 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; do not join but work in continuous rounds. Place marker in first sc and move up each round.
Round 2: 2 Sc in each sc around – 12 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times – 18 sc.
Rounds 4-6: Sc in each sc around.
Neck Opening-Round 7: Sc in first 12 sc, ch 4, skip next 4 sc, sc in last 2 sc.
Round 8: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times – 24 sc.
Rounds 9-11: Sc in each sc around.
Round 12: [Sc in next 2 sc, dec] 6 times – 18 sc.
Round 13: Sc in each sc around.
Round 14: [Sc in next sc, dec] 6 times – 12 sc.
Round 15: [Sc in next sc, dec] 4 times – 8 sc. Stuff head firmly.
Round 16: [Dec] 4 times – 4 sc. Fasten off.
Finish stuffing. Use yarn end threaded on tapestry needle to close hole. Set aside.

Neck
With A and smaller hook, attach yarn to any st at neck opening.
Round 1: Ch 1, sc in each sc and ch around; do not join – 8 sc.
Round 2: Sc in each sc around.
Round 3: 2 Hdc in each sc around – 16 hdc.
Round 4: [Hdc in next 7 hdc, 2 hdc in next hdc] twice – 18 hdc.
Rounds 5-9: Hdc in each hdc around.
Rounds 10 and 11: Sc in each hdc around. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Sew beads randomly on antlers. Sew ears and antlers to head with yarn ends.
Locate desired eye placement and with A, soft sculpture eye socket by taking st in one eye placement, then insert needle and run it across to other eye placement area. Bring needle out at this 2nd eye area and pull tightly causing yarn to make indentation for eye socket. Repeat process again and then bring yarn out behind ear and knot securely. Weave in yarn end. Sew wiggle eyes securely in eye sockets just made.
Sew pom pom nose to face.
Slip onto bottle, tie scarf around neck.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Classic Crochet Thread, Size 10: 1 ball 484 Myrtle Green
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Collar measures 19” (48cm) long
gauge: 32 dc = 4” (10cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com and www.crochettoday.com
©2013 Coats & Clark
Instead of the usual necklace, change up your style with this lovely crocheted piece. It buttons in the back, making it easy to add to any dress or top.
COLLAR
Flower (make 2)
Ch 3, join in a ring with a slip st. Place marker.
Round 1: Ch 3 (counts as dc), work 9 dc in ring. Join to top of ch 3 with slip st—10 dc.
Round 2: Ch 1, (sc, ch 7, sc, ch 1) in same st, *skip 1 dc, (sc, ch 7, sc, ch 1) in next dc; repeat from * around. Join to first sc with slip st—5 petals.
Round 3: Ch 1, (sc, 2 hdc, 3 dc, ch 2, 3 dc, 2 hdc, sc) in each ch-7 space around. Join to first sc with slip st. Set aside.
Neckband
Ch 122.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch—121 sts.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc), *dc in next st, 2 dc in next st; repeat from * across—181 sts.
Row 3: Ch 4 (counts as dc, ch 1), skip 1 dc, dc in next st, *ch 1, skip 1 st, dc in next st; repeat from * across.
Row 4: Ch 4 (counts as dc, ch 1), dc in dc, *ch 1, dc in dc; repeat from * across.
Row 5: Ch 3 (counts as dc), dc in each dc and ch-1 space across.
Row 6: *Slip st in next st, skip 4 sts, [ch 1, tr] 7 times in next st, ch 1, skip 4 sts;** repeat from * 7 more times, slip st in next st, [ch 3, slip st in ch-2 space on flower petal, ch 3, skip 3 sts, slip st in next st, ch 3, slip st in ch-2 space on next flower petal of same flower, ch 3, skip 3 sts, slip st in next st] twice, repeat from * to ** 8 times (omit first slip st on first repeat only), end slip st in last st.
Row 7: Sc in ch-1 space, *ch 3, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat across to top of 8th scallop, ch 3, sc in first unattached ch-2 space of flower petal, ch 3, [sc in next dc, ch 3, sc in first dc of next petal, ch 3, sc in next dc, ch 3, sc in ch-2 space, ch 3, sc in next dc, ch 3, sc in next dc, ch 3] twice, sc in ch-2 space of next petal, ch 3, sc in ch-2 space of 2nd flower, ch 3, [sc in first dc of next petal, ch 3, sc in next dc, ch 3, sc in ch-2 space, ch 3, sc in next dc, ch 3, sc in next dc, ch 3] twice, [sc in next dc, ch 3] twice, sc in ch-2 space, ch 3, ch 3 in top of next scallop,
**ch 3, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from ** to end. Fasten off.
Sew button to one edge at neck. Use first dc st as button loop. 
Weave in ends. Block and starch.

materials: Bernat® Maker Minis™ Kit includes: 10 balls (1.7 oz/50 g each; 17.6 oz/500 g total), yardage (61 yds/56 m each; 610 yds/560 m total) Approx 14 yds/13 m per letter + background. Note: Yardage may vary. Any shade of choice.
Size U.S. G/5 (3.75 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 2¾" [7 cm] tall.
gauge: 14 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
A
Ch 8.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. 
Ch 3. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch for center bar. 
1 sc in each of next 3 ch from original ch-8. Turn. Ch 4. Sl st in 
tip of center bar. Ch 5. Turn. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in 
each of next 3 ch. 1 sc in sl st. 1 sc in each of last 4 ch. Join with 
sl st in first st. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
B
Ch 8.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of 
chain. Turn. 7 sc. 
2nd row: Ch 5. Skip first 3 sc. 1 sc in next sc. Ch 6. Skip next 
2 sc. Sl st in last sc. Turn.
3rd row: Skip first sl st. 1 sc in each of next 6 ch. Sl st in next 
sc. 1 sc in each of last 5 ch. Join with sl st in edge of 1st row.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
 C
Ch 13.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of 
chain. 12 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Shape into ‘C’ when 
sewing in position.
D
Ch 17.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 6 ch. 
3 sc in next ch. 1 sc in each of next 7 ch. 2 sc in last ch. 
Join with sl st in first st.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
E
Ch 8.
1st row: Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. (Ch 3. 1 sc in 2nd ch from 
hook. 1 sc in next ch. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch of original ch-8) 
twice. Ch 3. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. Sl st in 
side of last sc along ch-8. 
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
 F
Ch 8.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. 
Ch 3. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. 1 sc in each 
of next 3 ch of original ch-8. Ch 3. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 
1 sc in next ch. Sl st in last ch. Fasten off, leaving a long tail 
for sewing.
G
Ch 15.
1st row: Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. Ch 3. 1 sc in 2nd ch from 
hook. 1 sc in next ch. Sl st in same sp as original sl st. 1 sc in 
each of rem 13 ch.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Shape into ‘G’ when 
sewing in position.
H
Left Side
Ch 8.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. 
Ch 3. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch for center bar. 
1 sc in each of next 3 ch of original ch-8.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

Right Side
Ch 8.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of 
chain. 7 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Sew Sides tog along 
center bar.
I
Ch 8.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of 
chain. 7 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
J
Ch 10.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of 
chain. Ch 3. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. 1 sc in 
side of last sc along original ch-10. Ch 3. 1 sc in 2nd ch from 
hook. 1 sc in next ch. Sl st in same sc along side.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Shape into “J” while 
sewing in position.
K
Ch 8.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. 
Ch 5. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. Sl st 
in last sc along original ch-8. Ch 4. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 
1 sc in each of next 2 ch. Sl st in same sc along side. 1 sc in 
rem ch of original ch-8.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
L
Ch 12.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. Skip 
next ch. 1 sc in each of last 7 ch.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
M
Ch 21.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 9 ch. 
Ch 5. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. 1 sc in 
rem 10 ch of orginal ch-21.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Shape into ‘M’ while 
sewing in position.
N
Ch 25.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 6 ch. Skip 
next ch. 1 sc in each of next 8 ch. Skip next ch. 1 sc in each of 
rem 7 ch.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Shape into ‘N’ while 
sewing in position.
O
Ch 17. Join with sl st in first ch to make a ring.
1st rnd: 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st in first sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
P
Ch 8.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of 
chain. Turn. 7 sc.
2nd row: Ch 5. Skip first 3 sc. Sl st in next sc. Turn. Leave 
rem sts unworked.
3rd row: 1 sc in each ch of ch-5. Sl st in last ch.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Q
Ch 17. Join with sl st in first ch to make a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. 1 sc in 
each ch around. Join with sl st in first ch. Ch 3. 1 sc in 2nd ch 
from hook. 1 sc in next ch.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
R
Ch 8.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of 
chain. Turn. 7 sc.
2nd row: Ch 5. Skip first 3 sc. 1 sc in next sc for center sc. 
Ch 5. Turn. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. 
Sl st in center sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 ch of first ch-5 sp. 
Join with sl st in edge of 1st row. Fasten off, leaving a long 
tail for sewing.
S
Ch 17.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of 
chain. 16 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Shape into ‘S’ while 
sewing in position.
T
Ch 8.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of 
chain. Ch 3. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. 1 sc in 
side of last sc along original ch-8. Ch 3. 1 sc in 2nd ch from 
hook. 1 sc in next ch. Sl st in same sc along side.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
U
Ch 17.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of 
chain. 16 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Shape into ‘U’ while 
sewing in position.
V
Ch 18.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of 
chain. 17 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Shape into ‘V’ while 
sewing in position.
W
Work as given for M, reversing direction while sewing in place.
X
Make 2 pieces alike. Ch 8.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of 
chain. 7 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Shape pieces into ‘X’ b crossing in center while sewing 
in position.
Y
1st row: (Ch 5. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 
3 ch) twice. Sl st in first ch. Ch 5. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 
1 sc in each of next 3 ch. Join with sl st in original sl st.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Z
Ch 16.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. Skip 
next ch. 1 sc in each of next 5 ch. Skip next ch. 1 sc in each of 
rem 4 ch.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Shape into ‘Z’ while 
sewing in position.
#
Bars (make 4 alike).
Ch 9.
1st row: Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. Sl st in each ch to end of 
chain. Fasten off leaving long tail for sewing.
Shape into ‘#’ while sewing in position, having 2 vertical bars 
leaning slightly to right.
Background  (Make 1 per letter).
Note: Background is worked side to side.
Ch 10.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end 
of chain. Turn. 9 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures approx  
½" [1.25 cm] wider than desired letter.
With RS facing, sew letter to front of background as shown.
With Hot glue gun, glue plastic bag charm back to back 
of background.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft™ (Solids: 6 oz/170.1 g; 315 yds/288 m; Heathers: 5 oz/141 g; 250 yds/228 m)
Size U.S. E/4 (3.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
measurements: To fit head circumference 6/12 mos 17" [43 cm], 18/24 mos 18" [45.5 cm]
gauge: 17 sc and 20 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions: The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger size the instructions will be written thus ( ). Note: To join new color, work to last loops on hook of first color. Yoh with new color, draw through loops and proceed with new color. With MC, ch 72 (78). Join with sl st to first ch, taking care not to twist chain. 1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first sc. 72 (78) sc. 2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep 2nd rnd until work from beg measures approx 1½" [4 cm]. Break MC. Join A. Next rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Skip next 2 sc. 6 tr in next sc. Skip next 2 sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 5 sts. Skip next 2 sc. 6 tr in next sc. Skip next 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. Break A. Join MC. Next rnd: With MC, ch 1. Skip first sc. *1 sc in each of next 3 tr. Ch 5. 1 sc in each of next 3 tr. Skip next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Soft Baby Steps: 1 skein each 9600 White A, 9800 Baby Blue (for boy) or 9700 Baby Pink (for girl) B.
Small child’s hanger, yarn needle, fiberfill, 2–7/16” buttons La Mode® 2064, ¼” ribbon, glue gun and glue stick.
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Finished measurements: 11¾” x 4”.
gauge: 8 sts = 4”; 8 rows = 4” in pattern. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
BODY
Row 1: With larger hook and A, ch 11 and PBS in 2nd ch from hook. Sc in next ch, alternate PBS and sc across, ch 1—10 sts.
Row 2: PBS in each sc and sc in each PBS across; ch 1 and turn—10 sts.
Row 3: Work (PBS, sc) in first sc (increase made); PBS in each sc and sc in each PBS across to last 2 sts; (sc, PBS) in next st (increase made); sc in last sc; ch 1 and turn—12 sts.
Row 4: Repeat Row 2—12 sts.
Row 5: Repeat Row 3—14 sts.
Row 6: Repeat Row 2—14 sts.
Row 7: Repeat Row 3—16 sts.
Rows 8-12: Repeat Row 2—16 sts.
Row 13: Repeat Row 3—18 sts.
Rows 14-16: Repeat Row 2—18 sts.
Row 17: Repeat Row 3—20 sts.
Rows 18-20: Repeat Row 2—20 sts.
Row 21: Repeat Row 3—22 sts.
Rows 22-24: Repeat Rows 2—22 sts.
Row 25: PBS in first sc; sc2tog; PBS in each sc and sc in each PBS across to last 4 sts; sc2tog; PBS in next sc and sc in last st; ch 1 and turn—20 sts.
Rows 26-28: Repeat Rows 18-20—20 sts.
Row 29: Repeat Row 25—18 sts.
Rows 30-32: Repeat Rows 18-20—18 sts.
Row 33: Repeat Row 25—16 sts.
Rows 34-36: Repeat Rows 18-20—16 sts.
Row 37: Repeat Row 25—14 sts.
Rows 38-40: Repeat Rows 18-20—14 sts.
Row 41: Repeat Row 25—12 sts.
Row 42: Repeat Row 18—12 sts.
Row 43: Repeat Row 25—10 sts.
Row 44: Repeat Row 18—10 sts.
At the end of Row 44 fold piece in half. Sew ends up and place hanger inside. Sew top part of pouch around top of hanger.
HEAD
Round 1: With larger hook and B, ch 2; [PBS, sc] 3 times in 2nd ch from hook, do not join—6 sts.
Round 2: Change to A, (PBS, sc) in each st around—12 sts.
Round 3: *PBS in next sc; sc and PBS in next st; repeat from * around—18 sts.
Round 4: *PBS in next sc; sc in next PBS; (PBS, sc) in next st; repeat from * around—24 sts.
Round 5: *PBS in next sc; sc in next PBS; PBS in next sc; (sc, PBS) in next st; repeat from * around—30 sts.
Round 6: *Sc in next 3 sc; 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around; join with a slip st and fasten off—30 sts.
EARS
(Make 2 Outer Ears and 2 Inner Ears)
Outer Ears
Row 1: With smaller hook and A, ch 2 and 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook; ch 1 and turn—3 sts.
Row 2: 2 sc in first sc; sc in next sc; 2 sc in last sc; ch 1 and turn—5 sts.
Row 3: Sc in each sc across, ch 1 and turn—5 sts.
Row 4: Repeat Row 2—7 sts.
Row 5: Repeat Row 3—7 sts.
Row 6: Repeat Row 2; ch 1 and turn—9 sts.
Row 7: Repeat Row 2 and fasten off—9 sts.
Inner Ears
With smaller hook and B, repeat Rows 1-7 of outer ear pattern. When inner ear is complete, with A work 1 row of slip st around piece except across base. Place wrong sides of outer and inner ears together and slip st through both pieces to join.
MUZZLE
Round 1: With smaller hook and B, ch 2 and 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook; do not join—3 sts.
Round 2: With A; 2 sc in each sc around—6 sts.
Round 3: *Sc in sc; 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—9 sts.
Round 4: *Sc in next 2 sc; 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—12 sts.
Round 5: Sc in each sc around; slip st in next sc and fasten off.
FINISHING
Fold ears in half and sew in place on head. Sew head to body. Stuff muzzle and sew in place on head. Tie ribbon in a bow and glue under head as shown.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver™ Super Craft Kit Set includes 12 balls (50 g/1.7 oz each; 600 g/21 oz total), yardage (85 m/93 yds each; 1020 m/1116 yds total)
Contrast A Spring Green - 1 ball or 17 yds/15.5 m
Contrast B Black - 1 ball or 5 yds/4.5 m
Contrast C Soft White - 1 ball or 15 yds/14 m
Contrast D Shocking Pink - 1 ball or 1 yd/1 m
Contrast E Saffron - 1 ball or 15 yds/14 m
Size U.S G/6 (4 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Approximately (approx) 2" x 3" [5 x 7.5 cm]
gauge: 14 single crochet (sc) and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
USING THIS GUIDE
Click on the underlined words throughout the pattern to access our library of helpful tools.
NOTE
• Do not join at ends of rounds (rnds) unless otherwise stated. Continue (cont) working in spiral placing marker on first stitch (st) of rnd for easier counting.

ALL CHARMS
Slip Knot
Make a loop with yarn and fold it on itself to make a pretzel shape. Then draw through to make slip knot.
Chain
Yarn over hook (Yoh), draw through loop – 1 chain made.

HEAD/BODY
(Make with: A for Frog, C for Panda, E for Lemon)
See diagram on page 7.
Chain (ch) 2.
Note:  Place marker on first st. Join in rnd. Work in continuous rnds.
1st round (rnd):  6 single crochet  (sc) in 2nd ch from hook. 6 sc.
2nd rnd:  2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc.
3rd rnd:  1 sc in each sc around.
4th rnd:  *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Repeat (Rep) from * around. 18 sc.
5th rnd:  1 sc in each sc around.
6th rnd:  *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 24 sc.
7th to 11th rnds:  1 sc in each sc around.
12th rnd:  *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Single crochet 2 together (Sc2tog). Rep from * around. 18 sc.
13th rnd:  1 sc in each sc around.
14th rnd:  *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 12 sc.

FROG
Head
With A, work 1st to 14th rnds as given above. Stuff Charm firmly.
15th rnd:  1 sc in each sc around.
16th rnd:  Single crochet 2 together (Sc2tog) 6 times. 6 sc.
Fasten off, leaving long end. Draw end tightly through remaining (rem) sts.

Eyes  (make 2 alike)
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd:  6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 6 sc.
2nd and 3rd rnds:  1 sc in each sc around.
Fasten off.

Attach safety eyes as shown in photo. Sew Eyes to Head as shown in photo. With length of B, embroider mouth with outline stitch as shown in photo. Sew charm hook to top of Head as shown in photo.

PANDA
Head
With C, work 1st to 14th rnds as given above. Attach safety eyes and stuff charm firmly.
15th rnd:  1 sc in each sc around.
16th rnd:  (Sc2tog) 6 times. 6 sc.
Fasten off, leaving long end. Draw end tightly through remaining (rem) sts.

Ears  (make 2 alike)
With B, ch 2.
1st rnd:  6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 6 sc.
2nd and 3rd rnds:  1 sc in each sc around.
Fasten off. Sew Ears to Head as shown in photo.
Nose
With B, ch 2.
1st rnd:  6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 6 sc.
Fasten off. With length of C, embroider nose onto Nose piece. Sew Nose onto Head as shown in photo. Sew charm hook to top of Head.

LEMON
Body
With E, work 1st to 14th rnds as given above.
Leaves  (make 2 alike)
With A, ch 6. 
1st row:  Slip stitch  (Sl st) in first ch.
1 sc in next ch. 1 half double crochet  (hdc) in next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Sl st in last ch. Fasten off.
Straight Stitch
Sew Leaves to one end of Head. With length of D, embroider cheeks under eyes using Straight stitch, as shown in photo. With B, embroider mouth, using Straight stitch, as shown in photo. Sew charm hook to top of Head as shown in photo.

materials: Small ivory button, matching thread and needle, rustproof pins, spray starch, yarn needle
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Collar measures 15” (38cm) circumference at neck edge, 23” (58.5cm) circumference at lower edge and 3½” (9cm) length.
gauge: 48 tr = 4” (10cm); Rows 1-7 of Ruffle = 2” (5cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Row 2: Ch 4 (counts as tr here and throughout), [tr in next st, skip next st] twice, *V-st in next st, skip next st, tr in next 3 sts, skip next st; repeat from * across to last 6 sts, V-st in next st, [skip next st, tr in next st] twice, tr in last st, turn – 31 V-sts and 96 tr.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first st, *ch 3, sc in V-st, ch 3, skip next st, sc in next st, work ([tr, ch 1] 4 times, tr) in next V-st (Fan made), skip next st, sc in next st; repeat from * across, ch 3, sc in last V-st, ch 3, sc in last st, turn – 15 Fans.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in first st, ch 1, sc in next ch-3 space, *ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space, tr in first 4 sts of Fan, work Lg V-st in next st, tr in last 4 sts of Fan, sc in next ch-3 space; repeat from * across, ch 3, sc in last ch-3 space, ch 1, sc in last sc, turn.
Row 5: Ch 4, ([tr, ch 1] twice, tr) in first ch-3 space, *skip 2 sts of Fan, sc in next st, ch 3, sc in Lg V-st, ch 3, skip next st of Fan, sc in next st, ([tr, ch 1] 4 times, tr) in next ch-3 space; repeat from * across, skip 2 st of Fan, sc in next st, ch 3, sc in last Lg V-st, ch 3, skip next st of Fan, sc in next st, work ([tr, ch 1] twice, tr) in last ch-3 space, tr in last sc, turn – 14 Fans and 2 half Fans
Row 6: Ch 4, work Lg V-st in next st, tr in next 4 sts, *sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space, tr in first 4 sts of Fan, work Lg V-st in next st, tr in last 4 sts of Fan; repeat from * across, sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3, sc in last ch-3 space, tr in next 4 sts, work Lg V-st in next tr, tr in last tr, turn.
Row 7: Ch 1, sc in first st, *ch 3, sc in Lg V-st, ch 3, skip next st, sc in next st, work ([tr, ch 1] 4 times, tr) in next ch3-space, skip first 2 sts of next Fan, sc in next st; repeat from * across, ch 3, sc in last Lg V-st, ch 3, sc in last tr, turn – 15 Fans.
Rows 8-13: Work Rows 4-7 once, then Rows 4-5 once more.
Fasten off.

Edging
With right side facing and working along row edges of Ruffle, join thread in edge of Row 1 of Ruffle, sc in same st, [ch 3, sc in edge of next tr] across to first tr of Row 13, turn to work along Row 13, ch 1, sc in first tr, (ch 2, sc) in same st, hdc between first 2 tr, *(dc, ch 1, dc) in next st, hdc in next 4 sts, sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space, hdc in next 4 sts; repeat from * across Row 13, (dc, ch 1, dc) in next st, hdc between next 2 tr, (sc, ch 2, sc) in last tr, ch 1, turn to work along row edges of Ruffle, sc in side of last tr, [ch 3, sc in edge of next tr] across Row 1 – 27 ch-3 spaces and 19 points on Fans.

FINISHING
Weave in ends. Fold Neckband to wrong of Ruffle and sew in place, leaving buttonhole end free. Sew button to other end of Neckband under Ruffle. Mist thoroughly with water and pin to stretch out pattern and eliminate gathers. Allow to dry completely. Lightly spray with starch to keep shape.
